story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Nancy (Qwynne) Lackey, and I am a graduate student at the University of Nebraska working on my Masters in Natural Resource Science with a specialization in Human Dimensions. I am currently campaigning for my research trip this summer to study ecotourism guide training in Southern Africa.  During this trip, I will be able to collect the data necessary to complete my Masters degree. Moreover,  this research trip will allow me to make a valuable contribution to natural resource conservation and community development initiatives, both of which I am extremely passionate about.

What We Need & What You Get

As a contributor you make will help fund the necessary medical and room and board requirements, such as vaccinations and program fees, to stay in the remote guide training camps. In total, those expenses add up to around $3,465 (USD), which is a difficult amount of money for a graduate student to come up with.

If I am fortunate enough to raise more than my $2,000 goal, the extra money will still be used to fund a larger portion of my program and medical fees. So, please do not be afraid to help me exceed my fundraising goal!

A small portion of your contribution (15% or less) will go towards perks for contributors. These perks will include hand written thank you letters, postcards from South Africa, photos from my trip (I am expecting to see a wide variety of African wildlife during my stay in the camps), real Belgium chocolate, and other surprise perks. This will be my way of thanking you for helping me complete a research project that is meaningful. It is also a way for me to  share my experiences with you so that you so that you will hopefully be able to understand why I am so passionate about what I have chosen to do with my studies and my career.

    The Impact

    This research trip will have a positive impact on ecotourism research and development as well as on myself as an individual. Ever since I was a child watching National Geographic documentaries in my high chair, I have been in love with wildlife and conservation. I have always known that I would spend my life pursuing a career in that field. Upon graduation, I earned a Bachelors degree in biology from Saginaw Valley State University. While doing so, I was fortunate enough to complete an internship and perform my Honors thesis research at a great white shark ecotourism operation in Gansbaai, South Africa, and I quickly became fascinated with ecotourism.

    Ecotourism is a environmentally and culturally responsible sub-sector of the tourism industry which strives to  contribute to conservation and community development initiatives.  Though my research and my first-hand experiences, I have learned that ecotourism has incredible potential to transform the attitudes and behaviors of ecotourists, conservation projects, and communities  for the better.

    However, there is significant room for ecotourism improvement and development worldwide. Previous research suggests that ecotour guides play an important role within ecotourism operations, but little research has been done on how a guide's training influences this role. 

    I have developed a  research project that will increase our understanding of ecotour guide training. My chosen research site is an established guide training program based in South Africa, and I will travel there this summer to collect my data. Through interviews, surveys, and observations of both trainers and trainees, I will develop a deeper understanding of how training impacts guides' abilities. 

    This research will be beneficial on many levels. First, it will make a valuable contribution to ecotourism literature in an area that is poorly populated. Second, the conclusions I draw can be used to improve existing and develop new guide training programs abroad and in the United States. In many areas in the US, Ecotourism has great potential yet is faced with many barriers. My research will be used to begin the conversation about helping ecotourism operations overcome some of those barriers through guide training. I am already pursuing opportunities to use my research in this fashion in the Nebraska. Third, this research will help me professionally and personally, allowing me to earn a Masters degree, gain experience that will make me a competitive candidate for PhD and career opportunities, and make a positive contribution to my lifelong passion.

      Risks & Challenges

      At this point, my main risk and challenge is funding. I have already arranged travel and stay with the guide training organization that has graciously agreed to work with me, and my research proposal has already been approved by my Masters thesis committee. However, for past research trips (including my previous one in South Africa) I have always overcome the funding obstacle through scholarships, grants, personal savings,  and if need be, student loans. Hopefully, with your help, I will not have to depend on savings and loans.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you do not have the means to contribute to my campaign financially, that's okay! You can still help me by sharing the link to my campaign with your friends, family, and coworkers, through email, Facebook, etc. This will also help me spread the word about ecotourism, guide training, and the positive impacts research such as mine can have.

story:
Thus far . . . and what's next.

   I am so excited to share this newest vision and adventure for my life with you, my friends and family and anyone else interested!  Four years ago I moved from my hometown of Pueblo, Colorado to Lawrence, Kansas.  With the simple goal to "learn about farming" I have been opened up to a whole new world and found a lovely community, because of this seemingly simple decision! It has included living and working on more farms than I have fingers to count, embarking on two bike tours, and enjoying lots of great farm fresh food with people passionate about growing plants and community through a love of the natural world.  

   I have enjoyed all the learning opportunities made available to me by folks willing to share their space and knowledge, and now this season I feel a self determined urge to create and contribute in new ways.  My initial interest in farming/gardening was in regards to my personal health and seeking to live more simply and closer to the earth.  I would like to continue this exploration in a more focused and personalized manner. I am eager to explore more and in depth, the healing attributes of both cultivated and wild plants.  The support I am seeking to turn my vision into reality will fund; a spring break trip to Burnsville, NC (near Asheville), to a project called Mountain Gardens, good quality tools, and specialty seeds.  

   Mountain Gardens is a botanical garden featuring the largest collection of native Appalachian and Chinese medicinal herbs in the Eastern US, organically grown at the foot of the Black Mountains in Western North Carolina. I plan to visit and work for a week in hopes to get an introduction to the possibilities of plants as medicine and inspiration for a new way to view my relationship to the natural world and how to live in relationship with it.  If you wish to read more here is a link to their website:  http://mountaingardensherbs.com/index.php/about/

The Break!

      A major expense for this trip is the gas required to get to North Carolina.  Scarlet, my van, will be my chariot and home.  I estimate $250 is what she will need to carry me there.  And of course I will need fuel so $50 will be used for my own travel fare.  

The Rakes!

   Good quality garden tools, I have learned, is a must.  Breaking a tool when focusing on tenderly caring for garden spaces is definitely frustrating.  I have had good experience with the Rogue brand of tools and would be ecstatic to own a few myself.  Up to $100 will go towards garden tools  http://www.roguehoe.com/  

The Plants!

   Mountain gardens has a wide selection of seeds and plants, and I would love to be able to bring some back to grow myself in the garden spaces I have access to this season (A small garden plot outside my back door, a community garden, yard space at a friend's house and fourth potential, for lower maintenance species,  at a friend's who lives a few miles out of town).  On the way back home to Lawrence I may also make a stop in Missouri at Baker Creek seed company to buy some beautiful and rare vegetable seeds.  Up to $100 will go towards plants and seeds  http://www.rareseeds.com/ 

... and crafts too!

  I also hope to be making more of the type of crafts I am offering for my perks and potentially selling them on an online store in the near future.  So any funds left over from any of the previous categories, and up to $100 if I reach my goal, will go towards tools for crafting.  


 Anything helps

  I have set my fundraising goal for flexible, which means whatever support you give will be helpful and much appreciated!  I also want to share my life visions and the natural crafts that I have been enjoying creating with anyone who has supported me thus far in home, financial, and/or friendship.

   I feel this is a small step towards a much larger chapter in my life that I cannot even comprehend fully at the moment.  I feel confident and am overwhelmed with grace and happiness in stepping forward into my talents and interests, to explore the way I wish to live and contribute to the life on this planet for myself, fellow humans, and plant and animal allies.

story: Save trees.
story_txt: Save trees.

story:
About us

We are wildlife biologists who saw a massive disconnect in the way we could reach out for real-time global support for critical needs outside our project's budget. We also knew projects all over the world were facing similar issues. Additionally, supporters of projects also want more transparency as to where their money is going, what the outcome of their support is, as well as, better ways to stay connected.

The Campaign

Did you know that we have lost over half of the world's wildlife in the last few decades? Did you know we are currently in a mass extinction event? Wildlife organizations need our help more than ever but most people don't even know where to begin to help.

This is where Key Conservation comes in.

We are providing 3 ways for wildlife organizations to get help and 3 ways for supporters to give help through our mobile app.

1. Donate Money: Funding is critical to wildlife organizations 

2. Skilled Impact: Supporters can help with their professional skills, something that might cost wildlife organizations thousands of dollars to do a professional could do for free. 

3. In-Person: Wildlife organizations can reach out to local supporters about real-time volunteer opportunities in their area through push notifications. This feature would update as you travel so you'll never miss an opportunity to help no matter where you are! 

Feedback & Updates

The best part is once a wildlife organization puts a supporter's donation or support to use they will send an update showing how it helped them. For example, the idea for Key Conservation came about when we got a call about a nest being washed out to sea. We ran out to our patrol vehicle and realized that we were about to be out of gas. Unfortunately our project was also out of money as well so we ended up using the stipend we got to buy our own food to buy gas. The whole way down to the nest all we could think about was how we knew at least 5 people that would of given us $20 to help save baby sea turtles. If Key Conservation existed then we would of taken a video of these baby sea turtles heading back out to sea so the supporter who helped make this possible could see exactly how they helped. 

Supporters earn new keys as they help new animals and habitats. Be sure to support our Indiegogo campaign to get your limited edition Key for your profile when the app goes LIVE!

We could be the generation that stops wildlife extinction in it's tracks if we work together. We still believe we can turn everything around and it's from that sheer determination that Key Conservation was born. Join us in the fight to #endendlings!

How much funding do you need and where is it going?

To build both iOS and Android versions of the app with all of the really cool features we would need to raise $105,000. To make attainable goals we have broken the app into 3 versions. Version 1 is the very minimum that we would need to get started and to goes up from there with more funding that we raise. We would love to be able to build both iOS and Android apps so we can reach as many people as possible.

The 3 different versions and their features are described in detail below:

What's the story on your perks?

We really wanted to bring you all perks that we would want ourselves.  We teamed up with independent artists and photographers who have a special connection to wildlife to bring you a selection of goodies! Be sure to keep checking back in as we might have a few more perks later in the campaign!

  • Grab a Key Conservation sticker to slap on that refillable water bottle you've been rocking. 
  • t-shirts so you can rock your support!
  • A unique Key Conservation X Pangolin pin would look dashing on any outfit.
  • Be sure to grab wildlife photos from Erik Nelson as they are limited edition and only one is available of each!
  • The Vaquita print highlights the estimated 30 individuals that left in the wild and would be an inspiration to have in your home to never give up the good fight to stop extinction! 


Where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal?

We would use the funds that we raise to start working on the development of Version 1 of the app while we try and raise the additional funds to complete it.

The Impact

We still believe, like many other people other there, that we still have time to turn the tide on wildlife extinction - but we must take a stand now. The Key Conservation app has the potential to connect supporters all over the world with wildlife conservation organizations in desperate need of funding and support. Imagine being apart of the force for good that helped make this happen! 

Risks & Challenges

We will be building something that we hope will work just as well in the field as it will from the comfort of your couch! We will be enlisting pilot projects and beta testers to make sure that everything runs smoothly when we go LIVE but there will most likely be unforeseen issues that we will have to tackle. We have a development team ready to start when we get funding who have extensive experience building apps and tackling complicated issues. 

At the beginning when we first get started the scrolling LIVE Feed will most likely be not as active as we would like but the hope is as more wildlife organizations are brought on it will become a very active feed with a lot of new posts and updates.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute to our campaign at this time that doesn't mean you can't help!

We need help spreading the word about our campaign and what we are trying to do to stop wildlife extinction! Please consider sharing the campaign with your friends and family and be sure to follow us on social media!

YOU can help stop wildlife extinction! Help us spread the word and support our campaign to build a platform that puts everyone on the front lines of conservation. #endendlings

story:
The world's paradox: The planet's richest countries in terms of natural resources suffer from extreme hunger and poverty. Imagine if farmers in underdeveloped countries could understand and explore the potential of their natural environment, and learn how to apply the principles of sustainable farming. Our goal is to give them access to hundreds of contemporary growing guides in their mother tongue, so that they can make informed decisions on choosing crops, applying diverse crop rotations, inter-cropping, cover cropping and organizing small beekeeping and livestock units. 

 

 

Who are we? 

We are a community of people who love farming and consider it as a vital part of life and modern society. 

Engineers, professors, botanists, large and small scale farmers, beekeepers and amateur gardeners all have the same vision: To share their best farming practices and experiences so as to help each other all over the world.

We believe that all farmers across the world, amateurs and professionals, have the right to have access to the best farming practices and to new ideas. 

Why did we create Wikifarmer.com? 

We are vast believers that some of the most important challenges of the world such as world hunger, climate change, invasive species and pollution can be solved by a very simple way : educating small and medium farmers on the best practices of sustainable farming. 

Where are the money going to be used? 

Underdeveloped countries are some of the richest countries in natural resources, but the poorest in terms of food. This mainly happens because farmers in those countries cannot have access to growing guides at their mother tongue. Although someone can find great online farming resources in English, an average farmer from Uganda understands only Swahili. Thus, (s)he is isolated from the rest of the world and cannot search for growing guides, funding, agricultural inputs, technical agricultural advice. 

The money raised will be used to : 

A) $30,000 to translate our site in all languages possible

B.) $30,000 (additional funding) ​to hand deliver tablets with all the growing guides pre-installed to farmers in Tanzania, Kenya, Uganda, Rwanda, Burundi, Mozambique and Congo. 

C) $30,000 (additional funding) to organize mentorship programs in underdeveloped countries. Our goal is to meet successful local producers, interview them and gain knowledge from them, which will showcase in our platform. In this way, more and more local farmers will understand the potential of their land.

D) $150,000 (additional funding) Our goal is to organize a knowledge sharing and disseminating system, similar to the one that applies in the United States (Extension Offices - Mentors and Experts - Growers Associations). Every potential farmer in an underdeveloped country will declare his/her interest in starting a new crop or livestock activity. Soon thereafter, a local mentor - expert will be responsible to face to face interview him/her, understand his/her skills and expectations and propose a complete business plan (short education program, funding, access to agricultural inputs, access to market, environment threats and opportunities). 

The Impact - We can make the world smile again

If our project succeeds, it will seamlessly lead to a solution for some of the world's biggest challenges. Imagine the self fulfillment of helping small children in Africa eat more and healthier or the joy of letting your children live in a cleaner and less polluted world. 

All this is doable and can happen, but it needs to be a team effort. Let's help new people become farmers and then we can celebrate... 

Help us make the world smile again

B.) $30,000 (additional funding) ​to hand deliver tablets with all the growing guides pre-installed to farmers in Tanzania, Kenya, Uganda, Rwanda, Burundi, Mozambique and Congo. 
C) $30,000 (additional funding) to organize mentorship programs in underdeveloped countries. Our goal is to meet successful local producers, interview them and gain knowledge from them, which will showcase in our platform. In this way, more and more local farmers will understand the potential of their land.
D) $150,000 (additional funding) Our goal is to organize a knowledge sharing and disseminating system, similar to the one that applies in the United States (Extension Offices - Mentors and Experts - Growers Associations). Every potential farmer in an underdeveloped country will declare his/her interest in starting a new crop or livestock activity. Soon thereafter, a local mentor - expert will be responsible to face to face interview him/her, understand his/her skills and expectations and propose a complete business plan (short education program, funding, access to agricultural inputs, access to market, environment threats and opportunities). 


The Impact - We can make the world smile again
If our project succeeds, it will seamlessly lead to a solution for some of the world's biggest challenges. Imagine the self fulfillment of helping small children in Africa eat more and healthier or the joy of letting your children live in a cleaner and less polluted world. 
All this is doable and can happen, but it needs to be a team effort. Let's help new people become farmers and then we can celebrate... 
Help us make the world smile again

story:
Established in 1981, the Environmental Foundation (Guarantee) Limited (EFL) is a non-profit public interest law group, whose mission is to conserve and enhance Sri Lanka’s natural environment. Over the past decade up to date, EFL has been fighting the fight to protect the Wilpattu National Park (WNP).

We are currently tackling 03 major cases within the park (elaborated below) and are in need of your support to continue our work.

The WNP is the oldest and largest National Park on the island. It was declared as a National Park in 1938 under the Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance of Sri Lanka. The adjoining Forest Reserves and Sanctuaries, containing a diverse range of habitats including forests, coastal, marine and wetlands, form a flourishing ecosystem supporting a number of fauna and flora.

A total of 284 faunal species belonging to 101 families have been recorded within the WNP, with 21 endemic and 30 nationally threatened species among them. The elephant (Elephas maximus), sloth bear (Melursus ursinus), and leopard (Panthera pardus kotiya) are some of the threatened mammals found in this protected area.

In 2013, Wilpattu was also declared as a Ramsar Wetland Cluster, which encompasses the entire park (Willu-pattu meaning 'Land of Lakes'). Some 205 water bodies, both natural and manmade, have been identified within the boundary of the park.

Located 30km west of Anuradhapura, the boundaries of the park lie in the administrative divisions of Puttalam, Anuradhapura and Mannar and spans across the North Central and North Western Provinces of the island.

Unfortunately, at present, these priceless natural resources are facing severe threats, a result of multiple anthropogenic activities. Since EFL’s first case on WNP was taken up in 2010, we have been investigating several issues relating to the WNP ranging from deforestation, encroachment to illegal projects within the park.

 

Our Cases

Illegally constructed road though the Wilpattu National Park

During the period of the civil war, when the WNP was under the control of security forces, the Sri Lankan Navy commenced the construction of two large roads running through the park to facilitate access to the North of the island. Following the end of the war, this road was illegally opened to the public as the ‘Puttalam- Mannar road’, in January 2010, completely violating the provisions of the Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance of Sri Lanka.

Challenging this illegally constructed road, which runs through a National Park, EFL instituted a case under a Fundamental Rights Application in March 2010 before the Supreme Court.

Risks & Concerns

Considering that fact that there is an existing road reaching the same destination, this road through the park has been made accessible merely for convenience, disregarding the major environmental impacts it has on the park’s rich biodiversity. As there are nearby villages, temporary ‘bus stops’ have been established along the road as well.

With the hustle and bustle of buses racing through the park and travelers getting off vehicles, the serenity of the park has been completely lost. It is rather disheartening that this has now become the norm, knowing that wildlife such as deer & elephants cross this road and quite commonly encounter such vehicles. This has not only increased the incidents of road kills but also poses significant danger to travelers too. The allowance of such prohibited activities only trivializes the National Park.

The road undoubtedly poses significant threats disrupting the natural environs, some of which include,

  • Habitat fragmentation and disturbance to the wildlife. Habitat fragmentation has been identified as a major threat affecting the survival of species of wildlife.
  • Gives rise to human-wildlife conflicts, a major issue experienced in other parts of the country.
  • Facilitates illegal activities within the park such as sand-mining, poaching and bio-piracy.
  • Necessitates annual sand-mining to fill up and repair the road after each rainy season.
  • Unmeasurable damage to the natural ecosystem of Wilpattu resulting from the blocking of the largest floodplain within the park, as well as air and sound pollution caused by constant motor traffic.
  • Traffic inevitably increases the risk of road kills of wild animals.
  • Paves the way for other ancillary issues such as encroachment.
  • Introduction of invasive alien species that can affect all types of ecosystems and lead to irretrievable loss of native species and ecosystems.

Status of the Case

During the course of this case there were several discussions and site inspections made to reach a settlement agreeable to all parties.

In 2013, the Supreme Court issued an interim order directing authorities to maintain the status quo of the road, where no further development activities would take place especially with regard to the tarring of the road. We were successful in preventing the road from being further developed into a highway.

The case is to be argued on the 8th of January 2019 before the Honorable Judges of the Supreme Court.

Through the case we seek to regulate the vehicles that use the road according to procedures applicable to the entry of visitors to any National Park.

 

The Pallekandhal Church, a jungle shrine located within the WNP

Built centuries ago, the Pallekandhal Church lies within the boundaries of the WNP. Over the years, it has been recognized as a catholic place of worship, with a small shrine placed in an area less than quarter of an acre. As far as tradition goes, an annual feast is held at the church with the attendance of nearby communities.

During the civil war, the church operated in minute scale. Devotees visited only for the feast and stayed overnight in temporary shelters next to the chapel until festivities concluded.  So, the chapel remained abandoned for most part of the year.

Once the WNP reopened post war, there has been a considerable increase in church activities and the annual festival has developed into a grand scale event, drawing more human intrusion in large numbers without proper regulation or control.  What used to be a jungle shrine has now been extensively expanded into a well-constructed church. A significant amount of forest cover has been cleared to expand the church premises while unauthorized road access to the National Park has also advanced over time.

After conducting an extensive investigation, EFL inquired into the irregularities and illegalities surrounding the Church festivities from relevant state departments but the responses received were unsatisfactory.

The forest clearings and unregulated illegal development activities inside the park have been taking place in stages over the last few years. All authorities responsible to prevent such issues have failed to carry out their duties to stop/regulate such unauthorized activities.

Due to the blatant violations made by the Church and the lack of action being taken by relevant officials to prevent such developments, EFL filed a Writ Application in the Court of Appeal on the 24th of January 2018.

Risks & Concerns

  • Clearing of forest area for camp sites and food stalls resulting in habitat fragmentation.
  • Absence of adequate waste disposal systems causing land-based and water pollution.
  • Noise pollution due to the influx of visitors, vehicles and festival activities.
  • Disturbances to animal behaviour patterns, including foraging, nesting and breeding patterns.
  • Increases the risk of human-wildlife conflict.
  • Facilitates illegal activities within the park; encroachment, poaching etc.

Status of the Case

The instigation of the case gave prominence to this issue, which in turn exerted pressure on authorities to take measures to curtail this year’s festivities of the church.

Through the case we seek to achieve the following,

  • Prevention of the intrusion of large crowds entering the park for the festivities of the church without any supervision and control by the Department of Wildlife Conservation.
  • Take legal action against those clearing the forest, erecting structures, buildings and other development activities.
  • A system with modern technology and a comprehensive database to effectively and transparently deal with demarcating the boundaries of National Parks and other Nature Reserves in order to eliminate any ambiguity of land tenement of areas declared so. 

 

Pukkulam Village bordering the WNP

Pukkulam is a seasonal fishing village located close to the Northern and Western boundaries of the WNP, and in 1973, was declared as part of the National Park. Considering the existent communities occupying this area, several lands were excluded to accommodate three seasonal fishing villages, namely Pukkulam, Vellamundalam and Pallugahathurai. As these villages lie adjacent to the boundary of the park, the agreement is such that the villages can only be occupied during the fishing seasons (November to April) under strict guidelines and restrictions. All three villages were only accessible from the seaside.

During the civil war, fishing activities were minimal as many fishermen were not permitted to enter the area due to security reasons. When the war ended, the villages at Pallugahathurai and Vellamundalam remained the same, with temporary seasonal settlements.

The fishermen from Pukkulam however, returned with their families and settled in Pukkulam permanently. At present there are approximately 153 fishing families with 450 individuals engaging in fishing activities.

When notified of this issue, EFL made inquiries from relevant authorities and conducted several site visits to address the matter. Through discussions with community members, our team discovered that the villagers residing in Pukkulam are all kin of the settlers who left during the war. Villagers use the bus service, which travels through the illegal “Puttalam – Mannar road”, to reach the Pukkulam village.

Community members also shared concerns with regard to the loss of land, a result of sea erosion. This was visible during the site visits made by our team as well. Because of this, villagers have been forced to encroach into the WNP and currently several families have settled and built permanent houses within the park premises.

This investigation is still ongoing and the findings will determine whether legal action is to follow against relevant government officials. Equally important, the case will seek adequate relief for all affected community members.

Current Status

  • There are 11 permanent structures including 9 houses, a church and an empty building.
  • Villagers have also requested for more permanent housing structures to be constructed by relevant authorities.

Risks & Concerns

  • A proper environmental assessment, which is vital in such sensitive locations, has not been done prior to relocating families in to the village.
  • According to the Fauna & Flora Protection Ordinance of Sri Lanka, approval needs to be granted by the Department of Wildlife Conservation to conduct any development activity within one mile of a National Park. In this instance, necessary approvals have not been obtained. This sets a bad precedent, encouraging other government entities/private investors to bypass following proper procedure, considering no action/penalties have been enforced so far.
  • Increased human activity in the area/within the park, will increase the risk of human wildlife conflict.
  • Habitat destruction and threat to wildlife in the area.
  • Facilitates poaching and other illegal activities within the park.

 

Why should you support this campaign?

  • The WNP provides a home for a range of endangered species that have made Sri Lanka a global biodiversity hotspot.
  • Forests provide invaluable ecosystem services to humans including, combating climate change, air purification, flood regulation and groundwater recharge.
  • The long-term revenue that can be generated by maintaining the pristine nature of the park is significantly higher than the short-term benefits that are gained from the exploitation of the park’s natural resources.

 

Why we need your help?

We are a non-profit organization working towards achieving environmental justice in Sri Lanka. The work we do here at EFL would not be possible without the help of our generous donors.

By contributing to our campaign to conserve the island’s largest National Park, you will be preserving precious ecosystems which provide vital services, protecting wildlife and the habitats of some of our rarest endemic species.

 

How we intend to use your donations

  • Legal expenses (Counsel Fees, legal documentation, litigation paperwork)
  • Preparation of site visit & scientific reports
  • Site visits
  • Advertising - To raise awareness via media such as TV and radio segments, articles published in newspapers/ magazines
  • Coordination and hosting meetings with relevant parties
  • Regular press conferences
  • Regular public lectures
  • Print media - Brochures/ Catalogues
  • Short-clip videos
  • Hoardings to be set-up in proximity to the Park

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know it’s not always easy to contribute financially, and that’s completely fine. You can still help us by just spreading the word! Reach out to people who you might think is interested in supporting our cause. You can also use the Indiegogo platform to promote this campaign with friends, family, and on social media networks. Hope this didn’t take up much of your time and a big thank you for all the support!

For more information on EFL and what we do, visit http://efl.lk/

Can’t contribute but would love to get involved? Drop us a mail at mail@efl.lk

story:
Earth Mom - A New Force of Nature

Over 30 years ago, we first recognized an image comprised of gentle winds and soft waves emerging from the depths of the Atlantic.  Since that time, we often wondered how such a beautiful vision can be harnessed for the good of everyone around the globe.

Today we debut the new Earth Mom Social Media Icon.  We offer her "Free to the World" to use as a global symbol of environmental commitment.  Most Fortune 500 companies easily understand the social value of posting their Corporate Responsibility statements online.  One day soon with your help, all businesses are going to want to have a published on-line "Eco-Policy" available for anyone to read.  To easily highlight access to these eco-policy statements, the Earth Mom icon is available totally free for any business to connect a direct link from their face page to their Eco-policy page (see example below).

Once fully adopted, you'll be able to locate the Earth Mom icon placed next to a myriad of social media icons.  You’ll instantly be able read all about the company that produces your favorite products, the steps they take to protect the environment and even access an e-mail where you can personally thank them for their efforts and provide feedback. Not seeing this icon leaves you free to question the reason for their omission and better determine if you wish to reward this company with your money or seek alternative sources.  Just knowing you as a consumer now have viable alternatives at your fingertips can immediately begin to improve questionable behavior.

Earth Mom invites you to become part of a highly effective, "Force of Nature".  We are committed to passing down a pristine blue planet to future generations by adopting a simple new way of doing business with eco-friendly companies.  We appeal equally to all races, religions, creeds, colors, ethnicities, orientations, etc.   As a member, there's a number of additional free benefits for both individuals and businesses.  You can access unlimited tips and ideas on how to help cultivate and encourage a way of life for you, your family and your business.

What We Need & What You Get

We are attempting to raise at least $45,000 through the sale of special perks to help ramp up our launch efforts. We’re well on our way with an eco-friendly on-line business directory, but need additional staff, office space, bandwidth and improvements to our mobile app to help bring you individual product friendliness. Our clothing perks in turn when used and worn by members, celebrities, our ambassadors and the media, will help us draw extra added attention to our campaign.  The first 10,000 Responders all receive special “First Responder” collector edition products. 

What else can you expect as an Earth Mom member? 

You get to be part of a growing new alliance designed to subtly change the behavior of global commerce.  Our first step promises to get a lot of attention and inspire significant changes almost overnight. We will show you how your voice can help directly influence the behavior of even the worst polluters in our own backyards and all around the world. The complete Earth Mom program offers an effective means of reducing pollution practices simply by offering to open our pocketbooks and reward eco-friendly sources. 

The Impact

Every person on Earth has a stake in how every business treats the environment.  Imagine the power we can bring to bear by asking every business owner around the world all at once, in a positive, friendly fashion, to kindly start being more attentive to the needs of the environment. Think they’ll listen?  They will if they want our business!   

As our membership grows, those businesses that provide and post the best policies, document their progress and adopt our global symbol of Eco-friendly business practice (Earth Mom Icon), can reap a substantial benefit.  Commercial members will be able to reach out to our individual members, extend special sales promotions and enjoy our continued patronage.  Once we collectively choose to buy from only the most eco-friendly businesses, soon only Eco-friendly businesses will remain. (Law of Natural Selection)

Amazingly, almost all Fortune 500 companies have already laid the groundwork for us by posting Eco-friendly policies of their own. Each is in a position to encourage the rest of the planet to ask their suppliers, subsidiaries, divisions, sister companies, and or buyers to all follow in their footsteps. We simply have to ask for their commitment in a way they can easily respect and they will gladly pass it along to others in their circle of influence.

(A normal day in Beijing China)

Consider that we tend to encourage pollution all around the world by the way we naively spend our money. Earth Mom offers a simple means of becoming much better informed in real time via internet and smart phone technologies. Soon, business entities who seek our patronage, will be eager to help us implement and police this powerful global solution on their own.

(Beijing again after a week long ban on cars and factory emissions)  

We’ve all seen what can be possible when we try.  Pollution is an obvious choice we allow.  Markets can be just as powerful as Governments if not more so.  As a global icon, Earth Mom offers the world a market solution via recognition and reward of responsible environmental  behavior.  A viable solution to pollution exists and is simply waiting for you to get on board.

Risks & Challenges

We all know the risks of allowing pollution to continue unchecked.  It doesn’t help much when a handful of countries, governments or companies fail to take the challenge seriously. Earth Mom cuts across all boundaries to provide an effective universal motivation destined to inspire better behavior from every business owner.

Who are we to ask?  We’re the very same people buying the products and services from polluting companies, which only enables questionable eco-practices to continue the cycle.  

Earth Mom has already come a long way on her own.  Our biggest challenge now is in getting additional funding, making more improvements to our site, finishing our mobile applications and attracting new members.

Where does your contribution go?

With over $150,000 in funds already invested in pre-launch activities and proving our business model, we are prepared for the next level.  A major portion of our proceeds will be directed toward marketing and new member acquisition.  For new business members, we offer substantial member benefits in the form of social media enhancements, sign packages, lead generation, product coupons, community interface, and much more.  The value of these listed benefits are well in excess of the various paid membership levels.  Our business model lends itself well to direct sales representation initially by qualified independent contractors.  We are currently pursuing several celebrity endorsements who will embrace the importance of the Earth Mom concept with their substantial Facebook and Twitter followings.   

Via word of mouth through family, friends and colleagues, we are now adding over 1,000 newsletter subscribers each week as we continue to ramp up our launch efforts.  The remaining proceeds will go directly to fund infrastructure costs which include expenses for added tech staff, perk production costs, legal and fundraising fees, and keeping the (very few) lights on.  Prior personal investment into equipment and facilities make it possible to begin shipping varoius perks immediately. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love to have your contribution, but if not, you can still be a big help. Join for free and share our campaign with all your friends and colleagues on social media. Create a free member profile page and submit your own tips and ideas for adding to our extensive Knowledge Base. There you will find more information about how you as an individual can help make a difference in your own household and throughout community.
story_txt: Earth Mom - A New Force of NatureOver 30 years ago, we first recognized an image comprised of gentle winds and soft waves emerging from the depths of the Atlantic.  Since that time, we often wondered how such a beautiful vision can be harnessed for the good of everyone around the globe.Today we debut the new Earth Mom Social Media Icon.  We offer her "Free to the World" to use as a global symbol of environmental commitment.  Most Fortune 500 companies easily understand the social value of posting their Corporate Responsibility statements online.  One day soon with your help, all businesses are going to want to have a published on-line "Eco-Policy" available for anyone to read.  To easily highlight access to these eco-policy statements, the Earth Mom icon is available totally free for any business to connect a direct link from their face page to their Eco-policy page (see example below).Once fully adopted, you'll be able to locate the Earth Mom icon placed next to a myriad of social media icons.  You’ll instantly be able read all about the company that produces your favorite products, the steps they take to protect the environment and even access an e-mail where you can personally thank them for their efforts and provide feedback. Not seeing this icon leaves you free to question the reason for their omission and better determine if you wish to reward this company with your money or seek alternative sources.  Just knowing you as a consumer now have viable alternatives at your fingertips can immediately begin to improve questionable behavior.Earth Mom invites you to become part of a highly effective, "Force of Nature".  We are committed to passing down a pristine blue planet to future generations by adopting a simple new way of doing business with eco-friendly companies.  We appeal equally to all races, religions, creeds, colors, ethnicities, orientations, etc.   As a member, there's a number of additional free benefits for both individuals and businesses.  You can access unlimited tips and ideas on how to help cultivate and encourage a way of life for you, your family and your business.What We Need & What You GetWe are attempting to raise at least $45,000 through the sale of special perks to help ramp up our launch efforts. We’re well on our way with an eco-friendly on-line business directory, but need additional staff, office space, bandwidth and improvements to our mobile app to help bring you individual product friendliness. Our clothing perks in turn when used and worn by members, celebrities, our ambassadors and the media, will help us draw extra added attention to our campaign.  The first 10,000 Responders all receive special “First Responder” collector edition products. What else can you expect as an Earth Mom member? You get to be part of a growing new alliance designed to subtly change the behavior of global commerce.  Our first step promises to get a lot of attention and inspire significant changes almost overnight. We will show you how your voice can help directly influence the behavior of even the worst polluters in our own backyards and all around the world. The complete Earth Mom program offers an effective means of reducing pollution practices simply by offering to open our pocketbooks and reward eco-friendly sources. The ImpactEvery person on Earth has a stake in how every business treats the environment.  Imagine the power we can bring to bear by asking every business owner around the world all at once, in a positive, friendly fashion, to kindly start being more attentive to the needs of the environment. Think they’ll listen?  They will if they want our business!   As our membership grows, those businesses that provide and post the best policies, document their progress and adopt our global symbol of Eco-friendly business practice (Earth Mom Icon), can reap a substantial benefit.  Commercial members will be able to reach out to our individual members, extend special sales promotions and enjoy our continued patronage.  Once we collectively choose to buy from only the most eco-friendly businesses, soon only Eco-friendly businesses will remain. (Law of Natural Selection)Amazingly, almost all Fortune 500 companies have already laid the groundwork for us by posting Eco-friendly policies of their own. Each is in a position to encourage the rest of the planet to ask their suppliers, subsidiaries, divisions, sister companies, and or buyers to all follow in their footsteps. We simply have to ask for their commitment in a way they can easily respect and they will gladly pass it along to others in their circle of influence.(A normal day in Beijing China)Consider that we tend to encourage pollution all around the world by the way we naively spend our money. Earth Mom offers a simple means of becoming much better informed in real time via internet and smart phone technologies. Soon, business entities who seek our patronage, will be eager to help us implement and police this powerful global solution on their own.(Beijing again after a week long ban on cars and factory emissions)  We’ve all seen what can be possible when we try.  Pollution is an obvious choice we allow.  Markets can be just as powerful as Governments if not more so.  As a global icon, Earth Mom offers the world a market solution via recognition and reward of responsible environmental  behavior.  A viable solution to pollution exists and is simply waiting for you to get on board.Risks & ChallengesWe all know the risks of allowing pollution to continue unchecked.  It doesn’t help much when a handful of countries, governments or companies fail to take the challenge seriously. Earth Mom cuts across all boundaries to provide an effective universal motivation destined to inspire better behavior from every business owner.Who are we to ask?  We’re the very same people buying the products and services from polluting companies, which only enables questionable eco-practices to continue the cycle.  Earth Mom has already come a long way on her own.  Our biggest challenge now is in getting additional funding, making more improvements to our site, finishing our mobile applications and attracting new members.Where does your contribution go?With over $150,000 in funds already invested in pre-launch activities and proving our business model, we are prepared for the next level.  A major portion of our proceeds will be directed toward marketing and new member acquisition.  For new business members, we offer substantial member benefits in the form of social media enhancements, sign packages, lead generation, product coupons, community interface, and much more.  The value of these listed benefits are well in excess of the various paid membership levels.  Our business model lends itself well to direct sales representation initially by qualified independent contractors.  We are currently pursuing several celebrity endorsements who will embrace the importance of the Earth Mom concept with their substantial Facebook and Twitter followings.   Via word of mouth through family, friends and colleagues, we are now adding over 1,000 newsletter subscribers each week as we continue to ramp up our launch efforts.  The remaining proceeds will go directly to fund infrastructure costs which include expenses for added tech staff, perk production costs, legal and fundraising fees, and keeping the (very few) lights on.  Prior personal investment into equipment and facilities make it possible to begin shipping varoius perks immediately. Other Ways You Can HelpWe would love to have your contribution, but if not, you can still be a big help. Join for free and share our campaign with all your friends and colleagues on social media. Create a free member profile page and submit your own tips and ideas for adding to our extensive Knowledge Base. There you will find more information about how you as an individual can help make a difference in your own household and throughout community.

story:
My story

     My name is Megan Baumgarten. My journey stated five years ago, when my body began rejecting processed foods. Once I cut out fast food, soda, most sugar, and switched to organic food I stopped experiencing the symptoms!  It is my goal to give other people the same opportunities to have access to locally grown, organic food so they can live the best version of their lives. The amount of cancer, food allergies, cognitive, reproductive,  digestive and skin issues in humans  and animals has never in history occurred at the level they are now. Everyone on this Earth has the right to organic food and to live disease and cancer free. Barfoot Acres Sanctuary will be an environment for children, adults, and animals to thrive happily.

 

Why Regenerative Organic Agriculture?

According to Regeneration International, an organization at the forefront of saving the world:

"The loss of the world’s fertile soil and biodiversity, along with the loss of indigenous seeds and knowledge, pose a mortal threat to our future survival. According to soil scientists, at current rates of soil destruction (i.e. decarbonization, erosion, desertification, chemical pollution), within 50 years we will not only suffer serious damage to public health due to a qualitatively degraded food supply characterized by diminished nutrition and loss of important trace minerals, but we will literally no longer have enough arable topsoil to feed ourselves. Without protecting and regenerating the soil on our four billion acres of cultivated farmland, 14 billion acres of pasture and rangeland, and 10 billion acres of forest land, it will be impossible to feed the world, keep global warming below 2 degrees Celsius, or halt the loss of biodiversity."
 

Why we are starting the farm:

 

IMPROVE FARMING:  Improve yields using permaculture- a whole systems approach, Expand to hire employees and provide fair-trade living wages. Improve local economy by keeping money local. Create drought resistant plants and soil by adding compost. 

FOOD INSECURITY: Improve vitamin and mineral nutritional content of produce. Utilizing every square foot of pastured acreage with fruit orchards, vegetable gardens, culinary and medicinal herbs, and wildflower flower fields means we will be able to contribute an incredible amount of food to society. I also want to work harder to provide organic food to schools, battered women's shelters, and homeless shelters.

CARBON LIMIT: Reverse climate change by absorbing carbon pollution from the atmosphere by adding carbon rich compost to the soil. Not using heavy machinery. Supplying locally means not requiring long distance refrigerated transport of our produce. No processing and excessive packaging. We will only use recycled materials for packaging.

INCREASE BIODIVERSITY:  Perennial hedgerows provide shelter for beneficial insects. Farming near forested land means a major increase in predator habitat and decrease in pest problems. Bees and other pollinators are the first to be poisoned by pesiticde usage. Heavy pesticide and poison usage in large farms move up the food chain and bio accumulate in predators. For example: a farmer has a rat problem in his 1,000 acres of corn so he/she sets out poison. After the rat is poisoned, it will run away and die, where it will be eaten by a predator. Now the predator has ingested the poison. The more poisoned rats it eats, the more poison it bioaccumulates, similar to what is happening to humans.

I want myself, the team, and the farm to become role models for domestic and international  organizations aiming to reform modern agriculture and ensure a future for humanity. The primary approach for farm operations will be from the research and positive results on regenerative agriculture done by Singing Frogs Farm in California, Polyface Farms in Virginia, the Rodale Institute in Pennsylvania, Regeneration International, and The Gerson Institute.

 

 

 

What we have done:

I am a steward of this Earth, and have devoted my life in the pursuit of bettering the world in one form or another. Over many years I acquired many different skill sets like construction, plumbing, irrigation, landscape architecture, and learning how to work on a diesel engine that will benefit Barefoot Acres. Since my first container garden in the U.S. Virgin Islands in 2011, I have expanded to larger areas of responsibility every year. Between 2012 and 2013, I started with a small plot on a homestead in Michigan that aimed to provide food for the household. In 2014, I had a large potted garden in North Carolina because of a serious invasive fire ant problem in the ground. In 2015, I bought my first potted fruit trees and removed 75 square feet of spider plant for the vegetable garden. During that year, I started an edible landscaping business called Barefoot Organics where I showed people living in inner city homes with minimal land how to maximize their food production. Instead of watering grass during the California drought or species of drought tolerant cactus and succulents that still require water, I installed raised bed vegetable gardens on drip irrigation that uses anywhere from 30-70% less water depending on the yard's features. I have encouraged, empowered, and enabled many people and families to build gardens in their small backyards in an effort to ensure larger access to organic food. This year, in 2016, I relocated and expanded the business to Los Angeles to become a part of urban agriculture. I built four 12x4’ raised beds in the extra long driveway for almost 200 square feet of added growing space, on top of what is in the ground. Along the perimeter of the house, I removed every plant and shrub that was not edible, and replaced them with fruit, vegetable, and species.

California passed a bill in 2014 that allows for the formation of urban agriculture zones, but the city itself must create the ordinance (AB 551).  I petitioned and spoke in front of the Gardena City Council to establish an urban agriculture zone ordinance that would give property tax breaks to private vacant land owners within city limits they allow it to be used for agricultural purposes. The Chief of Police encouraged the idea as well. However, it is apparent it will take upwards of a decade or more of the precious time this Earth has on political red tape. That time is better spent taking action now to improve the environment on a larger scale. In 2017, my destiny is to expand into a full scale regenerative farm in Oregon. We can continue to expand every year, rebuild, and protect our sacred earth, water, and air. It is our responsibility.

 

What we are growing now in a small Los Angeles backyard:

Imagine how much food we could grow on ACRES!

 

What We Need:

 

Barefoot Acres Sanctuary needs funding to begin operations. Upon reaching this goal, it would go mostly to the purchase of the land, and the remaining balance towards equipments and materials. If we could surpass our set goal, it will help us to be more successful in the long run.

The capital raised during this Indiegogo campaign will be kept in a separate bank account dedicated to Barefoot Acres Sanctuary. Every investor will receive frequent updates and a report on how the money is being spent.

 

What you get:

The perks! I read a book by Marcel Mauss called The Gift, and I am a firm believer in his theory that the exchanging of objects between groups builds relationships between humans. Your involvement in the creating of this farm is life changing to not only River and myself, but to every person we have the opportunity to help from now on. To show my appreciation for your love and generosity, there are a variety of perks available as my way of saying thank you for your involvement. Items such as hand crafted gifts made from items on the property, Barefoot Acres Sanctuary t-shirt, a special stepping stone with your name on it all the way to naming the animals, and a B&B farm stay!

 

The Impact

Receiving funding will enable us to establish the farm quicker and devote more time to making a larger community impact. We will also be able to volunteer more time dedicated to building and establishing school garden programs with interactive curriculums. Eventually we will be able to host domestic and international farmers with like minded mentalities to explore implementing new sustainable methods for modern agriculture.

In 2011, Congress actually ruled that pizza in school lunch programs DOES satisfy the vegetable food group requirement. Pizza and french fries are not part of the vegetable food group…   
A tomato... and a potato... are vegetables!

The four main goals for Barefoot Acres are:

1. Healthy People: I aim to foster physical and emotional well being with everyone who is involved with our farm. Our produce will not aggravate disease and cancer, but instead help to treat or cure it. I also strive to become a domestic and international education facility for people and organization striving to make a change in their farming environment.

2. Healthy Food: By increasing the  mineral content of the soil every year with compost, it will increase the currently diminished nutrient content of produce. Barefoot Acres will grow nutrient-dense and organic fruit, vegetables, herbs, raw honey, flowers, nuts, eggs and exotic fruit to increase the availability of organic produce." Organic is the fastest growing sector of the U.S. food industry. Organic food sales increase by double digits annually, far outstripping the growth rate for the overall food market. Now, an unprecedented and conclusive study links economic health to organic agriculture." - Organic Trade Association

3. Healthy Planet: We will regenerate soil bacteria life, absorb carbon pollution from the atmosphere, increase the predator-prey and pollinator species biodiversity, use no pesticides of any kind, and have zero toxic run-off into the water supplies and oceans.

4. Healthy Community:  I intend to have a large community outreach by organizing and implementing organic school gardens and educational programs. This will give children a chance to be empowered when it comes to their health and wellness. I would also like to maximize the inclusion of the surrounding community by working closely with police, fire, EMS, and military to help provide the organic substance necessary to keep us safe. 


Risks & Challenges

There will always be risks and challenges in any adventure. Successful growing techniques can be adapted- most often by trial and error. However the traits that are inherent in a successful farmer are passion, dedication, unconditional love and the drive to never let the farm fail. Most of the people reading this know me personally, but some do not. These are some truths that I live by: 

Always go the extra mile.
Foster good will within business.
Be true to your word.

By contributing to this campaign, I realize that you are putting your trust in me to make a change in this flawed world. Barefoot Acres Sanctuary will be a living experiment and model of how modern agriculture can be improved to feed the world organically, and sustainably.

To be economically sustainable we will be a working farm that sells what is grown. There are many options to sell our produce from the farm via CSA (Community Supported Agriculture), local farmer's markets, restaurants, and/or local super markets. Many of which I have already made contact with to share this Indiegogo campaign!

The three year goal of Barefoot Acres Sanctuary is:

a. To become a working and established farm
b. Have an established permaculture-based vegetable gardens and matured fruit and nut orchard
c. Expand community relations with local businesses in Portland
d. Establishing school gardens and host field trips in the local schools
e. Be communicating and sharing scientific results with international organizations working towards implementing a global solution to making modern agriculture regenerative and sustainable.
f. Become a teaching facility for domestic and international farmers

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand not everyone is able to contribute financially to this campaign, and that is perfectly alright. :)  There are other ways you can help bring us to success!

  1. At the top of the page, use the 'share' links. Facebook, Tweet, and the link. Using those links specifically triggers website algorithms that could get this campaign promoted!
  2. Heavy traffic flow to this Indiegogo page (especially on opening day!) definitely triggers the website algorithms and bump our campaign to become 'actively promoted' by Indiegogo.
  3. Tell your family and friends about our mission, refer them to the Indiegogo page and to our website for more information. www.barefootacressanctuary.com
  4. Share the wonderful YouTube video made by my friend Cody Gless on your social media accounts!

 

Thank you in advance for your time and contributions to this campaign for change! 

Megan Baumgarten
Owner/Chief Operator
Barefoot Acres Sanctuary
www.barefootacressanctuary.com

story:
The majority of children from communities that surround the Rhodes Matopos National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in southern Zimbabwe, have never been inside the Park and yet they live within 10km of its boundary. This is because of their inability to afford transport to and drives through the Park, as well as park entry fees. We would like to organise a trip for the children from surrounding schools to the national park. Apart from getting to see the biodiversity in the Park, the children will also have the opportunity to network and share ideas on natural resources with the children from the other communities. This will create a basis for conservation collaborations in the future. We are in need of US$1500 to provide them with transport to and through the park, to cover park entry fees for the pupils and vehicles and to provide meals during the trip.

We are a small non-profit conservation and research organisation who are entirely dependant on donor funding. Since 2012, we have been running Biodiversity Conservation Clubs in 5 rural schools of communities that border the Matopos National Park in Zimbabwe. The children are highly motivated in their learning and have collected wonderful and meaningful environmental information to date, which we use to troubleshoot the environmental degradation that these areas are facing. However, the fact that the children have never seen a protected area causes a gap within our programme in that we teach the children about biodiversity using their environmentally degraded environs (in the communal areas) as the demonstration field. Ideally, they should learn from a protected area such as Matopos National Park which has a standard ecostystem so that they use it as a reference to the kind of environment they aim to achieve in their conservation activities. Our organisation is currently hard-pressed with finances as we are barely able to cover the cost of supporting our activities of running the conservation clubs.

Your contribution to this cause will help us in training these children environmental issues, with the aiming of producing environmental stewards. This will consequently contribute to conservation of the environment in Zimbabwe.

entry fees. We would like to organise a trip for the children from surrounding schools
to the national park. Apart from getting to see the biodiversity in the Park,
the children will also have the opportunity to network and share ideas on natural resources with the
children from the other communities. This will create a basis for conservation
collaborations in the future. We are in need of US$1500 to provide them with transport
to and through the park, to cover park entry fees for the pupils and vehicles and to provide meals during the trip. 
We are a small non-profit
conservation and research organisation who are entirely dependant on donor
funding. Since 2012, we have been running Biodiversity Conservation Clubs in 5
rural schools of communities that border the Matopos National Park in Zimbabwe.
The children are highly motivated in their learning and have collected
wonderful and meaningful environmental information to date, which we use
to troubleshoot the environmental degradation that these areas are facing.
However, the fact that the children have never seen a protected area causes a gap
within our programme in that we teach the children about biodiversity using
their environmentally degraded environs (in the communal areas) as the
demonstration field. Ideally, they should learn from a protected area such as Matopos
National Park which has a standard ecostystem so that they use it as a
reference to the kind of environment they aim to achieve in their conservation
activities. Our organisation is currently hard-pressed with finances as we are
barely able to cover the cost of supporting our activities of running the
conservation clubs.
Your contribution to this cause will help us in training these children environmental issues, with the aiming of producing environmental stewards. This will consequently contribute to conservation of the environment in Zimbabwe.

story:
BAJAR PARA LEER CAMPAÑA EN ESPAÑOL

The reason why we are conducting this campaign is to take actions now in favor of the conservation of the Humboldt penguin (Spheniscus humboldti),, which is a currently protected species, yet still in a vulnerable condition, and the rest of the seabirds that live around.

The increase in property market of the Central coast of Chile has led several changes jeopardizing the biodiversity of the area, which is now also affecting the Humboldt Penguin, species that used to nest in a protected islet called “Islote Pájaro Niño” where the population of this seabird has decreased a 70% in the last 15 years.


The artificial breakwater built by the private Chilean nautical association, “Cofradía Naútica del Pacífico Sur”, has produced many negative effects on the ecosystem including the invasion of exotic species such as rodents that cross to the island through this bridge eating the eggs of the birds that make their nest there. Beside this, it has been reported seabirds slaughter and nest destruction caused by people who feel bothered by seabirds.


The goal of this campaign is to create a seasonal record of the species in order to measure their evolution, work with and train the local people in the identification and explanation of the seabirds and their conservation, and the importance for the local and global ecosystem, information that will be transmitted next to the large number of tourists that Algarrobo city receives every season.


We believe that the conservation of the species and their habitat is a shared responsibility, it is our mission to give the correct tools to make aware and educate about the importance of keeping alive our biodiversity. We want to invite you all to become part of this challenge; your cooperation will help us assure to reach our goals.

WHAT WE NEED WHAT YOU GET!

  • We need your support and activism to accomplish this project; we need you to spread the news and to share with your friend, relatives, co-workers and co-mates.
  • To accomplish our mission, we need to collect $15,000 dollars in order to implement and organize the current work for the Humboldt Penguins conservation.
  • If you cannot grant money, you can grant us time supporting us spreading the campaign.
                               HELP US AVOID THIS FRIGHTENING REALITY

              


SUPPORTING US WE CAN GET:

1. - Film a documentary to show the complete process of the Project that can help as educational material to free Access to the community.

2. - Conduct a seasonal survey during the year to measure the Humboldt Penguin evolution (Spheniscus humboldti) and also to identify seabirds’ species.


3. - Make training activities for local people having as purpose learn about the identification of species and the importance of the local and global ecosystem.


4. - Train environmental rangers to talk about environmental care particularly about the Humboldt penguin (Spheniscus humboldti) to the large number of tourists in Algarrobo beaches.


5. - Create a plan to expand the current IBA site to the Peña Blanca Islet, place where important species make their nests and a large number of individuals can be found.


Take part of our Project and you can get interesting rewards and protect the Humboldt Penguin (Spheniscus humboldti) life expectancy.


Project supported by:







Breve reseña

La razón por la cual estamos llevando a cabo esta campaña es para realizar acciones concretas de conservación que vayan en beneficio del Pingüino de Humboldt (Spheniscus humboldti), especie protegida y que actualmente se encuentra en estado de vulnerabilidad .

El auge inmobiliario en el litoral central de Chile ha acarreado una serie de trastornos que pone en peligro la biodiversidad del lugar, afectando con fuerza a especies como el Pingüino de Humboldt, especie que nidifica en la zona protegida Isla Pájaro Niño y cuya población ha disminuido en un 70% en los últimos 15 años.


El rompeolas artificial construido por la Cofradía Náutica del Pacifico Sur de carácter privado, a generado una serie de trastornos en el ecosistema, entre los que se cuenta la como roedores que logran ingresar a la isla por este puente, depredando los huevos de las especies que ahí anidan. Por otro lado existen reportes de matanzas de aves marinas y destrucción de sus nidos por personas que ven en estas especies una molestia.


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

  • Necesitamos tu apoyo y activismo para poder llevar a cabo este proyecto, necesitamos que le comentes y lo compartas con tus amigas y amigos, familiares, colegas, y cercanos. Si no puedes apoyar con dinero, apoyanos difundiendo esta  campaña. 
  • Para lograr nuestro trabajo necesitamos 15.000 dolares y así  poder ejecutar y sistematizar el trabajo realizado en la preservación de los Pinguinos de Humboldt.

               AYUDANOS A EVITAR ESTA REALIDAD

          

                                     


CON TU APOYO PODREMOS REALIZAR:


1.- Un documental que refleje el proceso total del proyecto y sirva como un material educativo de libre uso.

2.- Censos estacionales durante un año, para medir la evolución del Pingüino de Humboldt (Spheniscus humboldti) y la identificación de especies de aves.

3.- Realizar capacitaciones a la comunidad local para la identificación de especies y la importancia para el ecosistema local y global.

4.- Formar cuidadores ambientales que transmitirán la importancia del cuidado medio ambiental y en especial del Pingüino de Humboldt (Spheniscus humboldti) a la gran cantidad de turistas que llega cada verano a las playas de Algarrobo.

5.- Generar linea base para extender el actual sitio IBA al islote Peña Blanca, el cual es un sitio de nidificación de especies importantes y presenta una alta cantidad de individuos.

Con tu aporte podrás obtener interesantes recompensas y proteger la proyección de vida del Pingüino de Humboldt (Spheniscus humboldti) 

Este proyecto cuenta con el apoyo de:

story:
Accès Fleuve / Comité ZIP Ville-Marie

Accès Fleuve / Comité ZIP Ville-Marie est un organisme de bienfaisance qui a pour mission de redonner le fleuve Saint-Laurent aux citoyens. Nos objectifs sont de promouvoir la conservation et la restauration des écosystèmes, redonner l'accès au fleuve et à ses tributaires et favoriser la pérennité des écosystèmes et des accès.

===
Accès Fleuve / Comité ZIP Ville-Marie is a charitable organization with a mission to give the Saint-Laurent river back to the citizens. Our objectives are to promote the conservation and restoration of ecosystems, restoring access to the river and its tributaries and promote the sustainability of ecosystems and access.

Le projet - The project

La rivière Saint-Jacques est l'une des dernière rivières naturelles du grand Montréal et de nombreux milieux humides lui sont connexes. C'est pourquoi nous avons mis sur pied le projet d'aménagement d'une frayère.

Le projet est largement financé par le Programme Interactions communautaires d'Environnement Canada et la Fondation de la Faune du Québec, en plus de la Fondation TD des amis de l'environnement et de la Fondation RBC Eau bleue. Cependant, il nous faudrait environ 25 000 $ pour compléter le montage financier.

Tous ceux qui contribueront au projet deviendront membres à vie de l'organisme et recevront un reçu pour fins d'impôts pour le plein montant de leur don. L'ensemble des fonds recueillis iront à la réalisation de ce projet et serviront à acheter du matériel de stabilisation des sols et des végétaux à planter. Plusieurs personnes préfèrent donner directement via la page de notre site internet.

===

The Saint-Jacques river is one of the last natural rivers int the greater Montreal and many wetlands are adjoined to it. That is why we have developed the spawning grounds project.

This project is largely funded by the Community Interaction program of Environment Canada and the Québec Wildlife Foundation, along with the TD Friends of the Environment Foundation and the RBC Blue Water project. However, we would need about 25 000 $ to complete the project.

All those who contribute to the project will become lifetime members of the organization and receive a tax receipt for the full amount of their donation. All the funds raised will go toward this project and will be used to purchase soil stabilization equipment and plants to put in the ground. Many people donate directly via our website's project page.

Bénéfices environnementaux - Environmental benefits

Le projet permettra de créer un ruisseau de 460 mètres linéaires et 230 m² d'habitats riverains qui permettront la fraie du poisson, l'augmentation de la biodiversité et l'établissement d'espèces vulnérables telles la Tortue géographique (Graptemys geographica).

===

The project will create a stream of 460 lin. meter and 230 sq. meters of riparian habitat that will allow fish spawning, increased biodiversity and the establichment of vulnerable species such as the Northern Map Turtle (Graptemys geographica).

Risques environnementaux - Environemental Risks

Les secteurs à proximité ont été colonisés par le Roseau commun (Phragmites australis), une espèce exotique envahissante particulièrement agressive dans les milieux humides. Afin de contrer son avancée, des techniques ont été développées par le Groupe Phragmites de l'Université Laval et nous entendons les mettre en oeuvre. Une partie des fonds récoltés iront exclusivement à cette fin.

===

Nearby area were colonized by the Common reed (Phragmites australis), a invasive exotic species particularly aggressive in wetlands. To counter its progress, various techniques have been developed by the Phragmites group of Université Laval and we intend to implement them. Part of the raised funds will be used exclusively to that end.

D'autres façons d'aider - Other ways to help

Si vous désirez contribuer par votre expertise professionnelle ou en tant que bénévole lors des plantations, nous avons besoin de vous, alors n'hésitez pas à nous contacter.

===

If you would like to contribute to the project via your professional expertise ou as a volunteer during the planting, we need your help, so feel free to contact us.
