story:
Kurzbeschreibung des Climate Sail to Paris zur Weltklimakonferenz

Wir sind auf dem Weg zur Weltklimakonferenz in Paris, um dort für den schnellen und konsequenten Umstieg auf erneuerbare Energien zu protestieren. Unser Team hat sich am 3. Oktober in Hamburg auf den Weg gemacht mit der Botschaft: RENEW Climate Sail to Paris #COP21.  Wir fordern den sofortigen Umstieg auf erneuerbare Energien und das Ende der Subventionen für die Ausbeutung fossiler Energiequellen. Diese ca. 400 Millionen Dollar pro Jahr sollen besser in den Ausbau erneuerbarer Energien gesteckt werden. Unsere Politiker müssen dieses Mal erfolgreich sein. Sie dürfen nicht wieder scheitern. Die Welt braucht gemeinsame Klimaziele, und nie sah es dafür so gut aus wie dieses Jahr. Es gilt also Druck zu machen, dass diese Forderungen unser Bürgerwille sind. Das machen wir und nehmen schon jetzt viele 100 Botschaften mit auf unsere Tour.

Unsere Unterstützer bei der Abfahrt am 3.Okt.

Aldebaran in Hannover mit Video-Show

Schon viele 100 Unterstützer

Hier fahren wir entlang

Unsere coolen Segel-Outfits könnt ihr auch kaufen oder direkt bestellen bei www.bms.tv

Auf unserer zweimonatigen Tour halten wir in jeder größeren Stadt, diskutieren, informieren und hören zu. Menschen unterstützen unsere Forderungen, indem sie Bilder mit RENEW auf unsere Facebook Seite hochladen https://www.facebook.com/meeresstiftung oder durch ihr eigenes Bild unseren RENEW-Film zu ihrer eigenen Botschaft machen.http://www.meeresstiftung.de/climate-sail/. 

Immer öfter kommen neue Aktivisten an Bord, Schulklassen, Bürgermeister, Journalisten. Es ist eine Tour, die uns beflügelt, dass wir auf dem richtigen Weg sind und dass die Bevölkerung in Deutschland genau das Gleiche will. Auch wenn eine Einigung in Paris vielleicht schwierig erscheint. Es braucht Aktionen wie unsere, um den Politikern vor Ort den Rücken zu stärken jetzt konsequente Entscheidungen zu treffen…. Auch die Presse ist begeistert davon. Täglich wird über die Aktion berichtet z.B. hier:


Aber wir brauchen Geld für unsere Tour: Schleusen kosten Geld, Sprit, Verpflegung, Kommunikation, Hafengebühren und auch ein wenig Kommunikationsbudget werden von der Deutschen Meeresstiftung gebraucht. Um dieses Projekt zu stemmen brauchen wir die Unterstützung vieler Menschen. Helft uns mit einer kleinen oder großen Spende oder erwerbt eines unserer coolen Produkte, die es nirgendwo zu kaufen gibt nur hier. Auch damit würdet ihr uns unterstützen. Dann kommen wir nicht nur ans Ziel sondern auch noch darüber hinaus. Wer sich engagieren will ist bei uns eingeladen. Ihr könnt uns besuchen kommen, ihr könnt mitfahren (falls ihr Segelerfahrung habt und mindestens eine Woche Zeit), ihr könnt unsere tollen Segel-Outfits kaufen oder ihr könnt uns an den Stationen helfen, wo wir noch ankommen werden, um möglichst viel Öffentlichkeit zu erreichen. Über 70% der Bevölkerung in Europa erachtet Klimaschutz als ein wichtiges Thema. Hier und heute könnt ihr ganz konkret etwas tun, damit wir uns für den Klimaschutz einsetzen.

Wir: Das ist die neu gegründete Deutsche Meeresstiftung in Hamburg. Wir haben uns gerade als gemeinnützige Stiftung gegründet und sind quasi an unserem Gründungstag losgefahren mit dem gecharterten Forschungs- und Medienschiff, der www.aldebaran.org 

Mit unserem Team unterwegs sind unsere Stifter und Skipper wie Frank Schweikert und Svenja Angernendt, Kommunikationsfachleute wie Sofian Salam oder Kai Pohlmann und viele andere. Besucht werden wir von Klimaexperten und Meereswissenschaftlern wie Prof. Dr. Graßl. 

Was Du uns gibst & was Du bekommst

  • Wir benötigen ca. 5000 Euro, um unsere Tour etwas professioneller durchführen zu können. Wir brauchen nicht nur Sprit, Schleusen-Gebühren, Verpflegung für unser Team, Liegegebühren und ein wenig Marketing-Budget sondern auch Geld, um vor Ort gute Pressearbeit leisten zu können, um unsere Materialien auf Französisch zu übersetzen (da fahren wir ja hin) und um einen Skipper für die Rückfahrt zu finanzieren.
  • Wer uns unterstütz kann viel bewirken, da alle Mitglieder der Meeresstiftung kostenlos auf dem Projekt arbeiten. Aber auch für Euch kann es toll werden: Ihr bekommt diesen individualisierten Film mit Eurem Konterfei https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v7Iq8gmG8nU. Ihr könnt die Outfits unseres Segel-Ausstatters kaufen und uns damit unterstützen, oder ihr bucht eine Tour mit unserem Schiff der ALDEBARAN und wir fahren Euch und Eure Freunde für 500 Euro ein wenig durch die Gegend, wenn wir vor Ort sind.
  • Euer Geld geht direkt an die Deutsche Meeresstiftung und wird ausschließlich zur Finanzierung dieser Tour verwendet, denn unsere Mittel hierfür sind echt knapp.

  • Was bewirkst du mit Deiner Unterstützung des Climate Sails

Wir fahren auf jeden Fall nach Paris und weder die Strömung des Rheins, noch das miese Wetter werden uns aufhalten. Aber wir würden gerne mehr Pressearbeit machen können und einen Skipper anheuern, um auch den Rückweg zur Messe BOOT in Düsseldorf zu bewerkstelligen. Dort planen wir eine große Ausstellung und einen Film als Dokumentation über unsere Tour. Helft uns, den Climate Sail zum Erfolg zu treiben die Forderung nach erneuerbaren Energien groß und kräftig werden zu lassen.

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Natürlich kann unsere ALDEBARAN auch auf dieser langen Tour von 2 Monaten beschädigt werden, was den Climatesail gefährden könnte. Wir haben fast 100 Schleusen zu überwinden (und wieder zurück). Wir müssen gegen starke Strömung ankämpfen, und wir müssen unser Team motiviert halten, das bei doofen Temperaturen und quasi ohne Bezahlung sich die Flüsse und Kanäle empor kämpft. Aber mit Eurer Hilfe werden wir das schaffen.  

  • Alle Hürden wurden bisher überwunden, selbst eine ausgefallene Heizung konnte repariert werden. 
  • Das Schiff ist bereits seit 25 Jahren unterwegs. Die leichte Aluminium-Bauweise und der flache Tiefgang von nur 80cm hilft uns auch die kleinen Flüsse hinauf zu kommen.
  • Wir schaffen das.

Wie ihr uns auch helfen könnt

Liebe Unterstützer. Geld ist hilfreich. Aber Euer Wille, den Klimawandel nicht einfach hinzunehmen ist unsere Motiviation ist unser Lebenselexir. Gebt uns Rückendeckung. Ladet Eure Fotos mit Eurer individuellen RENEW-Botschaft auf unserer Facebook-Seite hoch: https://www.facebook.com/meeresstiftung

Nehmt ein Foto von Euch und ladet es hier hoch. Dann entsteht automatisch Eure ganz eigene Video-Botschaft für 100% erneuerbare Energien. Die könnt ihr dann beliebig teilen, mailen, facebooken. Wir benutzen diese Filme nicht. Es sind Eure Filme. http://www.meeresstiftung.de/renew-movie/ 

Herzlichen Dank für Eure Unterstützung
story_txt:
Kurzbeschreibung des Climate Sail to Paris zur Weltklimakonferenz 

Wir sind auf dem Weg zur Weltklimakonferenz in Paris, um dort für den schnellen und konsequenten Umstieg auf erneuerbare Energien zu protestieren. Unser Team hat sich am 3. Oktober in Hamburg auf den Weg gemacht mit der Botschaft: RENEW Climate Sail to Paris #COP21.  Wir fordern den sofortigen Umstieg auf erneuerbare Energien und das Ende der Subventionen für die Ausbeutung fossiler Energiequellen. Diese ca. 400 Millionen Dollar pro Jahr sollen besser in den Ausbau erneuerbarer Energien gesteckt werden. Unsere Politiker müssen dieses Mal erfolgreich sein. Sie dürfen nicht wieder scheitern. Die Welt braucht gemeinsame Klimaziele, und nie sah es dafür so gut aus wie dieses Jahr. Es gilt also Druck zu machen, dass diese Forderungen unser Bürgerwille sind. Das machen wir und nehmen schon jetzt viele 100 Botschaften mit auf unsere Tour.


Unsere Unterstützer bei der Abfahrt am 3.Okt.Aldebaran in Hannover mit Video-Show
Schon viele 100 Unterstützer
Hier fahren wir entlang
Unsere coolen Segel-Outfits könnt ihr auch kaufen oder direkt bestellen bei www.bms.tv



Auf unserer zweimonatigen Tour halten wir in jeder größeren Stadt, diskutieren, informieren und hören zu. Menschen unterstützen unsere Forderungen, indem sie Bilder mit RENEW auf unsere Facebook Seite hochladen https://www.facebook.com/meeresstiftung oder durch ihr eigenes Bild unseren RENEW-Film zu ihrer eigenen Botschaft machen.http://www.meeresstiftung.de/climate-sail/. 


Immer öfter kommen neue Aktivisten an Bord, Schulklassen, Bürgermeister, Journalisten. Es ist eine Tour, die uns beflügelt, dass wir auf dem richtigen Weg sind und dass die Bevölkerung in Deutschland genau das Gleiche will. Auch wenn eine Einigung in Paris vielleicht schwierig erscheint. Es braucht Aktionen wie unsere, um den Politikern vor Ort den Rücken zu stärken jetzt konsequente Entscheidungen zu treffen…. Auch die Presse ist begeistert davon. Täglich wird über die Aktion berichtet z.B. hier:



Aber wir brauchen Geld für unsere Tour: Schleusen kosten Geld, Sprit, Verpflegung, Kommunikation, Hafengebühren und auch ein wenig Kommunikationsbudget werden von der Deutschen Meeresstiftung gebraucht. Um dieses Projekt zu stemmen brauchen wir die Unterstützung vieler Menschen. Helft uns mit einer kleinen oder großen Spende oder erwerbt eines unserer coolen Produkte, die es nirgendwo zu kaufen gibt nur hier. Auch damit würdet ihr uns unterstützen. Dann kommen wir nicht nur ans Ziel sondern auch noch darüber hinaus. Wer sich engagieren will ist bei uns eingeladen. Ihr könnt uns besuchen kommen, ihr könnt mitfahren (falls ihr Segelerfahrung habt und mindestens eine Woche Zeit), ihr könnt unsere tollen Segel-Outfits kaufen oder ihr könnt uns an den Stationen helfen, wo wir noch ankommen werden, um möglichst viel Öffentlichkeit zu erreichen. Über 70% der Bevölkerung in Europa erachtet Klimaschutz als ein wichtiges Thema. Hier und heute könnt ihr ganz konkret etwas tun, damit wir uns für den Klimaschutz einsetzen.
Wir: Das ist die neu gegründete Deutsche Meeresstiftung in Hamburg. Wir haben uns gerade als gemeinnützige Stiftung gegründet und sind quasi an unserem Gründungstag losgefahren mit dem gecharterten Forschungs- und Medienschiff, der www.aldebaran.org 
Mit unserem Team unterwegs sind unsere Stifter und Skipper wie Frank Schweikert und Svenja Angernendt, Kommunikationsfachleute wie Sofian Salam oder Kai Pohlmann und viele andere. Besucht werden wir von Klimaexperten und Meereswissenschaftlern wie Prof. Dr. Graßl. Was Du uns gibst & was Du bekommst




Wir benötigen ca. 5000 Euro, um unsere Tour etwas professioneller durchführen zu können. Wir brauchen nicht nur Sprit, Schleusen-Gebühren, Verpflegung für unser Team, Liegegebühren und ein wenig Marketing-Budget sondern auch Geld, um vor Ort gute Pressearbeit leisten zu können, um unsere Materialien auf Französisch zu übersetzen (da fahren wir ja hin) und um einen Skipper für die Rückfahrt zu finanzieren.
 Wer uns unterstütz kann viel bewirken, da alle Mitglieder der Meeresstiftung kostenlos auf dem Projekt arbeiten. Aber auch für Euch kann es toll werden: Ihr bekommt diesen individualisierten Film mit Eurem Konterfei https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v7Iq8gmG8nU. Ihr könnt die Outfits unseres Segel-Ausstatters kaufen und uns damit unterstützen, oder ihr bucht eine Tour mit unserem Schiff der ALDEBARAN und wir fahren Euch und Eure Freunde für 500 Euro ein wenig durch die Gegend, wenn wir vor Ort sind.
Euer Geld geht direkt an die Deutsche Meeresstiftung und wird ausschließlich zur Finanzierung dieser Tour verwendet, denn unsere Mittel hierfür sind echt knapp.

Was bewirkst du mit Deiner Unterstützung des Climate Sails




Wir fahren auf jeden Fall nach Paris und weder die Strömung des Rheins, noch das miese Wetter werden uns aufhalten. Aber wir würden gerne mehr Pressearbeit machen können und einen Skipper anheuern, um auch den Rückweg zur Messe BOOT in Düsseldorf zu bewerkstelligen. Dort planen wir eine große Ausstellung und einen Film als Dokumentation über unsere Tour. Helft uns, den Climate Sail zum Erfolg zu treiben die Forderung nach erneuerbaren Energien groß und kräftig werden zu lassen. 


  Risiken & Herausforderungen  Natürlich kann unsere ALDEBARAN auch auf dieser langen Tour von 2 Monaten beschädigt werden, was den Climatesail gefährden könnte. Wir haben fast 100 Schleusen zu überwinden (und wieder zurück). Wir müssen gegen starke Strömung ankämpfen, und wir müssen unser Team motiviert halten, das bei doofen Temperaturen und quasi ohne Bezahlung sich die Flüsse und Kanäle empor kämpft. Aber mit Eurer Hilfe werden wir das schaffen.    
Alle Hürden wurden bisher überwunden, selbst eine ausgefallene Heizung konnte repariert werden. 

Das Schiff ist bereits seit 25 Jahren unterwegs. Die leichte Aluminium-Bauweise und der flache Tiefgang von nur 80cm hilft uns auch die kleinen Flüsse hinauf zu kommen.
Wir schaffen das.    Wie ihr uns auch helfen könnt Liebe Unterstützer. Geld ist hilfreich. Aber Euer Wille, den Klimawandel nicht einfach hinzunehmen ist unsere Motiviation ist unser Lebenselexir. Gebt uns Rückendeckung. Ladet Eure Fotos mit Eurer individuellen RENEW-Botschaft auf unserer Facebook-Seite hoch: https://www.facebook.com/meeresstiftung
Nehmt ein Foto von Euch und ladet es hier hoch. Dann entsteht automatisch Eure ganz eigene Video-Botschaft für 100% erneuerbare Energien. Die könnt ihr dann beliebig teilen, mailen, facebooken. Wir benutzen diese Filme nicht. Es sind Eure Filme. http://www.meeresstiftung.de/renew-movie/ Herzlichen Dank für Eure Unterstützung

story:
Beekeepers need a healthier environment for bees!

Beekeepers, consumers, environmentalists, food advocates, and everyone who enjoys fruits, nuts, vegetables, and seeds are organizing a Keep the Hives Alive Tour across the country to raise awareness about the plight of pollinators, honey bees, monarch butterflies, native bees, and reduced crop yields.

Keep The Hives Alive Bee Tour

The Tour will occur right before and during National Pollinator Week.  We aim to educate the general public with an accurate portrayal of the impact bee-toxic chemicals have had on the livelihoods of American beekeepers. We will travel across the United States, holding rallies and events to raise awareness about pollinator decline, and urge action on bee-toxic pesticides to safe guard our food supply.

Be a champion for bees and beekeepers! Donate to the tour to help beekeepers urge the government to protect beekeepers, honey bees, butterflies, birds, and native pollinators.


Donate to the Tour

By donating to the Tour, you will be a champion for bees and beekeepers!  Encourage members of your community, and anyone who values pollinators and their contribution to crop yields and sustainable agriculture, to support the Keep the Hives Alive Tour.  We need our bees! If you have a vested interest in a healthy future of food and the environment your donation to the tour will help Keep the Hives Alive.

Every donation counts! Your donation will support all aspects of the tour including promotional materials,  and event support at each tour stop (signs, sound system, filming the tour, creating informational videos, and much more.).  You will make the Keep the Hives Alive Tour possible!  Bees and Beekeepers need your generous support.  By donating to the Tour, your name will be featured as a "Tour Groupie" on the webpage as a Champion for Bees and Beekeepers! 

Once you donate please make sure to follow the updates, and get involved. 




Join the Tour and Spread the Word . . .

We are planning the Tour  June 7th through June 22nd, 2016.  See the Tour Schedule here as it develops.



Be a Part of the Tour

Write an op-ed for your local news outlet  . . . Learn more here

Are you a beekeeper? Send us your bee loss story . . . Learn more here

Invite others to attend events . . . Learn more here

Can’t attend an event? We still need your help with the tour!  . . . Learn more here


Be A Champion for Bees and Beekeepers

We want beekeepers, consumers, food advocates, environmental advocates, and anyone who cares about the future of our food supply, and our planet, to attend the tour stops across the country before and during National Pollinator Week.


The Struggle to Keep Bees Alive

.The goal of our tour is to  educate the public of the dangers of bee-toxic pesticides; share the stories of beekeepers whose livelihoods have been jeopardized (and some lost) by the continued use of these products;  and urge our EPA to take action to protect the health of pollinators and protect them from bee toxic pesticides.


We are a group of beekeepers, consumers, and environmental and food advocacy organizations, demanding strong action be taken to regulate and restrict the use of bee-toxic pesticides that harm pollinators and the environment.

story:
Planet Earth has limited resources. Fossil Fuels will eventually run out. Nuclear Energy creates 1000's of lbs of toxic waste every year polluting the environment. The people in first world countries have limited financial resources and are feeling the squeeze when it comes to paying for living costs. Then there are people on this planet that still have no access to electricity. All of this needs to change! The Earth is reaching its limit! 

At E-Ventus Energy we believe we have found the solution. We have designed a device that generates power using air. It collects air as it flows and uses it to create power using a new innovative patented turbine system. We are using indiegogo to raise funds to complete our final prototype and obtain licensing to sell our units all over the world. Please read on and learn about what our goals and visions are and how you can help us achieve them.

The LiveAir Turbine

LiveAir is 4ft tall, 3ft wide, emits low level noise,  zero emissions, and is mobile which means when you move, it moves! It can also be transported to different locations in response to catastrophic situations like, wars, flooding, earthquakes etc. The LiveAir Turbine collects air from the roof of your home using small air vents which feed into the turbine that sits indoors or outdoors creating a consistent flow of energy.

The LiveAir model can be calibrated to generate electricity at consistent multiple kilowatt levels. With most UK households using an average 12 kw per day the LiveAir Turbine can be customised to meet the needs of homes and businesses of all sizes. The LiveAir Turbine will reduce or eliminate your electricity bills meaning you can become completely electricity Independent, it will also generate surplus energy which will feed directly to the grid, which means our customers make money! See how our 5kWph system will save you money below)

Compared to Fossil Fuels and Nuclear Energy Plants that historically produce large quantities of toxic waste, harm the environment, use up vital limited resources and are a risk to the land, wildlife and the people that work and reside nearby; our initial studies suggest that to produce similar high levels of energy our technology will;

* Occupy a small fraction of space within urban areas.

* Produce zero waste

* Will be Zero CO2 

*Will create the same amount of energy. 

With all of the capabilities of a power plant either spread out in individual homes or condensed within a single urban wind farm within a warehouse, or office setting. It's a no brainer! 

PERKS!

We're grateful to everyone who has helped so far! If you donate £25 you get an Earth, Ltd Edition Car Bumper Sticker. If you donate £75 you get a Sticker and T-Shirt Bundle!  

Pledge £1200 and you get a sticker, t-shirt and a personal Thank You video from one of the founders. You will also become a member of our Priority Club and receive first dibs on the first run of LiveAir units before they hit the market. And finally, pledge £5000 and you get the very first editions of our LiveAir units! 

Sales Model:

Customers who house our units will also benefit from a share in the revenues generated from the surplus energy sales to other premises.

Here's how it works; 

Purchase Price: £6000 (£4800 for Indiegogo LiveAir Pkg donators) 

Electricity Bill: £0 (Average UK Electricity bill £80 per month) YOU SAVE: £4800* 

Surplus Energy Sales: 

The Average Customer will get a 10% return. (£3625) Cutting your total electricity bill by 50%

Indiegogo LiveAir Pkg donators will get a 13% return. (£4800) Cutting your total electricity bill by 100%

*All figures are based on a 5 year term and are based upon an average UK household using 12kws per day with a 5kWph LiveAir Turbine installed. 

**LiveAir units are guaranteed for 5 years but have a life expectancy of 20 years. 

Charity Work:

Did you know that there are over 3 Billion people all over the world who have no access or partial access to electricity? 

Did you know that it's 2016 and 3.6 Billion is a ridiculous number of people who don't have basics like heat and light? 

Did you know that there are hundreds of thousands of people struggling to pay their electricity bills? 

E-Ventus are committed to having a positive impact on the global community by providing our units to charities to help bring power to towns and villages still in the dark. We are also committed to working with social housing groups and community projects and clubs to help reduce and eliminate energy costs, this will be cost neutral through surplus energy sales. 

But first we need your help. We are seeking funds to complete our prototype so that we can begin final market production to make our vision a reality and help people all over the world become Energy Self Reliant. 

How your funds will be put to good use:

We are about to begin accreditation in the UK which will enable our customers to qualify for government feed in tariffs. This accreditation is recognised in the majority of developed countries which will enable us to produce, distribute and install our products all over the world. The funds that you donate will help us to finalise our prototype so that the LiveAir unit will be ready to market within the next 6 months. 

The Team

E-Ventus Energy is made up of John Connolly, Paul Baker and John Spencer. 

John Connolly has enjoyed a successful career as a professor of Business and has worked as a consultant for fortune 500 companies. 

John Spencer is an innovator, inventor and problem solver with a career in mining, machinery, construction and engineering. 

Paul Baker has a long history working for some of the largest brands in the world creating business and marketing strategies and developing new concepts and designs and bringing them to market. 

Please feel free to ask any questions you might have, we are happy to answer them.

Thank you for taking the time to read through our information. We hope that you will join us in our vision and will help us to reach our goals. If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! Please spread the word about our campaign and share it with your friends or anyone else you can think of! 

Thank you! 

Follow us on Twitter @eventusenergy

story:
eumelia community, help us go off grid

 

we miss our global eumelia community and over the past months it has become even more evident what our physical & mental connection with you means to us. eumelia was started by me, Frangiskos, more than 17 years ago and joined by Marilena 7 years ago and now our two little boys. It was always intended to be part of the dialogue of what we want this world to be. Always with a vision but always pragmatic, taking small or big steps along the way. Creating an organic farm with a regenerative foundation using biodynamic & permaculture tools. Hotel facilities to receive guests, sharing our love for sustainable and organic food, farm to table gastronomy, olive oil and natural wines. Every step we made was always committed to protecting the environment using technologies such as geothermal heating, natural waste management system, solar water heating, using natural cleaning material, natural bedding material, recycling, zero food waste and composting. But always at the center stage was our holy exchange of ideas, of sharing food, protecting the environment and creating human links with a vision for a future worth being proud leaving to our children.

 

what we will do

 

we are now taking one of our biggest steps to protect our planet, become more sustainable and to safeguard eumelia's viability by raising solar panels, a renewable source of energy production to create the electricity we need to continue with our vision. We cannot do this without you, the truth is what we have accomplished so far is because of our strong vision and determination but most of all because of you, our guests, friends, supporters and volunteers from around the world. You are our community and we turn to you for support, to create and implement our off the grid effort. Off the grid for us means that eumelia's viability and the vision behind her is protected from rising prices, grid instability, government and private interventions. This will alleviate one of our biggest uncertainties and help secure eumelia's role and vision in a complex and ever changing world.

 

 

how we will protect the planet

 

as the energy production mixture in Greece is heavily dependent on fossil fuels, we want to produce our own renewable energy . We do not want our energy consumption to contribute to the creation of more CO2 for the planet. Here is what your contributions will save the planet:

 

 

  • 10 euro/usd = 9 kg CO2/per year - 180 kg CO2/20 years
  • 20 euro/usd = 18 kg CO2/per year - 360 kg CO2/20 years
  • 50 euro/usd = 45 kg CO2/per year - 900 kg CO2/20 years
  • 100 euro/usd = 90 kg CO2/per year - 1.8 tons CO2/20 years
  • 350 euro/usd = 315 kg CO2/per year - 6.3 tons CO2/20 years
  • 500 euro/usd = 450 kg CO2/per year - 9 tons CO2/20 years
  • 750 euro/usd = 675 kg CO2/per year - 13.5 tons CO2/20 years
  • 1200 euro/usd = 1080 kg CO2/per year - 21.6 tons CO2/20 years
  • 2500 euro/usd = 2250 kg CO2/per year - 45 tons CO2/20 years
  • 5000 euro/usd = 4500 kg CO2/per year - 90 tons CO2/20 years

 

the perks for your contribution

 

the purpose of the perks is to have the opportunity to share eumelia with you and to meet you in person or online so we can thank you for your support.  Take an online tour of eumelia, have an online olive oil tasting or online cooking class, stay at our regenerative farm and enjoy activities or even get the help you need to create your dream sustainable project. Thank you, thank you!  Next stop energy independence!

 

the technology needed to create eumelia's solar off grid system

 

eumelia consumes about 45.000kWh of electrical energy annually.

Electricity is mainly used for domestic appliances, geothermal heating, and water pumps.

A 25kW off grid Solar System will produce around 43.000kWh. By applying further power saving measures the Solar System will cover all annual needs.

Solar System’s major components are listed below:

  1. Solar Panel, 250w Solar Panel - 80 pcs
  2. Inverter, 25kw Off grid Solar Inverter - 1 set
  3. PV Combiner Box - 1 pc
  4. Charger Controller, MPPT /PWM - 1 pc
  5. Battery, Lead Acid/Gel - 16 units
  6. Solar Mounting Structure, Roof/Ground Install (Customized) - 1 set
  7. PV Cable + Connectors - 1 set

 

 

Other ways to support our effort

 

  • Spread the word about our campaign
  • Share on social media
  • Join our social media and share with others - instagram - facebook - twitter
  • Send email to friends sharing the campaign
  • Visit our website for more information on www.eumelia.com
  • Visit our online store and purchase organic products at www.eumeliashop.com
story_txt:
eumelia community, help us go off grid
 
we miss our global eumelia community and over the past months it has become even more evident what our physical & mental connection with you means to us. eumelia was started by me, Frangiskos, more than 17 years ago and joined by Marilena 7 years ago and now our two little boys. It was always intended to be part of the dialogue of what we want this world to be. Always with a vision but always pragmatic, taking small or big steps along the way. Creating an organic farm with a regenerative foundation using biodynamic & permaculture tools. Hotel facilities to receive guests, sharing our love for sustainable and organic food, farm to table gastronomy, olive oil and natural wines. Every step we made was always committed to protecting the environment using technologies such as geothermal heating, natural waste management system, solar water heating, using natural cleaning material, natural bedding material, recycling, zero food waste and composting. But always at the center stage was our holy exchange of ideas, of sharing food, protecting the environment and creating human links with a vision for a future worth being proud leaving to our children.
 
what we will do
 
we are now taking one of our biggest steps to protect our planet, become more sustainable and to safeguard eumelia's viability by raising solar panels, a renewable source of energy production to create the electricity we need to continue with our vision. We cannot do this without you, the truth is what we have accomplished so far is because of our strong vision and determination but most of all because of you, our guests, friends, supporters and volunteers from around the world. You are our community and we turn to you for support, to create and implement our off the grid effort. Off the grid for us means that eumelia's viability and the vision behind her is protected from rising prices, grid instability, government and private interventions. This will alleviate one of our biggest uncertainties and help secure eumelia's role and vision in a complex and ever changing world.
 

 
how we will protect the planet
 
as the energy production mixture in Greece is heavily dependent on fossil fuels, we want to produce our own renewable energy . We do not want our energy consumption to contribute to the creation of more CO2 for the planet. Here is what your contributions will save the planet:
 

 

10 euro/usd = 9 kg CO2/per year - 180 kg CO2/20 years
20 euro/usd = 18 kg CO2/per year - 360 kg CO2/20 years
50 euro/usd = 45 kg CO2/per year - 900 kg CO2/20 years
100 euro/usd = 90 kg CO2/per year - 1.8 tons CO2/20 years
350 euro/usd = 315 kg CO2/per year - 6.3 tons CO2/20 years
500 euro/usd = 450 kg CO2/per year - 9 tons CO2/20 years
750 euro/usd = 675 kg CO2/per year - 13.5 tons CO2/20 years
1200 euro/usd = 1080 kg CO2/per year - 21.6 tons CO2/20 years
2500 euro/usd = 2250 kg CO2/per year - 45 tons CO2/20 years
5000 euro/usd = 4500 kg CO2/per year - 90 tons CO2/20 years

 
the perks for your contribution
 
the purpose of the perks is to have the opportunity to share eumelia with you and to meet you in person or online so we can thank you for your support.  Take an online tour of eumelia, have an online olive oil tasting or online cooking class, stay at our regenerative farm and enjoy activities or even get the help you need to create your dream sustainable project. Thank you, thank you!  Next stop energy independence!
 
the technology needed to create eumelia's solar off grid system
 
eumelia consumes about 45.000kWh of electrical energy annually.
Electricity is mainly used for domestic appliances, geothermal heating, and water pumps.
A 25kW off grid Solar System will produce around 43.000kWh. By applying further power saving measures the Solar System will cover all annual needs.
Solar System’s major components are listed below:

Solar Panel, 250w Solar Panel - 80 pcs
Inverter, 25kw Off grid Solar Inverter - 1 set
PV Combiner Box - 1 pc
Charger Controller, MPPT /PWM - 1 pc
Battery, Lead Acid/Gel - 16 units
Solar Mounting Structure, Roof/Ground Install (Customized) - 1 set
PV Cable + Connectors - 1 set

 


 

Other ways to support our effort
 

Spread the word about our campaign
Share on social media
Join our social media and share with others - instagram - facebook - twitter

Send email to friends sharing the campaign
Visit our website for more information on www.eumelia.com

Visit our online store and purchase organic products at www.eumeliashop.com

story:
WHAT HAPPENED TO CORAL REEFS?

Since 2016, the hot water in Australia has been leading to massive coral bleaching, killing off approximately half of the Great Barrier Reef - the world’s largest and most extensive reef system. The heat and acidity are heavily damaging and widely spreading throughout the oceans, with devastating effects across the planet. We need to take immediate action to restore the marine ecosystem before it’s too late! 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET?

  • We will need a total of 10,000 USD to prototype 6 x "reef pod" designs and after that, we will deploy over 25 individual ‘pods’ throughout 2019.
  • Donation starts from 10 USD, you will receive a variety of gifts, including a chance to win 3 nights in a Private Pool Villa at the award-winning Song Saa Private Island www.songsaa.com donated by Song Saa Private Island 

 

WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS?

  • PRESERVING BIODIVERSITY

The global loss of coral reefs threatens to wipe out various ecologically and commercially important species. Artificial reefs can help combat this loss by providing the habitat and feeding grounds that many reef-dependent species need to survive, which will help to preserve an area’s biodiversity.

  • INCREASING FISH STOCKS

By providing a safe refuge for juvenile fish to settle, artificial reefs can enhance fish populations, which in turn benefits local fishing communities by ensuring an ongoing source of food and income.

  • PROVIDING HABITAT COMPLEXITY

Various reef creatures rely on good habitat complexity (tunnels, holes, overhangs, caves) to escape predators. Artificial reefs can be designed to increase the habitat complexity of an area that may have been degraded by intense storms or destructive fishing practices, thus providing much-needed habitat for the survival of these reef species.

HOW DO DONATIONS HELP?

Creating artificial reefs is not as simple as throwing some wooden, metal or concrete structures in the water. Care needs to be taken to ensure that the design, materials, construction, and placement of the artificial reef does not negatively impact surrounding natural habitats. As such, we are prototyping 6 different 'reef pod’ designs to find the ones that work best in our beloved marine reserve. Having achieved this, we will then deploy 25+ individual ‘pods’ throughout 2019. Donations received will directly support our scientific investigation, in addition to funding the creation and installation of our first 25 reef pods. You will be actively involved in making the coral reefs in our Song Saa Marine Reserve healthier and more biodiverse.

story:
Short Summary

What is the one thing that connects all of us? Not just all humans, or even all animals, but all living entities. Our Earth is home to nearly 8 billion people and 8.7 millions different species of animals and plants. We are only given one earth. One environment for all creatures, to move, eat, sleep, live. However, in recent years many environments have been stripped away, due to humanity’s own self destruction. 

As filmmakers it is our job to highlight and document the stories of those who cannot speak on their own such as those who are being taken from their homes or who have had their homes taken from them. Such is the case of our crew for Feral, and the 150 feral horses facing possible extinction on Cumberland Island. 

Cumberland Island is designated as a National seashore and wilderness according to the National Park Services. With this designation comes many benefits yet some disadvantages for other animals. 150 Feral Horses are designated as “wild animals” in the park, leaving them to fend for themselves with out any aid from any organization.

Organizations have proposed ethical means to let the population of horses die out.  This in reference to making the entire population infertile and letting them die out over time.    

The Conflict

The horses are too heavy for wetland marshes and have a multitude of other habitats that degrade both themselves and the habitat.  The horses sink into the soft dirt, mud, or sand getting stuck and starving to death.  As well, the horses destroy massive amounts of vegetation in areas they frequent; destroying other habitat for other animals.  Though the most affected animals by Feral Horses are that of Sea Turtles which trample their nests.  Organizations such as Wild Cumberland wish to educate people about the suffering and destructiveness of the Feral Horses on Cumberland Island.  Their stance is to remove the Horses ethically through the use of contraception or vasectomy of the entire horse population.  

The National Park Services and that of Local tourism’s stance is to currently keep the horses on the island as it is a way of supporting an influx of visitors to the Island. Though who has the choice to allow them to die out on their own or become infertile?

An animal is currently struggling in an environment that it is not adapted for. Often getting stuck in and sinking into the Earth; starving to death or being victimized by predators like that of Alligators. The Feral Horses on Cumberland Island are not being maintained by the NPS. An effect of this is that female mare horses tend to procreate at a much younger age than they should. More likely than not, it leads to malnutrition for the horses.   As a result of the non-native species other animals are struggling as well. The biggest case of all is that of Sea Turtles. Having their nests trampled by the large mammal on the sandy beaches.  

Our Goal

Our goal is for this documentary to reach domestic markets for television, theatrical, and commercial release.  We would ultimately like this film to stretch and reach potential environmental companies and activists. With their support and distribution, we can further our message on a larger platform. We plan on submitting to film festivals around the United States and environmental-oriented film festivals around the world. From here, we plan to seek distribution from entities that support regenerative agriculture and environmental change. Additionally, we are open to the documentary’s use as an educational tool for schools, colleges, and universities across the United States. 

We will be submitting this documentary to film festivals in the short form documentary category. We will be targeting environmental film festivals, Georgia based festivals, and student festivals. Some of the festivals we plan on submitting to include: 

Ag & Art Film Festival

American Conservation Film Festival

Atlanta Docufest

Big Sky Documentary Film Festival

Colorado Environmental Film Festival

Dayton Independent Film Festival 

Environmental Film & Screenplay Festival

Green Screen Environmental Film Festival (T&T)

Lookout Wild Film Festival

North Dakota Environmental Rights Film Festival

SCAD Savannah Film Festival

Wild and Scenic Environmental Film Festival 

In An Ideal World

This would bring about conversation about what can be done for the feral horses of Cumberland Island and create an emotional connection with our audience.  It would also spark change in how the National Park Services designates the animal, reduce the struggling of the horses and get them the care that they need.      

This documentary’s timing and release is critically important. The point of this documentary is to outline the current situation of 150 feral horses facing possible extinction on Cumberland Island at the hands of the National Park Service. An animal is currently struggling in an environment that it is not adapted for. Often getting stuck in and sinking into the Earth; starving to death or being victimized by predators like that of Alligators. With your support, we can help bring awareness to these poor creatures.

story:
Beekeeping University

  • My Name is Nicholas Olsen,  I'm raising funds to create an online school for beekeepers. I'm currently a beekeeping instructor teaching Beginning to advanced Beekeeping Classes. I start my class by asking how many have watched videos online but are still confused, 100% of hands are raised. The reality of the beginning beekeeper is that they have to spend as much as $150.00 for a Class, purchase equipment for another $500.00 and then buy Bees for $125.00 totaling  $725.00 and most are still confused and have more questions. I aim to change all of that with a simplified, fun and educational experience that they will enjoy and go on to be beekeepers for years to come. 
  •      Over the past couple of years I have seen the cost of beekeeping classes sky rocket, some charging $150.00 to as much as $650.00 for classes. Approximatley 30% of my students have taken a class before and are still confused and have a ton of questions. Our online classes will walk the students through a easy interactive course which they will always be able to reference to. Via web or smart phone while in the field.

With your contribution, We will be able to teach everyone the art of beekeeping at a minimal cost. Free 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our team will use the funds to create an interactive Educational portal. We estimate it will take one year to complete. The project will involve development of the app, the website, research, collaboration with beekeeping experts from around the world, filming,  and purchase of educational beekeeping equipment. We will take newbees on a journey through the seasons of beekeeping and give experienced beekeepers a portal to explore new solutions.
  • We are so excited about our perks, We have everything from life time contributing membership to site, cool logo Beekeeping University t-shirts, sweatshirts, a complete langstroth beehive delivered to your door.(No Bees), you can even adopt-a-hive which will be used in training, and corporate adopt-a-hive sponsors will be able to use marketing material to let the world know they are doing their part. put it on your facebook add it to your marketing.

Making It Affordable For Everyone

Our team has had hours of debate on what will we charge. We want to make it affordable to everyone, but it also needs to be self sustainable. We are commited to keeping the costs down and will conduct a poll at a later date. But I will throw this out, we are thinking around $19.99 for individuals, Free for students grade 5 -  grade 12, and a discount for associations.

Bees need our help

It's true the bees need our help, but the reality is we need more beekeepers:

  • A world without bees is a world without fruits and vegetables.
  • with over 250 successful beekeeping students Nicholas's main goal is to teach beekeepers excellent beekeeping practices.
  • We believe our goal of education is the answer.

We Need Your Help...

We understand not everyone can help, BUT YOU CAN...

  • Help us spread the word.
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • PLEASE...always buy your honey from a beekeeper, your supporting his/her passion, hobby, lively hood and the world!

Thank you for helping us save the bees, beekeeper and maybe starting a NEWBEE!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sanjeev Uprety, born and raised in Nepal.  I am an Orthopedic Surgeon, and an expert in Health Informatics.  I have enormous experience treating patients in Nepal.  I currently reside in the United States but wish to return to Nepal to aid the survivors of this catastrophe.


Nepal suffered a deadly earthquake and  many of us lost our loved ones.
Sadly, many more will die if they do not receive medical treatment, especially traumatic care.  We need food , access to electricity,  water, shelter, and supplies.  I  have another friend that is also a doctor, but he needs supplies to continue treating the wounded.


I am Nepalese, I speak the language, I know the customs of my people and can get the job done. Please help me to help the Nepali people.


What We Need & What You Get

If you help us with a donation, you can rest assured that 100% of the funds will be used for providing aid to people in distress in Nepal.  The raised funds will absolutely ONLY be used for providing aid, never for overhead.  The $4000 I am trying to raise would be a great start, but I would ultimately love to have an entire team of physicians to oversee the relief efforts.  By one estimation, tents are needed for half a million people.

The money would be used for:

  1. Travel expenses
  2. Medical Supplies
  3. Tents for temporary housing
  4. Water and access to electricity for treatment
  5. Food

The Impact

 Your kindness will make the world a better place.  It may sound cliche, but it is true.  

Risks & Challenges

The only challenge is a lack of funds.  I have the ability to treat the wounded, and coordinate relief efforts in every way.  We just need your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this and other legitimate campaigns for aid to Nepal through Facebook, Twitter, any social media or e-mail.   Part of the reason I am launching this initiative is to make sure that 100% of the money makes it to those it is intended for.

story:
My journey will make a monumental and measurable difference to animals and our world.  With your support and contributions, I will bring a louder voice to the awareness of habitat loss which will bring an end to the extinction of many important animals. While Africa may seem thousands of miles away to some, habitat loss is a vital issue that has consequences that stretch farther than any single continent.

Later this year I will travel to Africa to work as a field guide. This amazing opportunity will bring credible awareness to issues many are unaware of regarding the plight of animals. In the case of the lion, the King of Animals is on a path to become extinct in the next 15 to 20 years! Due to habitat loss, lions now occupy only 20%  of their former range in Africa. A population once exceeding half-a-million in the 1950s, has dwindled below 25,000 today.  

When you become a member of our Roar for Change Pride, you will receive an up-close-and-personal experience into the beauty of Africa's animals and the vibrant cultures the nation has to offer. By joining our Pride you will gain valuable knowledge regarding habitat loss and human wildlife conflict so we can begin to build a stronger voice to help the animals of our world. I whole-heartedly believe we can peacefully coexist with animals and the world around us.

 

When you back me, your generous support will assist my enrollment in EcoTraining (http://www.ecotraining.co.za/), a program designed to produce the highest talent of field guides in the world. With your backing and the backing of this respected and world-renowned program, I will change the world! Thank you for supporting my dream in a powerful and generous manner.

Are you ready to Roar for Change?

(www.roarforchange.com)

 

Today you have the opportunity to back a passionate global 20-year-old leader who is devoted to change the world. Please share this campaign to make an impactful and immediate difference.

In the journey to end the plight of animals throughout Africa, there are no black and white issues, but instead many gray areas. Our core goal of Roar for Change is to create a world in which we peacefully coexist with animals and the world around us. With this commitment, I searched to find artwork that personifies our goal, work that represents the colors of so many majestic animals together into something remarkably beautiful. Artwork that brings bright, passionate and vivid colors to those once gray areas.

In so, I discovered Yang Africa. (http://yangafrica.bigcartel.com/) The artist Amanda Weatherlake has a rare and gifted talent to capture the heart, personality and wonder of Africa's majestic animals. By contributing at a higher level, you will receive one of these stunning and impactful prints below.

In an exclusive partnership with Yang Africa, Roar for Change also commissioned an original print representing the lovable, but misunderstood hyena. Stay tuned in the coming weeks for the unveiling of a perception-changing masterpiece!

 

 

 

Please check out our other exciting perks on the right hand side of the page!

Thank you for supporting my dream in a powerful and generous manner.Are you ready to Roar for Change?(www.roarforchange.com) Today you have the opportunity to back a passionate global 20-year-old leader who is devoted to change the world. Please share this campaign to make an impactful and immediate difference.In the journey to end the plight of animals throughout Africa, there are no black and white issues, but instead many gray areas. Our core goal of Roar for Change is to create a world in which we peacefully coexist with animals and the world around us. With this commitment, I searched to find artwork that personifies our goal, work that represents the colors of so many majestic animals together into something remarkably beautiful. Artwork that brings bright, passionate and vivid colors to those once gray areas.In so, I discovered Yang Africa. (http://yangafrica.bigcartel.com/) The artist Amanda Weatherlake has a rare and gifted talent to capture the heart, personality and wonder of Africa's majestic animals. By contributing at a higher level, you will receive one of these stunning and impactful prints below.In an exclusive partnership with Yang Africa, Roar for Change also commissioned an original print representing the lovable, but misunderstood hyena. Stay tuned in the coming weeks for the unveiling of a perception-changing masterpiece!   Please check out our other exciting perks on the right hand side of the page!

story:
We can’t thank you enough for spending some time learning about the Compo Cup® and changing the way we make single-serve coffee.


K-Cups® are everywhere and the waste is too

Single Serve Coffee machines - you've heard of them, right? Keurig® may come to mind.  If you drink coffee or tea, you may own one or use one at work.  Convenient, fast, a hot cup every time, less wasted coffee, all good right?  Well, not so fast…the product is everywhere and the waste is too. 

It might surprise you that even Keurig K-Cups® inventor, John Sylvan says  "I feel bad sometimes that I ever [invented the K-Cup® ]," he told James Hablin of the Atlantic.  Awareness of the massive disposal challenges of the K-Cups® has gone viral.  View a video "Kill the K-Cup", put out by www.killthekcup.org.  This collective voice has been heard throughout the coffee industry, and Keurig® has publicly stated its intention to have a recyclable or compostable K-Cup® in place by 2020.  Why wait for them, what if we can make a difference today?

Here's where the Compo Cup® Comes in

Made from a plant based plastic that is 100% compostable; this is the first solid single serve coffee cup of its kind. We have a patent pending on the cup and filter mechanism. What you will see does not look much different from the current K-Cup® , the difference is what happens after. The Compo Cup® can be composted in an industrial facility turning the cup into usable compost soil typically in 45-60 days. We are also working finding a home composting machine that will compost the cups. We will provide updates as we continue along developments. We've spent countless days, nights, weekends, and holidays engineering and testing the cup and filter to brew a perfect cup of coffee, but now we need your help to fund the production.

So what will we do with your investment?

We plan to build production molds and crank out Compo Cups® till we are blue in the face.  One production mold costs $50,000 which will create 150 Million Compo Cups® per year.  If each of those cups is composted after brewing, we're looking at 5.5 Million pounds of total compost, a small percentage of the K-Cup® population with a huge impact.  As we grow, we can continue to build more molds and just think of the impact we can make then!

We are also actively working with small and large coffee roasters to use the Compo Cup® in production once we are funded. 

As a thank you

We are thrilled you want to be part of the change!  We will be rewarding your investment at different levels.  If you chose a perk level with a coffee reward, you will receive some of the best gourmet coffee packed in the Compo Cup® so that you can try it at home for yourself.  Any amount is greatly appreciated!

Rewards will be fulfilled upon close of funding.

FAQ

Why is there a need to replace the current K-Cup®?
In 2013, it was estimated that 1 in 3 Americans had a single-serve coffee machine either at home or at work*; that number is astonishing.  The K-cups® are almost impossible to recycle or compost and can contain up to seven layers of plastic.  Our landfills are filling up and this single cup trend is not slowing down.  Introductions of cold brew machines, baby formula machines, and cups of soup brewed in your single-serve coffee machine are becoming mainstream. We don’t need to stop this trend; we just need a better way of doing it that won’t pollute our planet.

What is plant based compostable plastic?
A new generation of plastics, compostable plastics are biodegradable through composting and contain no oil or petroleum.  Typically made from renewable raw materials such as plant starches, they are not hazardous to produce and breakdown through decomposition into carbon dioxide, water, and biomass. 

What makes us different than the other biodegradable single serve coffee pods? 
We are the first to create a solid cup much like the current K-Cups®; however, ours is compostable, a much better alternative.


Other Ways You Can Help

Say you can't contribute, but you still want to help:

Help us spread the word and make some noise about the Compo Cup® by sharing this project with friends, family, neighbors, colleagues and everyone!

Who we are

With over 40 years of experience in the thermoforming industry, Cal Krupa founded UPAC2 with the mission to create products that will change the world. Cal was a pioneer in the field when he founded Ultra Pac in 1987. This company was the first in their field to commercialize PET (recyclable plastic) for food packaging and quickly became the market leader. With the evolution of new earth friendly materials available, he’s doing it again only with new and better green materials. As a father, daughter team, we are passionate about this project and determined to change the way we use single serve coffee. We want generation after generation to enjoy this beautiful earth we live on free from pollution and waste.

Contact us with any further questions!
www.upac2.com
E: cal@upac2.com  / katie@upac2.com 
 

Factual Sources:

*Kisha Patel with Shannon Spencer. “To Keurig® or Not to Keurig® ”. Ursinus College:Sustainability. May 6, 2015.  https://www.ursinus.edu/live/news/966-to-keurig...

story:
Hello friends,

My name is Antonio Rivadeneira, from the beautiful Amazonian region of Ecuador, called Morona Santiago. I am a bird and nature lover. 

Morona Santiago is a colonized settlement and the economy here is based on farming, which brings deforestation to feed the animals. In other words, it means cutting the trees and destroying the natural ecosystem. Additionally, this area is threatened by the petroleum companies for a long time. Because of that, many small and big animals are forced to immigrate or extinct. 

There are hundreds of different bird species here in this part of Amazonia. They all have incredible colors and amazing beauty. I am simply in love with this creatures and I don’t want them to extinct. I want to conserve this natural treasure for the next generations.

What I am trying to do basically is reforestation and conservation of this region in order to regenerate the natural habitat of birds to live in harmony with us. Birds are leaving this region because they don’t have sufficient trees and plants to feed them or to give shelter to them. In a very little area like a backyard of our house, we can create a living space for the birds. I say “we can” because I saw it happen. Now in my first station, Inca Birdwatching Station, more than 30 different birds can be seen in an hour. 


Challenge:

The main challenge here is landowners and their unconsciousness. Like everyone else, they need to earn money and they do what they know: farming. I need to show them an alternative way to generate income, while preserving the natural habitat of Amazonia. When I'm trying to encourage landowners to reforest, they ask for a reason. That’s why this is an eco-tourism project. By preserving the natural habitat of the birds these people can host many bird lovers and generate their income, which encourage reforestation and conservation and relatedly preservation of bird species.

It’s important!

Amazon is the heart of nature! Rainforests are the most productive and complex biodiversity in this world. 

"Ecuador, a country of 270,000 square kilometers, formerly held 132,000 square kilometers of rainforest. With a deforestation rate of 4% per year only 44,000 square kilometers still exist. Every year another 3,000 square kilometers are deforested" which gives "Ecuador the highest rates of deforestation" in this continent. (Ecuador Explorer, LAHD)

Photo by: Bruce Farnsworth

Where I’m in this project so far?

This project has been ongoing for more than 10 years, I mostly put my effort to create conciousness in this region and reforestation. For now, there are 3 main bird watching stations which all still needs pretty of work in means of tourism, and many areas has been reforested. I’ve been encouraging coffee and sugar cane farmers to conserve in their area too, and now they are also enjoying the beauty of the birds visiting their places.  I've build couple of lodging places in these stations, mostly with natural resources. I'm painting all areas with beautiful birds. These three stations are connected with an alternative road where I've started to reforest in order to create a natural corridor for birds.

Why I need help?

Since I am doing most of the work by myself and with the help of the volunteers around the world, the eco-tourism part of the project is going really slow. Until now I've been funding this project with my personal income that I get from teaching English. However, in order to recreate this natural habitat before it is too late, I need your help to make these birdwatching stations functioning well and ready for ecotourism. 

For this reason;

I need a truck for transportation because this region is almost 8 hours up and down by bus and it makes it very hard to move on. I will get a second hand truck and fix it if necessary.

Technological equipment; like professional cameras, binoculars, computers, telescope etc. These are very big expenses which seem quite hard with my personal income. Till now, I’ve been monitoring birds with the professional cameras and helps of the volunteers. 

The future goals:

I want to make seven bird-watching stations in total; so all the Morona Santiago region which is connected by the road E45, join this cause of reforestation and conservation. This also brings sustainable eco-tourism, so people here will be driven by nature, rather than money itself.

I would like that these stations are used as research center and knowledge base, where students and professionals can also benefit.

And here is my personal dream; I would love to see that one of this stations would comprise Museum of Birds Photography of Morona Santiago.

Money is not everything!

You can help me in many ways;

  • You can always come here to Ecuador, stay with me free and share the food with me, and help me psychically. If those amazing volunteers didn't contribute my project as it is their project, I couldn't be at this stage of it. Many thanks to all and all the ones who will join me in the future!
  • You can simply share this project, and help me spread the word. I'm very aware of the power of social media and word of mouth.
  • Tell me your ideas about the project, so I can improve accordingly. Your ideas are very valuable. 

Please help us spreading the word by donating your social media presence and sharing with your connections on Thunderclap http://bit.ly/1P4iIy9

Together, we can create the change! 


I'm sending my very sincere love and a vibrant vibes from Amazon. 

Antonio Rivadeneira

story:
APPEAL FOR EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE - DEVASTATING FLOODS IN MYANMAR

SITUATION – there are severe flood related You have problems throughout the country of Myanmar (Burma),
with Rakhine State the hardest hit - predicted to worsen dramatically
 
Rakhine State, in western Myanmar has already been pounded by torrential rains - throughout July 2015 - with ensuing floods and damage, and now July 31-August 2 was slammed by Cyclone Komen with deadly heavy rains creating mudslides, landslides, deep flooding, broken bridges and roads, and the spread of disease. The Mrauk-U area - site of the last fabulous and historic royal kingdom - is the most affected by the floods. The impact includes: 46 (and climbing) dead, 200,000 (and climbing) people displaced, damaged infrastructure and caused loss of 5000 hectares of cultivated agricultural land. People are in dire need of clean drinking water, food, shelter, and basic sanitation. Loss of life on a massive scale is a very real possibility, and the crisis is expected to worsen.  

 The accumulated impact of successive floods, tropical storms and cyclones has increased the vulnerability of the affected population and exhausted their coping mechanisms. Most of the affected people, especially in rural areas were already suffering from extreme poverty, deprivation, and the inter-communal violence before the disaster. 
 
This appeal for emergency assistance for the victims of the 2015 Myanmar Floods is justified as it fulfills the three criteria required  (i) the need for emergency shelter, (ii) the quick and constant supply of emergency food, (iii) emergency relief assistance aiming at restoring a degree of normalcy in both the social and economic life of the affected populations as quickly as possible.  A massive amount of emergency aid is needed right now - during the rescue and crisis period - to save lives and to protect livelihood when possible, so that people can rebuild, and restart their livelihood once the crisis is over. It is vital that humanitarian aid agencies and the international community support the efforts to bring critical aid to the victims. There is no time to waste. We must not stand by and watch this tragedy unfold and worsen without adequate assistance.

Again, please convey our gratitude to all the emergency humanitarian aid organizations for their ever present support and commitment  at this time of emergency.
Affected areas : http://reliefweb.int/map/myanmar/myanmar-flood-affected-areas-3-aug-2015

We look forward to hearing from you soon. 

Thank you for your consideration, compassion, and care in advance.

Sincerely 

Nwe oo 
California USA 
Nenerakhaing@hotmail.com
Phone 5102131452

story:
The New Orleans AFSC Peace by Piece (https://www.afsc.org/office/new-orleans-la) program focuses on empowering young people, ages 16-26, who experienced the flooding from Hurricane Katrina as children.

They have been involved in many projects such as using the arts to express themselves as they tell about their experiences with violence and trauma in their lives. Peace by Piece’s curriculum contains tools for trauma healing, power analysis, Black history, basics of economics, and organizing tactics for youth-led actions that address policies and practices that promote injustice. 

The program takes a comprehensive approach to these issues that includes amplifying the voices of impacted youth and developing their leadership to create systems change. They train young leaders to provide mentorship and education in urban agriculture and to organize around the inequitable distribution of resources and economic justice. These strategies will empower and prepare the next generation of leaders to identify root causes of oppression and take actions that lead to social and cultural transformation.  Some of their projects include an annual fashion show and creating a twenty-minute documentary detailing how New Orleans suffered due to the inequity of distribution of hurricane relief funds. These young people grew up in neighborhoods that were not given funds to rebuild while they watched funds being directed towards businesses and middle-class homeowners.

In 2016, Peace by Piece built a backyard garden in a Hollygrove neighborhood. The garden was used as an outdoor teaching space for a summer camp focusing on building sustainable communities. The camp helped young people to understand the lack of access to healthy food options in the neighborhood. The camp also helped young people realize their ability to create an alternative food source to feed their neighborhood. There are no affordable grocery stores in the neighborhood, so the program negotiated with corner store owners to sell their produce at a reduced cost once the garden yields a large enough harvest. Meanwhile, the program has sponsored three garden give-aways.  

As part of the process of learning how to plant vegetables, they have made connections with the older residents in the neighborhood and held gardening classes for young children.Growing out of the success of last year’s summer camp in Hollygrove New Orleans, Peace by Piece New Orleans would like to secure two plots of land dedicated to full sized gardens. Once secured, these green spaces will have full community ownership and control with oversight provided by the Hollygrove Neighbors Association. The gardens will be used as a food source for the entire neighborhood. These spaces are intended to feed, as well as to promote, healthy and whole communities through gardening and political education.

I am excited at the way that this project has fostered intergenerational relationships, helped these youth develop leadership, and organizational skills, and given them pride in their community.

I am working with Live Oak Friends Meeting in Houston to help them fund raise to purchase two empty lots in the neighborhood to increase their gardens. New Orleans Redevelopment Authority auctions these lots and we expect them to cost around $5-7 k each.

The Hollygrove Neighbors Association has become a partner in this venture and will own the property. This means that there will be continuity as the young people grow up and go to college. Witnessing first hand, how the entire neighborhood has come together and their level of buy-in and commitment leads me to believe that this project will be successful.

All proceeds will go to the garden. Any money raised above the cost of the property will be donated to AFSC for supplies and tools for this project.

These young people grew up in neighborhoods that were not given funds to rebuild while they watched funds being directed towards businesses and middle-class homeowners.In 2016, Peace by Piece built a backyard garden in a Hollygrove neighborhood. The garden was used as an outdoor teaching space for a summer camp focusing on building sustainable communities. The camp helped young people to understand the lack of access to healthy food options in the neighborhood. The camp also helped young people realize their ability to create an alternative food source to feed their neighborhood. There are no affordable grocery stores in the neighborhood, so the program negotiated with corner store owners to sell their produce at a reduced cost once the garden yields a large enough harvest. Meanwhile, the program has sponsored three garden give-aways.  As part of the process of learning how to plant vegetables, they have made connections with the older residents in the neighborhood and held gardening classes for young children.Growing out of the success of last year’s summer camp in Hollygrove New Orleans, Peace by Piece New Orleans would like to secure two plots of land dedicated to full sized gardens. Once secured, these green spaces will have full community ownership and control with oversight provided by the Hollygrove Neighbors Association. The gardens will be used as a food source for the entire neighborhood. These spaces are intended to feed, as well as to promote, healthy and whole communities through gardening and political education.I am excited at the way that this project has fostered intergenerational relationships, helped these youth develop leadership, and organizational skills, and given them pride in their community.I am working with Live Oak Friends Meeting in Houston to help them fund raise to purchase two empty lots in the neighborhood to increase their gardens. New Orleans Redevelopment Authority auctions these lots and we expect them to cost around $5-7 k each.The Hollygrove Neighbors Association has become a partner in this venture and will own the property. This means that there will be continuity as the young people grow up and go to college. Witnessing first hand, how the entire neighborhood has come together and their level of buy-in and commitment leads me to believe that this project will be successful.All proceeds will go to the garden. Any money raised above the cost of the property will be donated to AFSC for supplies and tools for this project.

story:
Short Summary

   I keep bees because I think they are important to us all. I run 70 of my own hives  and look after some for other people. I deliver talks about bees and provide visits to my apiaries. Bees are a barometer for our environment and sign post for the effects of our world on other pollinators. Bees pollinate the foods we like to eat and make yummy honey. All they ask is a place to live and a little help with food when times are hard.

Here is the story behind the project.....

Recently I arrived at one of my apiaries on a warm summer morning and was not greeted with the air full of bees...odd, I thought. It so happened that this day was day one of a two day audit of my bees by the Bee Inspector. As we began to examine the bees, we discovered piles of dead bees within the hives. Only the strongest colonies had any live bees and these bees were shivering on the honey combs. What we believe had happened was that the bees had come into contact with a substance toxic to bees. We think most of the foraging bees died in the field but some made it back to the hive and passed on the toxin and thereby killed the house bees. I estimate 600,000 bees are dead. That is a lot of pollinators not pollinating and not producing honey which fuels my work with the bees. The hidden destruction could be that the wild population of Bumblebees and other pollinators have been hit but there is no way to count their losses.   

   My inspector and I checked adjacent apiaries to find the next one, some half mile (1km) distant, had similar issues. There were very few foragers flying but the house bees were alive. We think these hives were far enough away from the toxin source for the foragers to die before they got back to the hive. It is a grim view but might be for the best in the long run. The next one, another half mile (1km) distant, was not affected.

   In those hives that were still alive there were no foragers to bring in food. I applied sugar syrup as food in the hope of making up for the lost foragers until the house bees grow up to be foragers.

So what do I need the funding for?

  • Replacement bees. It is approaching the height of the season in the UK and it already too late to be splitting remaining stocks in an attempt to replace the losses. Splitting the remaining stocks is possible but runs the risk of them not getting up to strength to survive the winter and, more importantly, our increasingly unpredictable spring time.
  • Food. These bees will need food supplied by me until the house bees grow up to foragers.
  • Queens. It might be necessary to buy new queens as the current queens may very well prove to have damaged ovaries  

  Time is short. Action has to taken smartly to build up the bees for winter in what remains of this summer. I hope you find you are able to make a contribution to re-establish the lost colonies. There are some perks just for me to say thank you. You can always go to my on-line shop at www.thebeefarmer.co.uk/shop and find out about other products I make. I thank you for your support and if the bees could give voice I suspect they would be grateful too.

If you have a skill or talent you think you can offer to help me and the bees please feel free to contact me and have a chat.

Thank you David, The Bee Farmer.

story:
How we got here

Frijolito Farm was a popular urban farm in Columbus that was known mostly for selling chicken and eggs at farmers markets. Back when it started, Franklin County allowed people in the townships to raise animals as long as they were on parcels of an acre or more. But then in 2013, the county passed a new zoning amendment saying that if you had less than five acres, you could have no more than 24 ducks, chickens, and rabbits, combined. All other livestock were prohibited.


According to the Ohio Revised Code, however, counties and townships have no authority to regulate agriculture on lots of more than five acres. Our farm is just a fraction of an acre too small to qualify for this exemption. There is a vacant lot next to our farm, though, that belongs to the county land bank, and they're offering us the chance to buy it. If we buy it, we'll have enough land to be allowed to raise animals again.


The land bank says there's someone else interested in the land, too, so instead of just telling us a price, they've invited us to submit an offer. They say that in addition to considering the offer, they also want to do what's best for the community. That's why we're asking for your help. Not only can you help us come up with the money, but the more supporters we have, the better we can show the land bank that the community supports our mission.


As this expansion is a new beginning for our farm, I'm changing the name from Frijolito Farm to Woodland Urban Farm (it may take a while for our website to reflect this change). I want Woodland Urban Farm to do more. Frijolito Farm demonstrated that it was possible to grow food on a commercial scale on a small, urban lot. But I want Woodland Urban Farm to be more than that. Instead of relying on farmers markets, Woodland Urban Farm will have its own market on site. We'll host tours, classes, workshops, and discussion groups for people who want to share ideas about sustainable living. It will be a place for people to learn how to live closer to nature and how to create their own jobs growing food in the city. It will be the place where people go to get local food in Columbus, and hopefully serve as a model for others to duplicate.

Be a part of this. Look over our perks. They range from a simple "thank you" on our website for chipping in a dollar, to items for your own garden, to a weekend bed & breakfast stay at the house where it all started. We want you to be involved. Woodland Urban Farm is a park-like setting, mostly forest. People who go far enough back on our land say, "Does this really count as urban farming?" because it seems so secluded...but we border the property of East Linden Elementary School.



As Permaculture co-founder Bill Mollison once said, "You don't have a slug problem, you have a duck deficiency." To really care for this land, we need the help of animals, and to be allowed to have animals again, we need help from you. Please be a part of building Woodland Urban Farm in your community. If the land bank should reject our bid for some reason, or if we go over our goal, we'll put the money towards making the best possible use we can of the land we already have. That means things like more deer fencing, more gardens, a greenhouse, mushroom and aquaculture production...it just depends on how much money there is to work with.

Even if you can't afford to contribute any money, you can still help! Spread the word about this campaign. Buy our vegetables when they're ready. Call Curtiss Williams, Vice President of The Land Reutilization Corporation of Franklin County (614-525-4938), and let him know that you want Wayne Shingler to farm the vacant lot on Woodland Avenue. If your neighborhood or community group supports our using this land for farming (specifically, we're planning to fence it in and plant fruit trees), then please have your organization send us their name and contact information so we can submit it to the land bank with our offer.

Special thanks to Elephant Revival for letting us use their song "The Pasture" in our video free of charge. Learn more about them at ElephantRevival.com.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name Is Jerry Peterson. I have recently graduated from the Cal-Earth Institute of Earth Art & Architecture where we studied Super-Adobe. Super-Adobe is a method of building with Earth to generate curvilinear architecture such as domes and vaults to provide superior strength from simple materials.
  • The Earthquake has been over for months but the devastation in Nepal is still wide-spread. There are still countless families without shelter and rubble in the streets where children play. We would like to raise funds to fly a small group of instructors to assist the Natural Resources Defense Council in the training of locals and the building of homes.
  • The average devastated family will live in a tent for the next 10 years. Your contribution will put a roof over the heads of a family whose home has been destroyed.

The average super-adobe single-family home can be built for $300 in materials. That's not bad considering The Red Cross raised millions of dollars for Haiti and only built 6 homes... These funds will provide Air fare for instructors to safely and responsibly approach the devastated area with an affective strategy that will help hundreds of families.

Whatever funds aren't raised or used will be donated directly to the forces already on the ground at the Natural Resources Defense Council

The Impact

  • The super-adobe method turns tools of war (Barbed wire/sand bags) that are available on ever continent into tools of shelter where families can reside safely out of weather and cold. 
  • We have successfully built small domes in anywhere from 2hrs-2days depending on how many hands we have. This could mean in a matter of weeks dozens, if not hundreds of people could have homes where before there was nothing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with the worlds. Its simple. Lets builds some homes!
