story:
The Organic Compound is a permaculture farm, event, and education center striving to go beyond sustainability and begin leading a Regenerative life. Based in Faribault Minnesota on what was once conventional farm land, we transitioned 3 acres of previously mono-cropped land and 7 acres of pasture into a GMO-free, pesticide-free permaculture food forest. With the help of the Organic Compound volunteer groups, we have planted tens of thousands of perennial and annual fruit and nut trees, not to mention loads of vegetables! We are well on our way to a regenerative future. By taking the time to learn and understand our local habitat, we have found many ways to live in collaboration with the earth. We actively dehydrate, can, pickle and ferment our food. Wild foods and medicines are annually foraged from the land as well. Last year, The Organic Compound managed to obtain a saw mill to produce our own local lumber and we continue to find creative ways to be regenerative. We are weaving a web of regeneration and coexistence. Through collaboration and cooperation with local organizations and communities, we are actively sharing knowledge and direct experience of our contributive and caring way of being.

In our quest to develop an energy self sufficient infrastructure for our farm, we asked ourselves:

"What are tangible goals we can set in this intention of regeneration and resilience which our wider community can support with confidence?"

 

 

We came up with several solutions, these are the three main strategies:

1. Building up our SUSTAINABLE INFRASTRUCTURE:

creating an outdoor kitchen, outdoor shower, and more places for people to inhabit while they are learning and contributing to the land. Our visions for the land here are expanding and so must our capacity to have the extra hands here to support these projects!

2. Build a ROOT CELLAR for Produce Storage:

This passive geothermal technology has been proven effective by generations of people. A Root Cellar will allow us to store our harvested food and live a more sustainable life through the winter season.

3. GO SOLAR:

The sun that grows our plants has the power to run our facilities! Going solar will increase our energy independence and reduce our carbon footprint.

 

These combined efforts will dramatically impact the Organic Compounds’ ability to further our vision of land-based education, increase our long-term resilience, decrease our energy dependence, and create a source of renewable energy to power our facilities.

 

What does this look like?

In Total We Need:  $45,000 and your HELP!

 

Our Sustainability Solutions come in three phases.

 

PHASE ONE: Creating an outdoor kitchen, shower, and seasonal living spaces. We plan to use recycled, reclaimed, Organic Compound milled-wood for these projects, and lots of our skilled friends and family to complete the projects.

Infrastructure Needs: $9,800

~For our outdoor kitchen space, we will be using an existing concrete slab as our foundation and utilizing rammed tire construction for the walls of the kitchen. We will use our own saw mill to cut any wood needed for framing, tin for the roof (better to catch rain water with!) and recycled materials for the cabinets within the kitchen. We estimate the cost of this being $4,500. ($3,000 for the roof, and $1,500 for screen, cabinets, door, sink, and other misc)

 

~We will also be creating an outdoor wash house. The wash house will have a shower (made with reclaimed tile and earth-based construction) and a washer, so that our interns and guests can have access to these basic necessities. Our estimate for this phase is $1,600. ($350 for piping, $150 for washer, $200for tile, $250 for the roof, and $650 for the structure itself)

 

~Finally we will be screening in four 9’ by 9’platform structures and adding roofs to make rain and mosquito free zones for our seasonal interns and guests. We will be using wood from our mill as well as screen and tin-roofs for these enclosures. We estimate the total cost being approximately $3,700. ($800 for wood, $2,400for the metal roof, and $500 for the screen)

 

PHASE TWO: Before moving into stage three of our solar electric aspirations we need to reduce the amount of power we need. One way we will do that is by Building a Root Cellar! Root cellar/ice house needs: $7,200.00 total

~With you & all of your friends with shovels and a couple of weekends, we can dig a 10' deep, 10' Wide, 24’ long hole, or we can pay an excavator $2,300.00 for their services. It just depends on how low impact we want to be with our install. We are talking about sustainability, right?

~For the Walls, we will be using re-claimed tires to do rammed earth construction! After the walls are up, we will use an earthen clay mix to seal the walls. This phase is practically free since we have all the materials on the land, but we will need your help to do it! BONUS, this is a great learning opportunity!

~For our floor, we will be using gravel rather than concrete to further reduce our environmental impact. The estimated cost for the gravel is approximately $300.

~$3,200.00 for waterproofing and insulating, we still need your help with labor, and finally another $1,400.00 for concrete, rebar and forms for the roof. Bring your friends with shovels!

 

PHASE THREE: is a grid tied ground mounted solar array. The ~$28,000.00 is for: 24 Canadian Solar 295w modules, a 7kw Schnieder Electric, Outback or Sunny Boy grid tied inverter, an Iron Ridge ground mount racking system, and all of the "Balance of System" parts to interconnect with the electric grid. This solar system will produce 36 kilowatt hours of energy per day which will meet about 80% or our current electrical needs. We hope, with time and added intent, we will be able to reduce our electrical needs so that this system will actually produce MORE than enough for our electrical needs. We will then need your help to assemble the racking system and mount the modules before we have an electrician come and hook us up to the electric grid. (If you are an electrician that can handle this please reach out!)

You are contributing to a farm revolution.

We are creating a model for others to adopt. With our ability to outreach and share our story with so many people in our community, we believe we are creating a space that will empower and inspire people for many years to come. Using advanced permaculture design and working with elements on the land, we will continue to explore new sustainable, regenerative ways of being.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people simply cannot contribute financially. There are ways you can help too:

*Please SHARE our campaign! Share via social media and word of mouth. It is the only way the word will spread and these ideas will grow.

*Join us on the farm and help us to maintain our gardens and build the infrastructure we need to have a more sustainable future. We really are the ones to make this happen, come join us!

Sign Up for updates here:

http://eepurl.com/CObEP

story:
Thank you for Stopping By - You support is very gratefully and humbly received. 

A quick round up of the Project and why it matters

GangesSUP's Goals are :

#PaddleForChange - Using the Power of adventure to understand the very serious problem of water pollution  via citizen science, community clean up projects, simple call to actions and citizen advocacy. 

#AdventureInyourOwnBackyard - Showcase the immense accessibility of the SUP sport as a means of creating additional Eco-tourism opportunities in India’s great outdoors. While also improving youth and individual engagement in environmental issues via  something aspirational and cool.

#SUPAgainstSUP - We are aware that cleaning rivers is a long term, often politically charged matter, hence we are focusing on causes of water pollution that are visible, do not require huge barriers for considerable improvement and see a huge improvement with the littlelest of governance changes.   We are focusing on raising awareness against single use plastic (SUP)- i.e #SUPagainstSUP (stand-up paddleboarding against single-use plastic) and other causes of pollution that are more readily addressable (e.g. treatment of sewage waste before it goes into the river).
 

Our Project Deliverables

We plan for:

  • Documentation on this goddess of a river which is facing its death;
  • A documentary film to premiere in Spring 2017;
  • Analysis of the condition of the river & the water via sampling where possible, anecdotal evidence, interaction with local organisations and qualitative & human ecological questions;
  • Photography of the entire journey;
  • Regular Blogs, Vlogs, Social Media and Website updates as we travel;
  • Collaborative events such a 'Clean up drives', school visits & community interactions in the major hubs/cities along the river;
  • Media events to spread the intent & the messaging of the expedition far and wide;
  • 2 strong calls to action - Disincentives for usage of plastic bags as well as working with WaterAid for advocacy against disposal of untreated sewage into the Ganges

The context for the Project

The Ganges or Ma Ganga is not only a critical pillar of India's cultural and spiritual identity but also one of the most prominent and significant rivers of the world. In the words of India's first prime minister - 'The story of the Ganges, from her source to the sea, from old times to new, is the story of India’s civilization and culture, of the rise and fall of empires, of great and proud cities, of adventures of man'.

The Ganga river basin is one of the largest river systems in the world, supporting not only over a 12th of the world's population but also numerous diverse ecosystems, from the alpine forests near Gaumukh to the plains of northern India to the mangrove forests and saline mud flats of West Bengal.

This river-of-life however, is now facing an accelerated death due to the immense strain placed on it due to human activity and interference. The challenges of the Ganges are similar to those faced by water bodies around the world - issues that are of global relevance and urgency as all this waste and these pollutants end up in our oceans, endanger marine life and eventually find their way in our bodies through the food chain. 

The pollution and threats to the Ganges have many origins at different points along the river and is easier to understand by dividing the river system into three main geographical regions along its main course: 1. Upper Ganga Region: the origin of the river in the lap of the Himalayas 2. Middle Ganga Region: the river as it meanders through the plains, where it is the most heavily populated.   3. Lower Ganga Region: the delta region as the river meets with Ganga Sagar. This is a very helpful graphic from Ganga Action Parivar -


Why does water pollution matter and Why the time for GangesSUP is now?



So Why Stand Up Paddleboarding?

Stand Up Paddlboarding (SUP) is not only the world's fastest growing watersport but is also an incredibly accessible sport, all one really needs is water and a paddle+paddleboard to  practice it. The advent of inflatable paddleboards has made it even easier to 'travel with'. The  sport also gives unrivaled visibility both inside and outside water.


Who we are

We are a three person international team of Shilpika 'Shilps' (female, Indian), Spike (male, British & Irish) and Pascal (male, German).

In late 2015, the idea of GangeSUP germinated from Shilps' burning dream to combine her love for adventure, a desire to discover more of her motherland via an 'immersive' & 'slow travel' mode (having been away from India for a decade) & most importantly realizing the need to create a constructive & engaging dialogue for the very very serious problem of water pollution. Meeting Spike via London's fitness and adventure community led to the seed of the idea growing into a tangible expedition format and with Pascal's addition to the team in the form of an environmental scientist, we bring together what we think are essential components for this expedition team's adventure-for-purpose.

As a team we are united by our passion for impacting and creating sustainable change, for pushing the boundaries of stereotypes & comfort and for empowering purpose via adventure.

We also bring a range of complementary skills and backgrounds to this expedition as below –

More details on the team can be found here -GangesSUP Team Profile

Besides this core team of 3, we are fortunate to have some passionate adventure and environment enthusiasts join us for shorter phases of the expedition along the river.

We are forever indebted to our wider team of family, friends and sponsors and partners, without whom this idea may have never actualized.

The Expedition plan (Well Plan A in any case!)

Kicking off in the final week of September 2016, our expedition itinerary is broadly divided into 3 phases – 

Taking into account rest stops, community engagement projects and likely safety/health concerns, we expect the expedition to take up to 3 months 

- Phase 1 Week of 28th September - Commence the 270km odd trek from Gaumukh +Gangotri, 4100metres high in the Himalays (i.e. the source) down to just below the Tehri Dam. We expect this to take approx 2 weeks.

Phase 2 Week of 10th October -Tehri Dam to Haridwar – We will be getting on our inflatable stand up paddleboards at just below Tehri Dam / near Devprayag and will aim for Haridwar through the white waters (approx 70 kms with rapids upto Grade 6).

Phase 3 Haridwar to Ganga Sagar – We will be swapping to our hard stand up paddle boards from Haridwar and embarking on the longest phase of our journey until Ganga Sagar.

OK but have you done ANYTHING like this before?

To prepare for this journey we have just finished the first 307 km long source to sea descent of the river Shannon by paddleboard.  This Irish river is the longest river in the British Isles and the expedition took us roughly 2 weeks agains the backdrop of constant headwinds, heavy rain but unfailing and lovely Irish hospitality. We were lucky to get some Media love as below:

Irish Times-ShannonSUP

Irish Independent -ShannonSUP

Why are we asking for your support ?

So far the expedition is completely Self-Funded barring equipment support from our incredible partners . This project has now been 9 months in planning and is a huge (yet super rewarding) feat to undertake -Shilps has been dedicated to it full time for this duration & Spike and Pascal have also spent considerable effort in getting us to this stage - Between expedition logistics, training expedition in Ireland, insurance, plane tickets,  expedition gear, filming, photography and editing of the film , our budget is to the tune of GBP 50,000+. The great news is that we are GBP 28,000 of the way there already ! 

We really really really NEED your support for the remaining GBP 22,000+  (BRExit has made our funding goal about 12% higher than initially estimated) which is broadly split as follows:

- GBP 13,500: India Specific Expedition Safety & logistics - In its leanest and meanest form, this includes but is not limited to -State specific permissions to be on the river, support vehicle, white water support, local fixers where needed. Our conviction to do this Expedition completely unsupported has been gradually chipped away due to reinforcement of local concerns regarding the risks mentioned above. 

- GBP 1000-1500: Scientific Experiments and cost of sample analysis.

- GBP 7000: Production of the Expedition Documentary, editing, post production - We consider  our work and purpose left unfinished if we cannot share our findings on the river with a global audience, in a raw, authentic and unbiased form - this will be by the means of  a post expedition documentary film which we will also use to fundraise for our Charity Partners, including WaterAid India.

All funding will go directly to the project- Please donate if you are so engaged, inspired and are able. Every single contribution counts and we greatly value all support we receive—moral, fiscal, and social.  

As we currently stand today w.r.t gear and monetary position - we are fully in a position to undertake the expedition as per plan - the difference between funding and lack of, is jeopardizing our safety and health and not being able to expand the environmental and social impact of this expedition beyond the adventure. We are only going to attempt this particular journey once, so we want to really push the boundaries of what impact and change we can create through it.

We are also confident that there are plenty of like minded individuals out there who care passionately and deeply for cleaner waters and will help us reach our Funding goal, enabling us to honor our Campaign Rewards.

For the Rewards themselves, we were very keen on not listing anything that might be an additional burden on the environment and more importantly where we would be able to engage with our backers as much as possible.  Please take a look at our rewards list and we hope that there will be something you will like!

The Impact

This is the reality of the human impact on our rivers and our oceans today - Recognizing, addressing and taking action against water pollution is essential to life, to human survival, to civilization itself. 



Risks & Challenges

We often say in our team that if this adventure did not come fraught with risks, it would not be an expedition. Our mantra however, is to be Risk Aware, not Risk Averse.  We have undertaken extensive risk assessment exercises for the expedition, put contingency measures in place and will continue to revise and update the plan as we go along the river and as and when we have new information. We have comprehensive insurance & as a team have extensive experience on the paddleboards as well as in expedition management. If we can find the funding, we will also have on ground support which will be critically useful. Additionally, we have an Indian on the team who speaks the language (s) as well as understand the cultural and social nuances of the areas we will pass through.  
Broadly the major Risks are:
-River itself - white water, strong currents, changing flow due to heavy monsoons, crocodiles & other wild life, submerged & visible hazards;
-River pollution - which creates a wide array of difficulties ranging from sourcing cleaner water to causing serious illness;
-Remoteness - which will impact communication, evacuation if needed, resupplies etc.
-People on the banks themselves (theft, assault etc.);
-Equipment failure.

Besides the adventure specific aspects, our big Challenges are:

-To authentically tell a story of the river and its people using a combination of anecdotal evidence, citizen science, photo, footage & writing;

-To crystallize the format of the legacy we would like to leave post expedition;

-To get our message out to as many people as possible, to engage them enough to create momentum and empower action.


There are many other ways of helping!!

We firmly believe that each one of you can meaningfully contribute to the campaign & our rivers  in myriad of other ways if not financially:

  • Spread the good word -You can help simply by spreading the message by word of mouth or via Facebook,Twitter & Instagram by using the hashtag #Paddleforchange and #SUPAgainstSUP - collective change & mobilisation has the power to save our rivers.                                                                                                                                          
  • Show us some Social Media Love by liking us on Facebook and following us on Twitter & Instagram.                                                                                                                 

  • #OneLess Pledge - Perhaps take a moment and reflect on  the role of Single-Use plastic in your life and find ways of cutting down on it - We need not all be on the water to find ways of making it cleaner.

  • Join Us - GangesSUP encourages you to join us on the expedition - you may be an environmentalist, a scientist, an adventure enthusiast or may simply want to explore a new country by human powered means - You are all welcome - just drop us a line on gangessup@gmail.com

  • Love & Luck - Please send good energy, positive thoughts, and your moral support as we make this very exciting, purposeful, yet dangerous journey.  
For more information please visit our website and social media channels as below please!
Website : GangesSUP
Facebook: GangesSUP Facebook
Twitter: GangesSUP Twitter
Instagram :  GangesSUP instagram
story_txt:
Thank you for Stopping By - You support is very gratefully and humbly received. A quick round up of the Project and why it mattersGangesSUP's Goals are :#PaddleForChange - Using the Power of adventure to understand the very serious problem of water pollution  via citizen science, community clean up projects, simple call to actions and citizen advocacy. #AdventureInyourOwnBackyard - Showcase the immense accessibility of the SUP sport as a means of creating additional Eco-tourism opportunities in India’s great outdoors. While also improving youth and individual engagement in environmental issues via  something aspirational and cool.#SUPAgainstSUP - We are aware that cleaning rivers is a long term, often politically charged matter, hence we are focusing on causes of water pollution that are visible, do not require huge barriers for considerable improvement and see a huge improvement with the littlelest of governance changes.   We are focusing on raising awareness against single use plastic (SUP)- i.e #SUPagainstSUP (stand-up paddleboarding against single-use plastic) and other causes of pollution that are more readily addressable (e.g. treatment of sewage waste before it goes into the river). Our Project Deliverables
We plan for:


Documentation on this goddess of a river which is facing its death;
A documentary film to premiere in Spring 2017;
Analysis of the condition of the river & the water via sampling where possible, anecdotal evidence, interaction with local organisations and qualitative & human ecological questions;

Photography of the entire journey;

Regular Blogs, Vlogs, Social Media and Website updates as we travel;
Collaborative events such a 'Clean up drives', school visits & community interactions in the major hubs/cities along the river;

Media events to spread the intent & the messaging of the expedition far and wide;
2 strong calls to action - Disincentives for usage of plastic bags as well as working with WaterAid for advocacy against disposal of untreated sewage into the Ganges

The context for the Project
The Ganges or Ma Ganga is not
only a critical pillar of India's cultural and spiritual identity but
also one of the most prominent and significant rivers of the world.
In the words of India's first prime minister - 'The
story of the Ganges, from her source to the sea, from old times to
new, is the story of India’s civilization and culture, of the rise
and fall of empires, of great and proud cities, of adventures of man'.
The Ganga river basin is one
of the largest river systems in the world, supporting not only over a
12th of the world's population but also numerous
diverse ecosystems, from the alpine forests near Gaumukh to the
plains of northern India to the mangrove forests and saline mud flats
of West Bengal.
This river-of-life however, is
now facing an accelerated death due to the immense strain placed on
it due to human activity and interference. The challenges of the Ganges are similar to those faced by water bodies around the world - issues that are of global relevance and urgency as all this waste and these pollutants end up in our oceans, endanger marine life and eventually find their way in our bodies through the food chain. 
The pollution and threats to the Ganges have many origins at different points along the river and is easier to understand by dividing the river system into three main geographical regions along its main course: 1. Upper Ganga Region: the origin of the river in the lap of the Himalayas 2. Middle Ganga Region: the river as it meanders through the plains, where it is the most heavily populated.   3. Lower Ganga Region: the delta region as the river meets with Ganga Sagar. This is a very helpful graphic from Ganga Action Parivar -



Why does water pollution matter and Why the time for GangesSUP is now?





So Why Stand Up Paddleboarding?
Stand Up Paddlboarding (SUP) is not only the world's fastest growing watersport but is also an incredibly accessible sport, all one really needs is water and a paddle+paddleboard to  practice it. The advent of inflatable paddleboards has made it even easier to 'travel with'. The  sport also gives unrivaled visibility both inside and outside water.



Who
we are
We are a three person
international team of Shilpika 'Shilps' (female, Indian), Spike (male,
British & Irish) and Pascal (male, German).
In late 2015, the idea of
GangeSUP germinated from Shilps' burning dream to combine her love
for adventure, a desire to discover more of her motherland via an
'immersive' & 'slow travel' mode (having been away from India for
a decade) & most importantly realizing the need to create a
constructive & engaging dialogue for the very very serious
problem of water pollution. Meeting Spike via London's fitness and
adventure community led to the seed of the idea growing into a
tangible expedition format and with Pascal's addition to the team in
the form of an environmental scientist, we bring together what we
think are essential components for this expedition team's
adventure-for-purpose.
As a team we are united by our
passion for impacting and creating sustainable change, for pushing
the boundaries of stereotypes & comfort and for empowering
purpose via adventure.
We also bring a range of
complementary skills and backgrounds to this expedition as below –

More details on the team can be found
here -GangesSUP Team Profile
Besides this core team of 3, we are
fortunate to have some passionate adventure and environment
enthusiasts join us for shorter phases of the expedition along the
river.
We are forever indebted to our wider team of family, friends and sponsors and partners, without whom this idea may have never actualized.
The Expedition plan (Well Plan A in any case!)
Kicking off in the final week of September 2016, our expedition itinerary is broadly divided into 3 phases – 
Taking into account rest stops, community engagement projects and likely safety/health concerns, we expect the expedition to take up to 3 months 
- Phase 1 Week of 28th September - Commence the 270km odd trek from Gaumukh +Gangotri, 4100metres high in the Himalays (i.e. the source) down to just below the Tehri Dam. We expect this to take approx 2 weeks.
Phase 2 Week of 10th October -Tehri Dam to Haridwar – We will be getting on our inflatable stand up paddleboards at just below Tehri Dam / near Devprayag and will aim for Haridwar through the white waters (approx 70 kms with rapids upto Grade 6).
Phase 3 Haridwar to Ganga Sagar – We will be swapping to our hard stand up paddle boards from Haridwar and embarking on the longest phase of our journey until Ganga Sagar.
OK but have you done ANYTHING like this before?
To prepare for this journey we have just finished the first 307 km long source to sea descent of the river Shannon by paddleboard.  This Irish river is the longest river in the British Isles and the expedition took us roughly 2 weeks agains the backdrop of constant headwinds, heavy rain but unfailing and lovely Irish hospitality. We were lucky to get some Media love as below:
Irish Times-ShannonSUP
Irish Independent -ShannonSUP
Why are we asking for your support ?
So far the expedition is completely Self-Funded barring equipment support from our incredible partners . This project has now been 9 months in planning and is a huge (yet super rewarding) feat to undertake -Shilps has been dedicated to it full time for this duration & Spike and Pascal have also spent considerable effort in getting us to this stage - Between expedition logistics, training expedition in Ireland, insurance, plane tickets,  expedition gear, filming, photography and editing of the film , our budget is to the tune of GBP 50,000+. The great news is that we are GBP 28,000 of the way there already ! 
We really really really NEED your support for the remaining GBP 22,000+  (BRExit has made our funding goal about 12% higher than initially estimated) which is broadly split as follows:
- GBP 13,500: India Specific Expedition Safety & logistics - In its leanest and meanest form, this includes but is not limited to -State specific permissions to be on the river, support vehicle, white water support, local fixers where needed. Our conviction to do this Expedition completely unsupported has been gradually chipped away due to reinforcement of local concerns regarding the risks mentioned above. 
- GBP 1000-1500: Scientific Experiments and cost of sample analysis.
- GBP 7000: Production of the Expedition Documentary, editing, post production - We consider  our work and purpose left unfinished if we cannot share our findings on the river with a global audience, in a raw, authentic and unbiased form - this will be by the means of  a post expedition documentary film which we will also use to fundraise for our Charity Partners, including WaterAid India.
All funding will go directly to the project- Please donate if you are so engaged, inspired and are able. Every single contribution counts and we greatly value all support we receive—moral, fiscal, and social.  
As we currently stand today w.r.t gear and monetary position - we are fully in a position to undertake the expedition as per plan - the difference between funding and lack of, is jeopardizing our safety and health and not being able to expand the environmental and social impact of this expedition beyond the adventure. We are only going to attempt this particular journey once, so we want to really push the boundaries of what impact and change we can create through it.
We are also confident that there are plenty of like minded individuals out there who care passionately and deeply for cleaner waters and will help us reach our Funding goal, enabling us to honor our Campaign Rewards.
For the Rewards themselves, we were very keen on not listing anything that might be an additional burden on the environment and more importantly where we would be able to engage with our backers as much as possible.  Please take a look at our rewards list and we hope that there will be something you will like!
The Impact
This is the reality of the human impact on our rivers and our oceans today - Recognizing, addressing and taking action against water pollution is essential to life, to human survival, to civilization itself. 





Risks & Challenges

We often say in our team that if this adventure did not come fraught with risks, it would not be an expedition. Our mantra however, is to be Risk Aware, not Risk Averse.  We have undertaken extensive risk assessment exercises for the expedition, put contingency measures in place and will continue to revise and update the plan as we go along the river and as and when we have new information. We have comprehensive insurance & as a team have extensive experience on the paddleboards as well as in expedition management. If we can find the funding, we will also have on ground support which will be critically useful. Additionally, we have an Indian on the team who speaks the language (s) as well as understand the cultural and social nuances of the areas we will pass through.  
Broadly the major Risks are:
-River itself - white water, strong currents, changing flow due to heavy monsoons, crocodiles & other wild life, submerged & visible hazards;
-River pollution - which creates a wide array of difficulties ranging from sourcing cleaner water to causing serious illness;
-Remoteness - which will impact communication, evacuation if needed, resupplies etc.
-People on the banks themselves (theft, assault etc.);
-Equipment failure.

Besides the adventure specific aspects, our big Challenges are:
-To authentically tell a story of the river and its people using a combination of anecdotal evidence, citizen science, photo, footage & writing;
-To crystallize the format of the legacy we would like to leave post expedition;
-To get our message out to as many people as possible, to engage them enough to create momentum and empower action.
There are many other ways of helping!!
We firmly believe that each one of you can meaningfully contribute to the campaign & our rivers  in myriad of other ways if not financially:

Spread the good word -You can help simply by spreading the message by word of mouth or via Facebook,Twitter & Instagram by using the hashtag #Paddleforchange and #SUPAgainstSUP - collective change & mobilisation has the power to save our rivers.                                                                                                                                          

Show us some Social Media Love by liking us on Facebook and following us on Twitter & Instagram.                                                                                                                 

#OneLess Pledge - Perhaps take a moment and reflect on  the role of Single-Use plastic in your life and find ways of cutting down on it - We need not all be on the water to find ways of making it cleaner.
Join Us - GangesSUP encourages you to join us on the expedition - you may be an environmentalist, a scientist, an adventure enthusiast or may simply want to explore a new country by human powered means - You are all welcome - just drop us a line on gangessup@gmail.com



Love & Luck - Please send good energy, positive thoughts, and your moral support as we make this very exciting, purposeful, yet dangerous journey.  
For more information please visit our website and social media channels as below please!Website : GangesSUP
Facebook: GangesSUP Facebook
Twitter: GangesSUP Twitter
Instagram :  GangesSUP instagram

story:
Too Many T's, Not Enough Bees...

Camberwell based hip-hop duo, Too Many T's, are concerned that there aren't enough bees.

And they're right.

To coincide with National Bee Day on Saturday 18th August 2018, they've released a brand new, punchy track about the decline of bees in Britain and teamed up with Bees for Business to raise money to adopt an exclusive Too Many T's beehive. This is your opportunity to sponsor a part of that hive!...

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the fun bit...

Leon and Ross will visit the Bees for Business farm in Lincolnshire to decorate the beehive (before we put the bees in it!) with a little help from street-art legend, Jim Vision! 

We'll film it so you can witness Ross, Leon and Jim unleash their creativity with their unique, super fly design. 

There are 4 ways you can get involved and be a part of making a real difference to the environment by donating and in return we're offering some super sweet, exclusive perks:

£10 - Leon and Ross will write your name on the hive

£25 - Leon and Ross will write your name on the hive and we'll send you a jar of the exclusive Too Many T's honey when it's harvested

£50 - Leon and Ross will write your name on the hive, we'll send you a jar of the exclusive Too Many T's honey from your hive AND they'll send you a signed T's vinyl.

£500 - Adopt your own hive, which Leon and Ross will decorate for you, include your name and send you signed Too Many T's merch as well as 24 jars of your hive's exclusive Too Many T's honey!

It costs about £500 to install a beehive with bees in it. Bees for Business are kindly donating their time for free to care for the bees and the additional maintenance and support costs.

If we raise more than £1,000 we're going to keep adding more bee hives! £1,500 and we'll install 3 beehives, £5,000 and we'll install 10 beehives! Hey, we might end up with our very own Too Many T's apiary!

And if that happens we'll be adding more perks including opportunities to meet us and visit the bees in person. It's over to you...

The Impact

You get to be a part of something truly unique - an environmental project owned and championed by you. Too Many T's want to bring our fans together to act on a cause we passionately believe in that impacts us all.

Let's not wait for the Government or someone else to do something about it - let's make the world a better place together - NOW.

It's a really simple process:

1. You donate towards our goal.

2. Bees for Business build a beehive from sustainably sourced, English cedar and provide the honeybees on their organic farm in Lincolnshire.

3. Ross and Leon will take a day out to the farm to decorate the hive and add the names of everyone who contributes to the hive design!

4. Bees for Business will add the bees and look after the hive for us all, sending video and photo updates to us, which we'll share with you all on social. At the end of the season they'll harvest the honey and we'll send you a jar of the delicious sweet stuff - 100% British and raw, made by bees in the countryside!

 

Are Bees Really That Important?

In 1900 a census of beekeepers revealed there were around 1 million honeybee hives in the UK.

In 2017 that number was around 220,000.

More recently, on 12th April 2018, The Independent newspaper revealed the decline in bees is putting the supply of raw materials for businesses at risk and honeybees are responsible for providing us with one third of the food we eat. They pollinate crops for food, biofuel, habitat for nature and flowers in the beautiful world we live. 

Too Many T's are working with Bees for Business, bee farmers committed to installing 250 more honeybee hives here in England over the next 5 years and sowing 250 acres of unused land with organic, bee-friendly flower seeds.

They care for bees for some of the most iconic brands in Britain, including: ‘The Ned’ hotel, 'Nobu Hotel Shoreditch', Michelin-star ‘Restaurant Story’ in London and installed and manage the new apiary at Burghley House in Stamford.

The beehive adoption plans that Bees for Business offer are helping to reverse the decline of the honeybee, whilst simultaneously encouraging corporate social responsibility, all while providing our customers with their own-brand, 100% British, artisan, raw honey. 

 

The Humans Behind the Bees: Ethical, Artisan Bee Keepers

Jez, the beekeeper who owns Bees for Business, say "we don't 'keep' bees; we care for them. We don't clip the queen's wings (so if they want to swarm, they can do, demonstrating natural behaviours) and we practice ethical beekeeping".

With bees come a number of additional benefits, which by supporting his campaign, you'll be helping to support:

The team at Bees for Business provide employment and rehabilitation opportunities in gardening, beekeeping and honey processing for adults with educational and social needs; those recovering from stroke or mental health crisis. 

They are champions for British, raw honey - it's completely unlike supermarket honey and converts almost all people who think they don't like honey!

Championing innovative British farming: like a lot of historical practices operating in a modern world, farming is having to change. This is our way of uniting society with nature and making a positive difference for both.

story:
What is OpenHive? 

OpenHive is a beekeeping business and community dreamt up by Kyle Petrie and Mark Earley, two beekeepers based in Dublin, Ireland. The focus of OpenHive is  to strengthen the population of the local Irish honeybee, the Apis Mellifera Mellifera, and to sustainably produce local Irish honey.

Here at OpenHive, we want to help secure the survival of our native Irish honeybee and to help build the honey community. We have a bee-centric approach to beekeeping. Bees are the focus while honey and other produce are byproducts of keeping the native Irish bees thriving. We combine modern and sustainable techniques with the traditional art of keeping bees. 

With your help we are planning to expand our current Irish bee stocks in the spring of 2020 which would double our hive numbers, introducing nearly half a million new Irish bees by mid-summer.

 

What Do We Need?

Our target is €8,000. While the bees are the focus of our passion it is the honey and the sale thereof that will keep OpenHive active and able to grow. Below is an outline of what we intend to spend our funds on.

  • 15 hives & hive stands
    • These hives will last approximately 30 years 
    • They will include all working parts of a hive from wax foundation to mouse guards and back again
  • Building OpenHive infrastructure 
    • Harvesting equipment
    • Processing equipment

 

What Will You Get? 

We have lots of physical rewards, including wax candles and Irish honey, but the focus for us is the long-lasting benefit to the local habitat that your backing will provide. Sponsoring a hive will introduce up to 40,000 black Irish bees into the ecosystem!

 

The Impact

OpenHive is all about helping the bee population here in Ireland flourish. This campaign will allow us to breed and rear up to half a million bees. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Our goal is scalable. Reaching our goal would be fantastic but if we don't reach it we will still be working hard to help the local bee in her habitat. OpenHive is committed to the goal of supporting Irish honeybees and that will not change! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would ask that you please share this link with friends and colleagues. If your company are looking to do something different maybe they would like to sponsor a hive. All the usual sharing tools are available vis Indiegogo. We really appreciate your support!

story:
Story

Hey, my name is Vladi, I’m author of Garbie in Consumerland. Story of this project began when I was elite agent representing famous fashion models. My conscience was uneasy because this activity forced people to buy a lot of rubbish (they don’t really need) and feel inadequate about own appearance and long list of other things. One day I couldn’t carry on it and quit. 

My previous life in overstuffed world of fashion inspired me to write a script unfolding in world of rubbish, which emerged on the ruins of our world after it had drowned in own consumption. My idea is to use real garbage for the setting of this world and animate it in stop motion. It imitates potential reality, as tragedy has already happened and we just film documentary. 

I live in Kiev Ukraine, it’s still undeveloped country where issue of pollution and proper waste management is very urgent. Group of fantastic people and eco activists united around my idea to bring it to life. For several months we have been collecting garbage on the streets of our city, building from it Consumerland and animating.

Story reveals destiny of Garbie who choose the wrong path in life and got lost in dense forrest of various rubbish. While story unfolds Garbie discovers that she is on the path to plastic grave. Style of animation uses elements of horror films to terrify with plastic pollution. This is contemporary fairy tale which educates children and adults about present day forms of threats and evils. 

What We Need & What You Get

Production of quality content aiming for global impact requires professional staff and sophisticated equipment. So far we were able to rise money from our close friends. Their funding got us to the final stage of production. At the moment we lack comparatively little amount to complete it. We need your help for final push. Any contribution is valuable for us, multiple drops of water create an ocean. 

The Impact

Since Garbie in Consumerland is story without words, it has global potential to connect with most marginalized communities that need to hear the massage most. It’s composed of familiar cultural elements like classic fairy tales and pop icons and speaks on familiar language with people of various ages and nationalities, educating them about danger of plastic and creates intolerance to all forms of pollution, encourages to live in balance with nature, consume responsible and recycle. 

In order to make impact on max audience, animation will be presented on prestigious movie/animation festivals than posted online where everyone can watch it for free. 

We feel like we can put surprising twist on many other stories and we are going to produce new episodes in future. Next one is going to tell the story of Garbie in Polluted Ocean inhibited by plastic sharks and other scary creatures. Our goal is to create collection of fairy tales about modern day good and evil.

 

Risks & Challenges

We evaluate the art, not in money, but in impact which it does for people, therefore we want to give it for free to everybody. However production is very expensive. If people find value in our art, they may contribute into production to make it possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can do recycle and consume less plastic in your everyday life. If you can't help raise money for the project, you can at least talk  about plastic pollution problems, share the link or join our volonteer movement
story_txt:
Story
Hey, my name is Vladi, I’m author of Garbie in Consumerland. Story of this project began when I was elite agent representing famous fashion models. My conscience was uneasy because this activity forced people to buy a lot of rubbish (they don’t really need) and feel inadequate about own appearance and long list of other things. One day I couldn’t carry on it and quit. 
My previous life in overstuffed world of fashion inspired me to write a script unfolding in world of rubbish, which emerged on the ruins of our world after it had drowned in own consumption. My idea is to use real garbage for the setting of this world and animate it in stop motion. It imitates potential reality, as tragedy has already happened and we just film documentary. 
I live in Kiev Ukraine, it’s still undeveloped country where issue of pollution and proper waste management is very urgent. Group of fantastic people and eco activists united around my idea to bring it to life. For several months we have been collecting garbage on the streets of our city, building from it Consumerland and animating.
Story reveals destiny of Garbie who choose the wrong path in life and got lost in dense forrest of various rubbish. While story unfolds Garbie discovers that she is on the path to plastic grave. Style of animation uses elements of horror films to terrify with plastic pollution. This is contemporary fairy tale which educates children and adults about present day forms of threats and evils. 

What We Need & What You Get
Production of quality content aiming for global impact requires professional staff and sophisticated equipment. So far we were able to rise money from our close friends. Their funding got us to the final stage of production. At the moment we lack comparatively little amount to complete it. We need your help for final push. Any contribution is valuable for us, multiple drops of water create an ocean. 

The Impact
Since Garbie in Consumerland is story without words, it has global potential to connect with most marginalized communities that need to hear the massage most. It’s composed of familiar cultural elements like classic fairy tales and pop icons and speaks on familiar language with people of various ages and nationalities, educating them about danger of plastic and creates intolerance to all forms of pollution, encourages to live in balance with nature, consume responsible and recycle. 
In order to make impact on max audience, animation will be presented on prestigious movie/animation festivals than posted online where everyone can watch it for free. 
We feel like we can put surprising twist on many other stories and we are going to produce new episodes in future. Next one is going to tell the story of Garbie in Polluted Ocean inhibited by plastic sharks and other scary creatures. Our goal is to create collection of fairy tales about modern day good and evil.
 

Risks & Challenges
We evaluate the art, not in money, but in impact which it does for people, therefore we want to give it for free to everybody. However production is very expensive. If people find value in our art, they may contribute into production to make it possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help
You can do recycle and consume less plastic in your everyday life. If you can't help raise money for the project, you can at least talk  about plastic pollution problems, share the link or join our volonteer movement

story:
NEWS UPDATE on Fund Raising:

GOAL #1:  ACCOMPLISHED!  We're now 100% funded for the TV ADS goal of $9700!  This campaign of 3 Public Service Announcement TV ads will inspire people to vote for a transition to clean energy. This election year is all-important!  These ads will air in both Canada/2015, and in the US/2016.

GOAL #2:  PITCH to FUND any SHORTFALL.  Woohoo!  We are now 103% funded for the Documentary Pitch Fund of $4,800!  The Documentary Pitch Fund is earmarked for soliciting foundations & funding bodies to top up any crowd funding shortfall to ensure the documentary is funded to its completion.

GOAL #3:  MAKE the DOCUMENTARY,  $82,500.  This is the biggest phase of the project, and must be preceded by the first two.  The documentary, for air in Canada and the US, will inspire the confidence needed to gain the collective will to turn the tide.  And we must turn the tide now.


Waking the Frog: A One Hour Documentary and 3 x :30 second TV Ads

“Imagine an era of renewed prosperity that is underwritten by a job-creating economic stimulus and powered by abundant low-carbon energy sources.”      – Tom Rand, Waking the Frog

Your Support Will Help Us To:

  • Make 3 x :30 second TV Ads to promote solutions to Climate Change and encourage voters to make clean energy a priority in the upcoming Canadian and American elections.

  • Pitch foundations to top up the funding needed to make a one hour Documentary featuring Tom Rand.

  • Produce the one hour Documentary Waking the Frog, based on Tom Rand’s best selling book. This documentary is intended for air on mainstream TV in Canada and the US, and will focus on current solutions to Climate Change and their relatively small cost. Tom Rand’s message inspires and empowers people with the knowledge that we actually can transition to clean energy with confidence.

Climate Disruption is the most urgent issue humankind faces. Major action can no longer be delayed. We must move now.

Tom Rand is a galvanizing speaker whose book Waking the Frog  (9 weeks on the Globe & Mail's Best Seller List) outlines why we have been paralyzed about Climate Change, and how we can get unstuck and fix it. He uses the analogy of the frog in the pot of water – if you turn the heat up slowly, he doesn’t know enough to jump out until it’s too late. Tom takes us from helpless to hopeful by drawing a map to navigate us through a transition to clean energy that will cost us about a coffee and donut per person per week. Okay, he says, if we want to subsidize developing nations for a time, make that a coffee and 5 donuts per person per week. He frames the problem and the solution as insurance – we insure our homes and cars, so why not our environment, national safety, economic wellbeing, food security and the very survival of future generations? 



    My name is Barbara Bergen. In my 26 year career as a Line Producer and Executive Producer, I have never been so ignited to get a project on TV screens as I am now. A few weeks ago, Citizens’ Climate Lobby brought Tom Rand to Nelson, BC, where he spoke for an hour straight on the problems and solutions to climate change. People need to hear what he says, so we can find the collective will to avoid increasingly catastrophic weather events such as those we’ve seen lately, which are “just an appetizer” according to Rand.  Changing the outcome on global warming is possible. We just need to wake up and act. Rand shows us how.

    Tom Rand is simply the smartest guy in the room. With a BSc in electrical engineering, MSc in philosophy of science, an MA and PhD in philosophy, he is managing partner of the $30 million MaRS Cleantech Fund, and sits on the board of several clean energy companies and organizations. He parlays with other bright minds at Stanford University, MIT and NASA.  He developed Planet Traveler, a low carbon hotel project in downtown Toronto. It contains many innovative energy designs, such as a lighting system that consumes about the same amount of energy as a toaster – that’s for the entire hotel.  He is a highly informed and compelling speaker, with frankly the most important message to be heard at this point in our history. 


What We Need & What You Get

To get Rand's message out to a large enough audience, we need to get it onto mainstream television. The first stage is to create a campaign of Public Service Announcements (PSAs for short) for Citizens’ Climate Lobby, to publicize the main points that need to be acted upon immediately – this represents about 10% of the budget. Next is a Pitch initiative, about 5% of the budget, to pitch TV networks as well as funding bodies to cover any crowd funding shortfall. Once all the funding is in place, we will produce the documentary: Citizens’ Climate Lobby presents Waking the Frog, which comprises about 85% of the budget.

  • What do you get out of the bargain?  A chance to do what may well be the most important thing you've ever done. You'll be a hero.
  • If we don't reach our entire crowd funding goal, I will use whatever funds there are to first create the PSAs, then further the documentary project by soliciting completion funds from foundations. I have budgeted people and services at a sliding scale of pro bono to half their normal rates. Tom Rand has generously offered to be featured in the documentary pro bono – and if there is any money left from the budget for a fee, he will be donating it to Cape Farewell Canada, a charitable organization that brings artists, scientists and educators together to collectively engage the public on climate disruption and envision a resilient future.

If we act now, we can mitigate a very scary future not just for us, but for our children and grandchildren.


  • Tom Rand distills a very complex problem into concepts we can grasp. The result is a confidence that will mobilize us to link arms and fix it.
  • Al Gore and Leonardo Dicaprio started the conversation in 2006 and 2007. Rand takes the baton and completes the picture with present day solutions that will not only help us sidestep extreme weather events and economic hardships, but will usher in a new era of prosperity with clean energy and new jobs retrofitting it.
  • Rand has a unique capability for putting forward with clarity the steps we must take to shift our economy to clean energy.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is getting our governments to act. The province of BC has already enacted a carbon tax, with no economic downside. The proof is in: carbon fee and dividend is effective at reducing greenhouse gas emissions while still growing the economy. The Federal Election is coming up. We need to get the message out not just to the voting public, but to political candidates, demanding solid plans to effectively address climate change. We need a carbon tax, Green Bonds, and investment in clean energy.

  • As a Producer, I have brought literally hundreds of projects in on time and on budget.  I know how to do this.
  • The risk of doing nothing is unthinkable.  It's no longer an option.
  • The challenge is inspiring collaborative action. The one hour documentary Waking the Frog will paint the big picture. The Public Service Announcement ads will compel voters to elect politicians who pledge a transition to clean energy.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, please help by passing this on to others:

  • Get the word out to absolutely everyone you can, in Canada, the US, Australia and the UK, to help us raise funds to make the documentary and the PSA ads. Acting now is incredibly important – the threat is a nightmare, but there are real solutions to climate change.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools, and send this out to everyone you know, via Facebook, Twitter, and email. Let's go viral!
  • Join Citizens Climate Lobby, in Canada www.citizensclimatelobby.ca, or in the US www.citizensclimatelobby.org.

story:
"We Are Vegan" -music video project

 Let's create a music video that can carried the message for carried the message for our vegan movement. I wrote these lyrics last summer to the tune of Helen Reddy's famous song, "I am woman," and I've already gotten the lyrics approved by her music publisher.

  • We just need the $2500 licensing fee to use this melody.
  • I have musical friends ready & willing to help create a lively, impactful video. 
  • through social media, this video can reach millions of people and help them "get it," to understand why NOW is crucial to eat and-based. Survival of life on Earth depends on a oval change... Time is running out. 

if everyone reading this message donates $10, we'll raise the funds overnight  so please donate and SHARE  we can do this  we need to do this... For our own future and that of our children. Don't delay... All our lives are at stake.

Goal = $2500

 That's expressly for the licensing fee to the music publisher.

  •  Any additional funds raised will go towards the production costs of the music video, which will be kept to a minimum with all or mostly volunteer help. 

Donate today!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Food Security is fast becoming one of our biggest challenges worldwide. Irish Seed Savers need to pass on the traditional skills of saving  Open Pollinated  seeds from year to year; how to grow great nutritious food; how to plant and care for heritage orchards large and small. To do this we need your help. 

Irish Seed Savers is a charity based in Scarriff, County Clare, Ireland. We have been conserving heritage varieties of organic open pollinated vegetables seeds, flowers, herbs and grains on behalf of the people of Ireland since 1991 . We have over 600 seed varieties saved from extinction in our national Seed Bank. We also work to preserve heritage apple trees and have over 140 apple varieties and over 50 potato varieties  saved. We have taught hundreds of children and adults through our hugely successful workshops. The ripple effects of the seed saving community is growing worldwide! We welcome thousands of school children, families, gardeners, farmers, students, community groups and elders to our beautiful Visitor Centre in Scarriff.  They come to see our  seed gardens, orchards, native woodlands and our school garden. All come for inspiration, to learn more about food, where it comes from and more importantly how to grow it yourself.

Yet the problem is that not everyone can get to us, so we need to make this information available to all through the development of an e-learning programme of Irish Seed Savers Workshops.

It has been said that he who controls the seed controls life.. and it is true. All of our seeds at Irish Seed Savers are traditional Open Pollinated  seeds. This means that the next generation of seed remains constant and will contain a wide genetic diversity allowing it to adapt to new local environments, and to changes in climate. The majority of commercial seed  is F1 hybrid which must be purchased new each year in order to maintain uniformity and avoid genetic instability. Open Pollinated seed only needs to be purchased once, then saved year on year. If organisations such as ourselves fail to teach this, these special Open Pollinated  varieties will become extinct. 

It is this knowledge and these skills which we desperately want to make more available to everyone. EVEN BETTER, the income from these e-learning workshops will give us a more secure financial footing into the future so that we can keep on doing the important work we do. 

What We Need To Do

We would like to start with creating two e-learning workshops, with the intention of creating two every year for the next three years. Our present core workshops are:  

Seed Saving, giving gardeners basic skills to harvest and save seeds from harvest crops in their own gardens, to keep varieties going from year to year. This workshop includes basic botany, and lots of practical know how.

Creating an Orchard, covering choice of site, layout of orchard, choosing rootstocks, soil preparation, drainage, maintenance, health & disease, choosing varieties, soil health and pruning techniques. 

We need to raise €25,000 euro which will be used for initial research costs, videographer and editing costs, development, writing and scripting of our workshops for e-learning, support and back-up of the e learning workshops and the development of the next set of e-learning workshops. Anything we raise above our actual costs e-learning costs will be fed into the rest of our work. We are a not-for-profit organisation, so nothing goes to waste.

How You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute at this time, we would be very grateful if you could share our campaign via  Facebook , Twitter, YouTube 

Thank you SO MUCH!

story:
‘Five days to construct, five hours per week, food for life!’ 

 

The Morganic Nature Beds are an easily installed, multi-functional, modulated, urban farming system. They mimic nature with a hexagonal layout which has the greatest efficiency, for the least endeavour i.e. like the beehive shape. The raised vegetable beds — made from recycled plastic — are versatile and allow the natural ways to nurture our every day needs. 



Hi, I’m David Morgans, the creator of the Morganic Nature Beds. I’ve spent two decades understanding the way we work with urban lands; in landscaping and in housing, as well as living and working on farms. The outcome is a system which fills the need of consuming healthy and spiritually nutritious food. Modern society has lost its link to the natural ways. Morganic is here to help many people, in a simplistic, common-sense manner. The Nature Beds can be used in a small, inner city environment, or large gardens. Also, when the Nature Beds are manufactured, there will be a ‘How-to’ series on YouTube, explaining the design, construction and maintenance of your Morganic Garden, with ease. As we say:

‘Five days to construct, five hours per week, food for life!’


Morganic Layout - incorporating paths.


Below is a video showing the the three Stages of manufacture.


This Campaign’s intention is to fund the initial (Stage 1) products — from development of Industrial Design through to manufacture and sales — of the three sizes (1.2m, 1.8m, and 2.4m) Morganic Sleepers, Chicken Pens, Ponds, the Raised Beds which can also be used for Retaining Walls, and the Decking options. Any savings made, or extra funding (and initial sales) will extend to the final design and manufacture of Stage 2 products: Composts, Screens / Balustrades, Worm Farms, Seedling / Fodder Tables, Gazebos, Rabbit / Guinea Pig Coops, Sculptures, and, Table and Chairs. As growth allows, we’ll fund Stage 3: Garden Sheds, Electric Fencing, Bird Baths, Hammocks, Stepping Stones, Pizza Ovens, Lighting, Candelabras, Green Walls, Gabion Walls / Planters, Irrigation, Bees, and the soon-to-be famous, Maggot-labras, which looks like a Candelabra but it is a maggot farm for the fish and chickens. In the YouTube clip, these are initially explained but in the Morganic ‘Nature Beds’ PDF ebook, they are explained in great detail and provide immediate alternatives, pre-manufacture. 



Perks.


Your Contributions will be much appreciated, and I’m confident you’ll realise value-for-money with the Perk system that has been setup. They include;

$13 Perk - Morganic Gardens ‘Nature Beds’ PDF ebook. This book explains how the Nature Beds have evolved, many different design processes as well as examples, and initial construction ideas (pre-manufacture). This means one can design, construct and maintain their Morganic Garden. NB: This ebook will be shared on Drop Box, for it is too large for emails.

$144 Perk - Morganic Gardens ‘Nature Beds’ PDF ebook plus a Morganic Garden Design. When you send a Site Plan as well as a photo-or-two of your garden, we’ll come up with an individualised Morganic Garden Design. Within the ebook it explains what is needed for the Site Plan. NB: the designs will be similar to the Morganic Designs in the ebook. (Site Plan must be received by April 2016)

$233+ Perk - Morganic Gardens ‘Nature Beds’ PDF ebook, Morganic Garden Design, and 10% off your initial purchase. NB: 10% off up to the amount you have Contributed i.e. with a $300 Contribution, you get the ebook, a Morganic Garden Design and $300 off a $3000 purchase. With the ‘How-to’ videos, you’ll be able to build and maintain your Morganic Garden easily or, if you’re in Sydney, Australia, Morganic can build it for you. (must be claimed within 12 months of release date)


Morganic Garden Design - Jones Household


If the Goal of $64,000 isn't reached, then the money will go toward the Nature Bed Sleepers first, and then trickle down the Stage 1 Accessories as profits allow. 


Website Sales

Our website, morganicgardens.com, will have an application where you’ll be able to upload the current design of your house and garden, overlay a hexagonal layout to scale, choose the path width, and then click-and-drag a certain use for each hexagon. You will be able to design your Morganic Garden online, and then on the lower right of the screen, the Shopping Cart adds up the cost of the order. Another benefit of the Morganic Gardens system is the ability to stage the construction. This means you can have an overall design, but only build part. When funds or time allow, you can continue with your initial design. NB: there will be an option to have Morganic Gardens to check the design, for your peace-of-mind. 

Another design on morganicgardens.com will be for the individual Nature Bed Vege Gardens where you can design your vegetable garden plantings. Automatically companion plants (which help with pests and diseases) will be included into the design, then check your seed quantities, and order more if needed. Further to this, we will have a children's art design section, where children can type in their favourite vegetables, and then do funky designs, (where parents can add a few other vegetables if needed) the companion plants will be included, and the design can be planted out, so your children can aid in bringing their ‘living artwork’ into fruition. 

Another option for the Nature Bed Vege Gardens is the Crystal Gardens. In these designs you can choose a favourite crystal, and the inner geometries of that crystal will be placed into the hexagonal Nature Bed.  You choose the climate, the season, and different plants can be added to your Crystal Garden. There will also be Morganic Crystal Essences which can be purchased as to aid the connection to that specific crystal that you have chosen in the design. This strongly links one to the mineral kingdom, and the plant kingdom.



Where We Are Going

As a society I, and many others, sense great risk in the way we live our lives, especially in the so-called ‘First World!’ Great changes are needed and usually evolve through chaos; let’s nip issues in the bud now, so there’ll be less chaos. Let’s join together, grow food, and share the abundance that nature nurtures us with. Let’s re-unite families, friends, neighbours, and make the change. 

As Gandhi so eloquently put, ‘You must be the change that you wish to see in the world!’ 

For those who the Morganic Garden Designs won’t work for, then please share this Campaign, because one of your friends may be interested. You can do this on the below - Indiegogo share tool. 

When our ‘How-to’ series is uploaded, communities can use that information to lead toward self-sufficiency. We’re in this world together and, from every aspect in the way I see life, we’d be better off growing our own food. This will be at odds with corporate greed, which I’m comfortable with. 

All problems have an answer which our environment is constantly teaching us. If we simply allow nature to fill in the needs we have, we can work a system which is beneficial to all. 

Please place a seed in the ground as often as you can, and allow nature to nurture you. 


‘Five days to construct, five hours per week, food for life!’ 


Morganic on Facebook


morganicgardens.com





Morganic 'Nature Beds' by Crystal Gardens of Atlantis Pty Ltd
story_txt:
‘Five days to construct, five hours per week, food for life!’  

The Morganic Nature Beds are an easily installed, multi-functional, modulated, urban farming system. They mimic nature with a hexagonal layout which has the greatest efficiency, for the least endeavour i.e. like the beehive shape. The raised vegetable beds — made from recycled plastic — are versatile and allow the natural ways to nurture our every day needs.

story:
Fall 2015 -- Despite years of substantial community skepticism about and opposition to the project in Old Bethpage and Plainview, the Town of Oyster Bay on May 12, 2015 unanimously approved Country Pointe Plainview, which is now a massive complex that will overwhelm the local community with traffic and decimate the wildlife and forest on a 143-acre site near the LIE.

On June 10, 2015, a group of five neighbors on Round Swamp Road appeared in court on their own behalf and under the prodding of the Supreme Court judge hearing the case obtained agreement from the developer not to begin any work, or damage the environment in any way, pending a hearing on July 8, 2015.

The neighbors -- who are non-lawyers -- filed a massive Article 78 petition detailing and documenting blatant violations of the State Environmental Quality Review Act (SEQRA) by the Town, which downplayed and distorted the impacts of the project.

The lawsuit asks the court to overturn the zoning, site plan, and subdivision plans, and compel a new environmental review. It took a lot of work and that continues. 

There is much legal work to be done.

Now we also hope to obtain adequate funding for a "bond" as required by the Court for a Preliminary Injunction, if granted, to protect the site. 

Without the injunction, work may begin even while the lawsuit is pending! We do not know how much will be required yet, and will not know until the judge decides. 

Those issues are pending; for the moment the Court has extracted a temporary promise not to start work. But it may NOT be sufficient going forward and critical windows are approaching.  

Furthermore we may be looking for some legal assistance as we move forward and face the full weight of the developer's legal team as well as the Town's.

We need the help now of some of the HUNDREDS of P/OB residents and others concerned about the environment who testified, wrote letters or emails, and signed petitions against this project over the past few years.

The five-member plaintiffs group has already spent hundreds of their own dollars in this, and will spend more as we progress.

PLEASE HELP WITH A MODEST DONATION...You are investing in your own future too, if we can succeed. 

THANK YOU. 

PS Feel free to contact us at ProtectPOB (AT) Gmail DOT COM. (Note: We have broken up the address to thwart spam-harvesters. Thanks.)

story:
Short Summary

It has been estimated that one out of every three bites of food that you eat comes from a plant, vegetable, fruit, nut, or seed that ultimately relies on the role of bees in the ecosystem.

Between 2007 and 2013, more than 10 million beehives were lost in the United States, which is twice the normal rate of loss. This loss can be attributed to Colony Collapse Disorder (CCD), a phenomenon that has eluded scientists for years. Currently, we are on track for a complete wipeout of bees in the United States.

The money raised will go to the development of a bee sanctuary in Floyd, Virginia. The sanctuary will be established over seven (7) acres of donated land for the sanctuary and research center. The research center will be partnered with a satellite location at Whitebarrel Winery in Christiansburg, VA. With your help we will be able to accomplish three major goals:

(1)  Create a seven (7) acre bee sanctuary with the optimal placement of a minimum of 50 beehives through pasture and woodland.

(2)  Establish a research center for surrounding universities to study CCD, novel antimicrobial compounds to combat the spread of antibiotic resistance, and other bee research of high impact for science and the environment

(3)  Increase agrotourism in the surrounding county by hosting awareness and education seminars, training sessions, and ‘farm-days’ where we will collaborate with local meaderies, vendors, and musicians for family-friendly events and bee-festivals

What We Need & What You Get

Starting a bee sanctuary is by no means cheap! In fact, each hive cost approximately $1000 to establish, including all equipment and bees. This does not include the costs of maintaining the beehives, man-power, or the planting of bee-friendly, pollen- and nectar-rich trees and wildflowers. The funds raised through your generous support will be used for the following:

(1)  Establishment of a minimum of 50  beehives on seven (7) acres of land ($60,000)

(2)  Planting of bee-friendly, pollen- and nectar-rich trees and wildflowers ($25,000)

(3)  Maintenance equipment ($15,000)

Your help will not only contribute to repopulating the bee population in the United States, you will also be helping to set the foundation for a new research center for local universities to use and you’ll help by promoting agrotourism in the region. Additionally, you will receive the following benefits directly:

(a)  $25+: A “Save the Bees” pin and our gratitude

(b)  $50+: A tasting for two (2) people at Whitebarrel Winery, a “Save the Bees” pin, and our gratitude

(c)  $100+: 8oz jar of Sanctuary Honey, A VIP cellar tour for four (4) people at Whitebarrel Winery, a VIP Tour for four (4) people of the Bee Sanctuary (when established), a “Save the Bees” pin, and our gratitude

(d)  $500+: A bench named in your or another’s honor at the Bee Sanctuary, 32 oz. jar of Sanctuary Honey, a VIP cellar tour for four (4) people at Whitebarrel Winery, a VIP Tour for four (4) people of the Bee Sanctuary (when established), a “Save the Bees” pin, and our gratitude

(e)  $1,000+: An acknowledgment of your absolute awesomeness, a beehive named in your or another’s honor at the Bee Sanctuary, 25% of the honey produced by your beehive for a year, a VIP cellar tour for four (4) people at Whitebarrel Winery, a VIP Tour for four (4) people at the Bee Sanctuary (when established), a “Save the Bees” pin, and our gratitude

The Impact

The immediate impact of the bee sanctuary will be the dedication of a space and the people to protect and nurture the bees that make our diverse food sources a reality. Without them, we are in trouble!!

The longer term impact of the sanctuary is that it will provide a space for local, regional, and international scientists to come and research the terrifying phenomenon of CCD. It will also be a space where scientists can research the other amazing ways that bees can and do contribute to society, including the amazing antimicrobial properties of honey, which can help against the rapid and continuing spread of antimicrobial resistance!

Risks & Challenges

Any project always comes with risks, and the greatest risk for the sanctuary will be sustainability.

Our team includes both internationally recognized scientists, local community business, and farm wineries. Together we plan on creating a self-sustaining Bee Sanctuary and Research Center. Long term sustainment will be through the sale of honey, and goods made from bee-products, as well as funding for scientific research.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Help spread the word about our campaign and make some noise so the whole world learns about it!
