story:
Going with the Flow

I am Carol Fleitz.  My husband, Robert Six Owls, and I steward the Illuminated Heart Center of Venus Rising at Isis Cove, a place for healing on all levels.   I have 30 years experience as a professional horticulturist with design, installation and maintenance experience on public gardens.  In our 10 years together, Robert and I have renovated 5 properties, and are now lovingly caring for the three buildings we purchased from Brad Collins and Linda Star Wolf in May 2013, which are the foundation of the retreat center at Isis Cove. We have invested $182,000 of our savings into repairs, upgrades and operating expenses for this beloved retreat center.   We have drawn no salary from the retreat center's operations nor from the workshops offered by our congregation, Illuminated Heart Center of Venus Rising.

  • Going with the Flow at Isis Cove Campaign seeks to create a healing forest garden in place of the leaking Forgiveness Pond.    Over the years, water has been escaping the pond basin through fissures in the bedrock, necessitating frequent repairs in an attempt to seal these holes and stem the leaks.  Repairs lasted up  to 6 months before water found its way through another crack in the bedrock. Water levels dropped  precipitously leaving slippery exposed banks, exposed drain pipe and a muddy pond. The community has decided to "go with the flow" that Mother Nature suggests by transforming Forgiveness Pond to into a sparkling free flowing stream surrounded and imbued with interactive areas for enjoying the stream and surrounding gardens. In order to do that, professional excavators, construction personnel to create proper drainage and grading, add boulders to create cascades in the stream, build a gazebo over the stream, and bring in flora known for their suitability to the area and magical healing properties. the land. The healing power of this land will be enhanced by the sounds of fresh cascading water and lush flora. 

  • With your help, the Going with the Flow Campaign is transforming the land into a natural stream design with boulder strewn spillways.  Throughout the area there will be lovely new gathering spaces including a gazebo.  Additional funding above the goal will  purchase additional river rock, boulders, trees, shrubs, perennials, birdhouses, mulch, stepping stones, wind chimes, and a fern grotto, 

$18,900 total will create the stream and gazebo.  

The following generous supporters have donated so far, $18897.79; 

Amai Clarice Munchus, Anna Cariad-Barrett, Audrey Robinson, Aura Bee Cleveland, Barb Westover, Ben Gandy, Benjamin Bernstein, Bonnie Rubinstein, Carol Fleitz, Deb Irestone, Dennis and Judith Corvin-Blackburn, Diana Kenney, Dr. Tina Driscoll(Elona), Irwin Gandy, Isis Cove Residence Association, Nancy Hannah-Fey Daniel, Jacob Rakowski, Jade Osborne, Jax Ranger, John Deakyne, John Hooks, Karen Smith, Kathy Morrison, Laura Wolf, Lesley Jackson-Whalen, Lilian Montrose, Nancy Jenkins, Pat SheeWho Cummins, Paul Henderson, Ruby Falconer, Sabine Haynes, Sacred Flame, Sarah Jane Fridy, Sara Claire Curran, Sarah Christine O'Rourke, Lynn Villa, Linda Star Wolf, Lisa Whittenton, Mariko Yamamoto, Sacred Spirals Community of Venus Rising, Shen Pauley, Stephanie Seker, Tamaya Lowinske, Tammy Anderson, Ursa Wolf, Victoria June Looper, Windraven, and 4 anonymous donors.

 We are just $2.21 shy of the amount needed for the gazebo and stream creation.  All additional funds that come in beyond the goal will be used in their entirety to create the therapeutic garden/ healing forest in the area surrounding the stream and gazebo and sacred sites beyond.  Please contribute now to make this healing forest/ spirit garden a beauty.
The Sacred Spirals Spiritual Community contributed to this Campaign.  Please all Blue Star Circles, Venus Rising Congregations, Shamanic Ministers, and Shamanic Breathwork Facilitators,  follow Sacred Spirals lead;  contribute to create this therapeutic garden that will increase the rate and efficacy of healing for all those who experience it.
Here are the details 
  • What does the $18,900 fund? The earth moving that will take the pond dam soil to fill in the edge of the pond and fashion the stream bank.  Rocks will line the 2 springs and the waterway that flow into the area. The waterline crossing the dam will be re-run to fit it within the new soil line of the area.  Large boulders will be staged to create spillways and sound effects in the stream.  A gazebo will span the stream. 
  • There are numerous perks for different donation levels.
  • Any money that comes in above and beyond the original $18,900 goal will be used to create walkways, seating areas, and gardens surrounding the new stream and gazebo..

The creation of the stream at Isis Cove will add to the allure and healing that attracts people here to do their deep inner work and find healing on all levels: 

  • Creating a beautiful riparian garden that helps draw people here and aids in their healing will enhance the speed of recovery from physical, emotional and spiritual ills.   It is through the cathartic healing work done at this cove, that people release aggression, relax racial, political, gender, and spiritual prejudices, become global citizens, and develop ecological sensitivity for the Earth.  
  • My love of the earth and innate skill in horticulture has led to more than 30 years of manifesting beautiful gardens and renovating areas to create greater  functionality and beauty.  Please join me in recreating this healing space, to make it a beacon to those seeking healing.
  • All donations to the Go with the Flow Campaign will be used entirely for the conversion of the pond to stream, gazebo and surrounding gardens and hardscapes.  None of the funds will go toward salaries or bonuses for Robert or myself.

Risks & Challenges

The start time must be delayed as the total funds accumulated too late to start the project before the Spring workshop push. The area will remain under construction during the very busy spring months when the cove is visited by the highest numbers of people.

Isis Cove has been a place for trans-formative healing for many people over the years.    Please support this fundraising campaign and help make the center of this healing community look lovely and feel fantastic.  

More than money will help with this campaign.  Below are additional ways you can contribute: 

  • Please spread the word to your friends, family and neighbors about Going with the Flow fundraising campaign for Illuminated Heart Center of Venus Rising at Isis Cove. 
  • Please share this campaign with 5(or more ;) people.
  • After the land construction is complete, plants will be needed for this project.  Some of the plants that we need to grace this area are: Blue or purple Iris ensata – Japanese Iris, Thelypteris normalis –Southern Shield Fern, Rhododendrons, Native Azaleas, or other leafy ones you would like to contribute to this new garden, please do.   Mulch and wildflower seed will also be needed once the project is complete.  Stain will be needed for the Gazebo.  Additionally, we hope to grace the area with river rocks, wind chimes, bird houses, flag stones, etc.
story_txt:
Going with the Flow
I am
     Carol Fleitz.  My husband, Robert Six Owls, and I steward the Illuminated Heart Center of Venus Rising at Isis Cove, a place for healing on all levels.   I have 30 years experience as a professional horticulturist with design, installation and maintenance experience on public gardens.  In our 10 years together, Robert and I have renovated 5 properties, and are now lovingly caring for the three buildings we purchased from Brad Collins and
     Linda Star Wolf in May 2013, which are the foundation of the retreat center at Isis Cove. We have invested $182,000 of our savings into repairs, upgrades and operating expenses for this beloved retreat
     center.   We have drawn no salary
     from the retreat center's operations nor from the workshops offered by our
     congregation, Illuminated Heart Center of Venus Rising.




Going with the Flow at Isis Cove Campaign seeks to create a healing forest garden in place of the leaking Forgiveness Pond.    Over the years, water has been escaping the pond basin through fissures in the
     bedrock, necessitating frequent
     repairs in an attempt to seal these holes and
     stem the leaks.  Repairs lasted up  to 6 months before water found
     its way through another crack in the bedrock. Water levels dropped  precipitously leaving slippery exposed banks, exposed drain pipe and a muddy pond. The community has decided to "go
     with the flow" that Mother Nature suggests by transforming Forgiveness
     Pond to into a sparkling free flowing stream surrounded and imbued with interactive areas for enjoying the stream and surrounding gardens. In order to do
     that, professional excavators, construction personnel to create proper drainage and grading, add boulders to create cascades in the stream, build a gazebo over the stream, and bring in flora known for their suitability to the area and magical healing properties. the land. The healing power of this land will be enhanced by the sounds of fresh cascading water and
     lush flora. 


With
     your help, the Going with the Flow Campaign is transforming the
     land into a natural stream design with boulder strewn spillways.  Throughout the area there will be lovely new gathering
     spaces including a gazebo.  Additional funding above the goal will  purchase additional river rock, boulders, trees, shrubs, perennials, birdhouses, mulch, stepping stones, wind chimes, and a fern grotto, 



$18,900 total will create the stream and gazebo.  
The following generous supporters have donated so far, $18897.79; 
Amai Clarice Munchus, Anna Cariad-Barrett, Audrey Robinson, Aura Bee Cleveland, Barb Westover, Ben
Gandy, Benjamin Bernstein, Bonnie Rubinstein, Carol Fleitz, Deb Irestone, Dennis and Judith
Corvin-Blackburn, Diana Kenney, Dr. Tina Driscoll(Elona), Irwin Gandy, Isis Cove Residence Association, Nancy
Hannah-Fey Daniel, Jacob Rakowski, Jade Osborne, Jax Ranger, John Deakyne, John Hooks, Karen Smith, Kathy
Morrison, Laura Wolf, Lesley Jackson-Whalen, Lilian Montrose, Nancy Jenkins, Pat SheeWho Cummins, Paul Henderson, Ruby Falconer, Sabine Haynes, Sacred Flame, Sarah Jane Fridy, Sara Claire Curran, Sarah Christine O'Rourke, Lynn Villa, Linda Star Wolf, Lisa Whittenton, Mariko Yamamoto, Sacred Spirals Community of Venus Rising, Shen Pauley, Stephanie Seker, Tamaya Lowinske, Tammy Anderson, Ursa Wolf, Victoria June Looper, Windraven, and 4 anonymous
donors. We are just $2.21 shy of the amount needed for the gazebo and stream creation.  All additional funds that come in beyond the goal will be used in their entirety to create the therapeutic garden/ healing forest in the area surrounding the stream and gazebo and sacred sites beyond.  Please contribute now to make this healing forest/ spirit garden a beauty.
The Sacred Spirals Spiritual Community contributed to this Campaign.  Please all Blue Star Circles, Venus Rising Congregations, Shamanic Ministers, and Shamanic Breathwork Facilitators,  follow Sacred Spirals lead;  contribute to create this therapeutic garden that will increase the rate and efficacy of healing for all those who experience it.
Here are the details 


What does the $18,900 fund? The earth moving that will take the pond dam soil to fill in the edge of the
     pond and fashion the stream bank.  Rocks will line the 2 springs and the waterway that flow into the area. The waterline crossing the dam will be re-run to fit it within the new soil line of the area.  Large boulders will be staged to create
     spillways and sound effects in the stream.  A gazebo will span the stream. 
There
     are numerous perks for different donation levels.
Any money that comes in above and beyond the original $18,900 goal will be used to create walkways, seating areas, and gardens surrounding the new stream and gazebo..

Creating
     a beautiful riparian garden that helps draw
     people here and aids in their healing will enhance the speed of recovery from physical, emotional and spiritual ills.
  It
     is through the cathartic healing work done at this cove, that people release aggression, relax racial, political, gender, and spiritual
     prejudices, become global citizens, and develop ecological sensitivity for the Earth.  


My love
     of the earth and innate skill in horticulture has led to more than 30 years of manifesting beautiful gardens and
     renovating areas to create greater  functionality and beauty.  Please join me in recreating this
     healing space, to make it a beacon to those seeking healing.
All

story:
Can an App Start a Revolution?

 

Why an APW App?

In 2012 the concept for starting AParallelWorld.com didn’t seem controversial. In fact, at that time it seemed obvious that providing current facts and real news about sustainable living was a good thing. The APW team wasn’t trying to start a revolution. To us, it seemed a “no brainer.” What average American wouldn’t appreciate a one-stop website that provided a clear path to a healthier, more affordable, greener lifestyle?

 

And so, we built the APW site to do just that. As a result, thousands of you have become part of the APW family because you’re eager to learn as much as you can about saving money while helping to care for Mother Earth. You’ve learned to rely on APW to spread the news about alternatives that don’t fit the fossil-fueled corporate narrative. Many of you now take advantage of the APW site to find information, bonuses and discounts from our green vendors.

 

In starting this project, we never dreamed that providing honest facts about sustainable living might be considered revolutionary. But that was before Trump and his minions came into power. That was before the 45th president installed climate-change deniers as heads of the very institutions created to protect our environment. As a result, a goodly portion of the Right Wing sees America’s desire for “sustainability” as an existential threat.

 

The Revolution on Your Smart Phone

Truth be told, you might think your life was threatened too, if you believe it depends on America staying addicted — addicted to oil, gasoline, toxic products, too-big-to-fail-banks, GMOs, and a corporate-controlled Mainstream Media. Like you, our APW team members are fed up with these mega corporations controlling our lives as well as our government. The moment for an economic revolution has arrived and true to the times it’s coming as an app.

 

APW’s job is to tell you about affordable alternatives that are better for you and the planet. APW works hard shouting out the message about the healthier, cleaner, better-for-local-economies alternatives that are available today. However, given today’s grim political reality, the team now believes we need to reach more people quicker than ever. We believe that “sustainably” is patriotic because it helps move the center of political balance back to regular Americans like us.

 

 

First the Video…

Our first effort to spread the APW message as far and as fast as we could was to create this 2-minute video, “Jumping the Track from Corporate Control to Economic Democracy”. Within two days after its launch early this year the APW site came under a blistering cyber attack by fossil fuel trolls and bots with Russian addresses. Although that attack hurt the launch of the video we didn’t give up. We rebuilt our security and re-launched it. As of now over 350,000 (and counting) people have watched it on Facebook alone.

 

…Then the App

People are beginning to wake up and realize that if they want their kids to have any kind of a livable planet they need to act now. It’s time to stop supporting dirty industries that buy our government. It’s time to make the APW strategy available to everyone who’s ready to shake off the 19th century technologies still holding power over our everyday lives.

 

Every time you use the APW App you’ll be conducting your own little “media revolt.” All three applications from the APW website will be at your fingertips. Users will receive a weekly update every Thursday from APW’s writers and editors. You’ll have access to the Parallel Strategy, showing you how to live healthy, save money and start to protect the planet. And you’ll have access to APW’s exclusive marketplace and the bonuses and discounts offered by our green vendors.

 

An App for You, Your Family and the Environment

All of our vendors are pledged to provide APW members with discounts and bonuses for their goods and services from the following six categories and their 25 sub-categories —

 

Home Energy

•             Home weatherization & Insulation

•             Energy Efficient Appliances

•             Energy Efficient Lighting

•             Solar Equipment Installed

•             Solar Equipment Shipped

•             Wind Energy Providers

•             Eco-Realtors

•             Green Contractors

 

Transportation

•             Electric Plug-in & Hybrid Vehicles

•             Bicycles

•             Biofuels

 

Food Security

•             Organic Products & Markets

•             CSA & Urban Farming

•             Community & Home Gardening

•             Farm-to-Table Restaurants

 

Personal Products

•             Personal Care & Wellness

•             Household Supplies

•             Natural Clothing

•             Product Reuse

 

Independent Media

•             Electronic Media & Social Media

•             Independent Publishing & Bookstores

•             Independent Broadcasting

 

My Money

•             Local Credit Unions & Banks

•             Socially Responsible Investment

•             Non-Profit Financial Services

 

It’s true — there’s a lot of information to digest to figure out the smartest, most efficient was to live sustainably. APW was created to help the Average American figure it out.

 

Doing it Together

And we need your help to get America to its “tipping point” of sustainability as quickly as possible. With your help, we can build an APW App that leverages the free market to uproot the fossil fuel economy and its control over our lives. This APW App will put the Parallel Strategy for sustainable living at your fingertips. With a couple of clicks on a mobile device everyone can access resources around the nation that offer discounts and bonuses on green products.

 

Just as important, the APW App will help you track when new sustainable technologies become available to the mass market. And, in spite of our corrupt administration, the APW App will help restore America’s leadership in the fight against climate change. We can’t do this alone. We need your help.

story:
The funds we are raising for the Protect Our Public Lands Tour (July 19-29) will go towards chartering a van to visit frontline communities from California to Philadelphia, documenting the stories of Native American community members working hard to transition from toxic energy industries to a just and renewable energy future.

Many Native American communities, inhabiting tribal lands that are adjacent to public lands exploited by fracking, are among those at the front-lines experiencing the impacts of fracking, and are also among those speaking out against such extreme forms of extraction.

Your support will enable a Navajo/Hopi film crew to document the tour and create an educational film. It will also allow community members to join us for the final stretch to Philadelphia and participate in the "March for a Clean Energy Revolution," which is to rally for the “Protect Our Public Lands Act” (POPLA). If passed by the U.S. Congress, this Act will stop all fracking on U.S. public lands. The tour is also being organized for story sharing and outreach for the International Peoples’ Tribunal on the Human rights implications of unconventional fossil fuel development, which will be held in 2017.

Please contribute to our fundraising campaign by Wednesday, June 22. With a $20 donation, you will be credited in the film; with a $100, you will receive a free DVD of the film.

This is a project of the Livelihoods Knowledge Exchange Network (LiKEN). When you donate, please note that you will receive a confirmation email from the Kentucky Environmental Foundation, which serves as LiKEN's fiscal sponsor. Your donation is tax-deductible. 
For more information, contact Julie Maldonado (LiKEN’s Director of Research), research@likenknowledge.org, or visit our website: http://www.likenknowledge.org/

With your support, we can ignite the shift to a just and renewable energy future together!

story:
To view photos of perks please scroll down

Short Summary

My name is SuZen, and I’m a NYC designer and photographer. I am thrilled to share my newest creation, the JacCAT™.  Inspired by my feline friends, the JacCAT™ is the purrrfect synthesis of all the things I love – photography, design, cats and fashion. 

JacCAT’s unique design features a large, bold silhouette of a black cat fastened with 3 magnets. It's made from 100% imported cotton from Japan and manufactured of the highest quality in the New York City's garment district. JacCAT is truly the Cat’s Meow!

Here's actress, comedian, author, Annabelle Gurwitch, modeling the JacCAT. 

Here's the JacCAT in Red & Black - great for the holidays!

Three of my loves—cats, photography, and design—came together first in my 1990 book, "The Love Story of Sushi and Sashimi, A Cat Tale," published by Capra Press. Since then, I added fashion, producing lines of clothing, scarves, bags and notecards, which are sold in fine boutiques throughout the country.
Many New Yorkers know my work, as my photograph, "Flowing Light", is a 40’ x 25’ painted mural in Times Square, funded by the NYSCA. 

Over the years, I’ve exhibited my photography internationally in museums and galleries and multi-media installations in many public spaces, such as JFK Airport, World Trade Center, and the Port Authority Bus Terminal. 

What We Need & What You Get

The basic costs of bringing this product to market are about $10,000.00. The complicated process of manufacturing clothing calls for many services and purchases upfront. More cash on hand makes it possible to buy materials and do production in quantity, lowering the cost of goods sold. Before the first JacCAT™ can be assembled, there are many expenses, such as the design and manufacturing of numerous samples, labels and care tags that go in each jacket. Pattern makers need to grade the design for sizes, and then highly skilled cutters will turn bolts of fabric into the pieces that will be sewn together by workers in a factory located in the heart of the NYC garment district.

Once the product exists, marketing requires many other expenses. Just a few of them are printing and distributing promotional materials, and reserving spaces at events like CatCon and traveling to work the shows. And as anyone who produces unique products can tell you, there are also costs in advance of everything—to trademark, license, and protect original creations. The difference between success and failure often depends on the size of your advertising budget. The more cash there is on hand, the greater the potential for ultimate success. 


The Impact

When you support the JacCAT™ project, you are backing entrepreneurship, work for Americans, an independent artist/designer, and care for cats without homes—and you’re facilitating a product that will be attractive to buyers who love cats.

The world is full of people who adore cats, as the Internet makes clear. The JacCAT™ is my most recent design in a series of products that appeal to cat lovers everywhere, which began with the CatWrap™, a sleek bodysuit patented and produced in the ‘90s.

Corporate manufacturers have deep pockets, but they will make their products cheaply in third world countries to increase their profit margins, unconcerned about job loss at home. This project is a small step towards keeping jobs in America, and the creation of something affordable that combines art and function for an enthusiastic demographic of Cat Lovers.

I have been making art, designing, and producing products for over 30 years. As the costs of living, production, and marketing have escalated in recent years, it has become harder to implement a project without investor support. Campaigns like this enable supporters to decide what gets to market, giving donors a chance to affect consumer options.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks when you launch a product, although clever marketing and targeting the right demographics reduce the risks inherent in production. While it may be harder to wholesale the JacCAT™ to retail stores, which need to triple or quadruple the price to cover their own operating expenses, the risks are minimized when using direct marketing through cat conventions, an online store, or advertising in cat-related publications. The more we can raise for an advertising campaign, the fewer the risks.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might not have money to spare, but you can still make an important contribution to this campaign! Pass the word along on social media, and tell your cat-loving friends about our project. Word of mouth is really important, and to everyone who uses the Indiegogo tools to help promote this campaign, thank you so much!

Perks -

There are wonderful perks I am offering for your help to manufacture the JacCAT™ and to bring it to market, Since I haven't figured out how to add the images to perk section, I'm giving you a preview of them here.

NEW PERK!

PRE-PRINTING SPECIAL
pre-order – your Ari-Gato T-shirt

offer ends Sunday, Sept 18
only $20 - save $5

New Printing Technique - DISCHARGE
DISCHARGE method removes the shirt's dye – leaving it soft.
100% black cotton shirts
Available in male and female sizes: S, M, L, XL

offer ends Sunday, Sept 18
only $20 - save $5

_____________________________________________________________________

Ari-Gato Tote Bag
Ari+Gato design is printed on both sides of this ECO friendly tote bag. It measures 12" x 13."5 x 7" and holds up to 30 pounds.

_______________________________________________________________

The Love Story of Sushi & Sashimi: A Cat Tale" book
This book shows SuZen's 2 Siamese cats, Sushi and Sashimi, frolicking in her Greenwich Village studio.  Each cat  tells their experience of how they meet and fell in love. Photographed by SuZen; written by John Daniel, and published by Capra Press,  It's truly a delight for any Cat Lover.

_______________________________________________________________

Cats + Flowers notecards with envelops
Can get 2 cards or the set of six  5" x 7" Cats + Flowers notecards. Siamese cats, Sushi and Sashimi, elegantly posed with flowers on a white background. Notecards are blank inside and come in a box. Photos by SuZen.

________________________________________________________________

 T-shirts
Receive a short sleeved T-shirt - either Gato or Sashimi in a window
- available in S, M, L, XL in male and female sizes.

Get 2 T-shirts & a FREE autographed"The Love Story of Sushi & Sashimi: A Cat Tale."

________________________________________________________________

ARI-GATO Scarf 
This exquisite scarf of silhouettes of SuZen's black cats, Ari and Gato, is made of 100% silk chiffon, measures 12" x 63 and signed with SuZen's red signature. 

___________________________________________________________________

sKAT-mono

New to the collection is the sKAT-mono. The sKAT-mono combines the look of a kimono with the diversity of  a scarf.  The bold graphic image of my cat, Gato, is held in place with a hidden button. 100% silk charmeuse, 12" x 60".

_______________________________________________________________
JacCAT™ - the Jacket for Cat Lovers
This cool, unique jacket of SuZen's bold black cat cutout design is inspired by her cat Ari. It fastens with 3 magnets, made of 100% cotton imported from Japan and is manufactured in the heart of  NYC garment district.
Now available in Red+Black.

__________________________________________________________________

Photograph, framed and signed by SuZen
11" x 14" and 16" x 20" photo of the cover of The Love Story of Sushi and Sashimi: A Cat Tale,  framed and signed by SuZen.

______________________________________________________________

Visit SuZen in her Greenwich Village studio

Have lunch with SuZen and her cat, Gato in her Westbeth artist studio in the heart of Greenwich Village – and receive a JacCAT™, scarf, and personally signed "The Love Story of Sushi and Sashimi" book. Afterwards, SuZen will take you on a tour of the Westbeth Artist Housing, the Hudson River Park and the HighLine in the Meat Packing district.

story_txt:
To view photos of perks please scroll down
Short Summary

My name
is SuZen, and I’m a NYC designer and photographer. I am thrilled to share my newest creation, the JacCAT™.  Inspired by my feline friends, the JacCAT™ is the purrrfect synthesis of all the things I love – photography, design, cats and fashion. 
JacCAT’s unique design features a large, bold silhouette of a black
cat fastened with 3 magnets. It's made from 100%
imported cotton from Japan and manufactured of the highest quality in the New York City's garment district. JacCAT is truly the Cat’s Meow!
Here's actress, comedian, author, Annabelle Gurwitch, modeling the JacCAT. 


Here's the JacCAT in Red & Black - great for the holidays!


Three of my loves—cats, photography, and design—came together first in my 1990 book, "The Love Story of Sushi and Sashimi, A Cat Tale," published by Capra Press. Since then, I added fashion, producing lines of clothing, scarves, bags and notecards, which are sold in fine boutiques throughout the country.
Many New Yorkers know my work, as my photograph, "Flowing Light", is a 40’ x 25’ painted mural in Times Square, funded by the NYSCA. 
Over the years, I’ve exhibited my photography internationally in museums and galleries and multi-media installations in many public spaces, such as JFK Airport, World Trade Center, and the Port Authority Bus Terminal. 
   What We Need & What You Get 




The basic costs of bringing this product to market are about $10,000.00.
The complicated process of manufacturing clothing calls for many services and
purchases upfront. More cash on hand makes it possible to buy materials and do
production in quantity, lowering the cost of goods sold. Before the first JacCAT™
can be assembled, there are many expenses, such as the design and manufacturing of numerous samples, labels and care tags that go in each jacket. Pattern makers need to grade
the design for sizes, and then highly skilled cutters will turn bolts of fabric
into the pieces that will be sewn together by workers in a factory located in the heart of the NYC garment district.
Once the product exists, marketing requires many other expenses.
Just a few of them are printing and distributing promotional
materials, and reserving spaces at events like CatCon and traveling to work the
shows. And as anyone who produces unique products can tell you, there are also
costs in advance of everything—to trademark, license, and protect original creations.
The difference between success and failure often depends on the size of your
advertising budget. The more cash there is on hand, the greater the potential
for ultimate success. 


    The Impact 



When you support the
JacCAT™ project, you are backing entrepreneurship, work for Americans, an
independent artist/designer, and care for cats without homes—and you’re
facilitating a product that will be attractive to buyers who love cats.
The world is full of
people who adore cats, as the Internet makes clear. The JacCAT™ is my most
recent design in a series of products that appeal to cat lovers everywhere,
which began with the CatWrap™, a sleek bodysuit patented and produced in the
‘90s.
Corporate manufacturers
have deep pockets, but they will make their products cheaply in third world
countries to increase their profit margins, unconcerned about job loss at home.
This project is a small step towards keeping jobs in America, and the creation
of something affordable that combines art and function for an enthusiastic
demographic of Cat Lovers.
I have been making art,
designing, and producing products for over 30 years. As the costs of living,
production, and marketing have escalated in recent years, it has become harder
to implement a project without investor support. Campaigns like this enable
supporters to decide what gets to market, giving donors a chance to affect
consumer options.
   Risks & Challenges  


There are
always risks when you launch a product, although clever marketing and targeting
the right demographics reduce the risks inherent in production. While it may be
harder to wholesale the JacCAT™ to retail stores, which need to triple or
quadruple the price to cover their own operating expenses, the risks are minimized
when using direct marketing through cat conventions, an online store, or
advertising in cat-related publications. The more we can raise for an
advertising campaign, the fewer the risks.   Other Ways You Can Help 

Some of
you might not have money to spare, but you can still make an important
contribution to this campaign! Pass the word along on social media, and tell your cat-loving friends about our project. Word of mouth is really important, and to
everyone who uses the Indiegogo tools to help promote this campaign, thank you
so much!Perks -There are wonderful perks I am offering for your help to manufacture the JacCAT™ and to bring it to market, Since I haven't figured out how to add the images to perk section, I'm giving you a preview of them here.NEW PERK!PRE-PRINTING SPECIALpre-order – your Ari-Gato T-shirtoffer ends Sunday, Sept 18only $20 - save $5New Printing Technique - DISCHARGEDISCHARGE method removes the shirt's dye – leaving it soft.100% black cotton shirtsAvailable in male and female sizes: S, M, L, XLoffer ends Sunday, Sept 18only $20 - save $5_____________________________________________________________________Ari-Gato Tote BagAri+Gato design is printed on both sides of this ECO friendly tote bag. It measures 12" x 13."5 x 7" and holds up to 30 pounds.
_______________________________________________________________
The Love Story of Sushi & Sashimi: A Cat Tale" bookThis book shows SuZen's 2 Siamese cats, Sushi and Sashimi, frolicking in her Greenwich Village studio.  Each cat  tells their experience of how they meet and fell in love. Photographed by SuZen; written by John Daniel, and published by Capra Press,  It's truly a delight for any Cat Lover._______________________________________________________________Cats + Flowers notecards with envelopsCan get 2 cards or the set of six  5" x 7" Cats + Flowers notecards. Siamese cats, Sushi and Sashimi, elegantly posed with flowers on a white background. Notecards are blank inside and come in a box. Photos by SuZen.________________________________________________________________
 T-shirtsReceive a short sleeved T-shirt - either Gato
or Sashimi in a window - available in S, M, L, XL in male and female sizes.Get 2 T-shirts & a FREE autographed"The Love Story of Sushi & Sashimi: A Cat Tale."________________________________________________________________
ARI-GATO Scarf This exquisite scarf of silhouettes of SuZen's black cats, Ari and Gato, is made of 100% silk chiffon, measures 12" x 63 and signed with SuZen's red signature. ___________________________________________________________________sKAT-monoNew to the collection is the sKAT-mono. The sKAT-mono combines the look of a kimono with the diversity of  a scarf.  The bold graphic image of my cat, Gato, is held in place with a hidden button. 100% silk charmeuse, 12" x 60"._______________________________________________________________
JacCAT™ - the Jacket for Cat LoversThis cool, unique jacket of SuZen's bold black cat cutout design is inspired by her cat Ari. It fastens with 3 magnets, made of 100% cotton imported from Japan and is manufactured in the heart of  NYC garment district. Now available in Red+Black.




__________________________________________________________________
Photograph, framed and signed by SuZen11" x 14" and 16" x 20" photo of the cover of The Love Story of Sushi and Sashimi: A Cat Tale,  framed and signed by SuZen.

Visit SuZen in her Greenwich Village studio
Have lunch with SuZen and her cat, Gato in her Westbeth artist studio in the heart of Greenwich Village – and receive a JacCAT™, scarf, and personally signed "The Love Story of Sushi and Sashimi" book. Afterwards, SuZen will take you on a tour of the Westbeth Artist Housing, the Hudson River Park and the HighLine in the Meat Packing district.

story:
How many of us here as ever been to Bwaise?, house flood when it rains, it was worse 5 years back in Nateete a slum where I Nantume Judith grew up from. Our house used to flood every time it rained, we shifted but a single mum with 5 kids would not afford that much so the situation was always the same. I lost friends, changed schools a lot lost places I had become attached to. I always thought I could change this when I grow up but after I joined the Social Innovation Academy, I did research and found out that trenches get blocked with waste but it doesn't stop from there. How of us has ever been to Gayaza Kiteezi landfill? It stinks even before you get off the taxi and its the only landfill we have for Kampala and her neighboring district. It smells so bad and you don't even like to go back but people live just below the landfill, kids are being born from this place, young girls live in this place, expectant mothers. Women have the most percentage of people working in the landfill. I always thought I was uncomfortable while growing up but kids at Kiteezi had a lot more than that, they have poor appetite, get angry easily, are hyperactive of which am a victim my self. They tend to grow slowly than kids their age, are less intelligent.

 

According to a case study done by the Kampala City council Authority, 28,000tons of garbage is collected everyday and taken to the landfill, 40% remains uncollected because its dumped in streams, trenches and areas not accessed by the vehicles. On the garbage collected 2.6% is plastic waste and at the landfill the organic matter is sorted out and sold to the agriculturists leaving it with paper, glass, leather and plastic waste. The study also shows that on the plastic collected 1% is formerly recycled. For every 1kg of plastic burnt, 6kg of CO2 is produced leading to global warming, landfills around the whole world contribute 19% to global warming.

 

Wastics recycling company aim to address this challenge by recycling plastic waste to make plastic lumber that will be made into plastic school desks for the rural secondary government aided schools. Our product is maintenance free, long lasting, unique and has 0 waste. As our target market is the rural secondary schools, we are going to work with organizations that advocate for quality and comfortable education for all to purchase our product for their beneficences.

With a team of three people we hope to achieve our Vision as we are all committed to saving the environment.

We beat our competitors with a unique, durable and maintenance free product. We are also going to re-buy the desks that are broken so they will not be wasted and that makes our product cheaper in the long run. We are also giving our customers a guarantee of 2years.

As our target market is schools, already there are many schools and more are coming up, therefore our market keeps growing.

With a budget of 5499USD we hope to start producing with a locally made machine that will be fabricated in Kasese and obtain other local resources as we look for funds to scale up.

We are not able to start the production and therefore seeking for support to obtain the machine and all other materials as well as partnerships to start the production process

Reach a hand in the building of a conducive learning environment for all.

WASTE…. A GOLD MINE!!

story:
A way to stop making GHGs

Introduction

My name is Larry and Recycling is a huge part of protecting the environment for me and my family, and I have been doing this for almost 15 years. Here's what we do.

  • The old recycle truck we have now, collects recycling going door to door.
  • Then we donate the stuff to a local Recycle Depot...about one ton/week
  • Today we have about 370 subscribers to our Curbside Service in Camrose representing about 3000 residents.
  • Last year we eliminated over 150 Tons of GreenHouse Gases by collecting recycling
  • There is no public transportation and 7259 dwellings in Camrose.

Recently, we learned that France is already doing this in 60 cities and towns.

We want more people to recycle and they say the #1 way to reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions is Reduce, Reuse, Recycle. My campaign is very important to us because it will eliminate even more GHGs produced by waste collection trucks and even more from costly road maintenence. By using Draft Horses to pick-up recycling instead of a truck, it will eliminate more than 14 Tons of GreenHouse Gases annually and get even more people to recycle. The horses are very much like people so, the health and safety of these animals is our highest priority. 

It is a win/win situation!

This is an opportunity for you to help create a cleaner, quieter, more natural environment for us all to live in and reduce our carbon footprint, Let's make a more sustainable, smart way of collecting waste for the world! 

How We Got Started

We came up with this idea in January 2014 and so far, we have invested our own money and bought four Draft Horses. These horses were bred for working and they will work for us in teams of two. They never have to work two days in a row and of course...we have special bags to be hung under their tails so they don't poop on the road. 

Trishaly, our team leader, travelled and trained with Alvin Yoder at the Beginner's Horsemanship School in the Amish Hills of Ohio last year. Countless hours have been poured into practice and training for driver and horses, and we are quite serious about reaching our goal. Trish is with the horses every day! Awesome

What We Still Have to Get

In order to make the transition from an ordinary recycling company to an extraordinary method of collection, we have to invest in some more stuff. We can also do this ourselves, however it would take us years rather than months, without your help. We want to eliminate our GHGs immediately!

A sum of $50,000 is still required to fulfill the rest of our requirements, so that we can collect recycling using Horse and Wagon. These items are;

  1. electric Utility Terrain Vehicle-$10,000
  2. custom light weight wagons (state of the art)-$20,000
  3. horse harness used-$5,000
  4. horse trailer used-$5,000
  5. carriage used-$10,000


Perks and Goodies

Horses, horses, horses!!! We have some pretty cool perks to offer our supporters that are very unique. From an awesome picture of our beautiful Clydesdale Teams, to complete instruction and support to start your own horse drawn recycling business for your own community. If this campaign does not reach our goal, all funds we do get, will go towards the purchase of the equipment. The perks we have will be honored as soon we reach our goal. 


This campaign is so important to us because we have been planning it for some time and we have the persistence and determination to make it happen. We have committed to our goal because our environment has to be sustainable, if we want to be healthy for years to come!  

Every person that we have told about this idea, usually says "that is sooooo cool"! 

We have not had a single negative reaction from our surveys, so we are confident that this is going to work from a business standpoint. We have never been involved with a business idea that has had this kind of public support.

Why this Campaign?

Remember, this campaign is not just about reducing GHG emissions...we are already a recycling company. have operated since 2002, and save over 260 Tons of recycling from ending up in the landfill annually! 

There is not much money made by recyclers yet and I ask you to keep in mind, we know many more people will want to recycle, if they can have their recycling picked up by horse and wagon. GHGs will also be eliminated when fewer people drive their vehicles to the depot with their recycling.

An average vehicle with a 3-litre engine idling for ten minutes burns 300 millilitres (over 1 cup) of fuel and this produces 690 grams of CO2. This may not sound like a lot but remember‚ millions of motorists have fallen into the trap of unnecessary idling. 

About 4.4 Tonnes of GHGs are emitted every 10 minutes when everyone's car is running in Camrose. 

Dennis Gordeyko

Our team member Dennis Gordeyko has a stock of over 150 head of Clydesdale Draft Horses, which we can access directly from the ranch located minutes from Camrose. These animals are very even tempered... they really keep their cool, Percheron Draft Horses are also very similar.  
Dennis Gordeyko is a horse expert and his family has raised Clydesdales for 3 generations. He is not a celebrity...unless your talking to someone in the Clydesdale industry. I feel we are in good hands with Dennis on our team, and the electric Utility Terrain Vehicle will always be available, just in case. 
We know that light horses, who are more prone to spook, are successfully used for handsome cabs in many other cities, like New York. One of our teams was actively driven in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan before we purchased them, and we feel confident that we can operate this way safely and efficiently.

Risks & Challenges

We have endured many ups and downs since 2009 when we took over the business. The work that our horses will do is light because the type of recycling we collect is very bulky, not heavy, and we avoid the main roads. The horses will move slowly with many stops and starts, on quiet streets and in alleys. We do not foresee any problems with the workload for these mighty Clydesdales, who traditionally hauled milk wagons, that were very heavy. The switch to using Horse and Wagon will not be a disruptive change for us however, horses are not machines. Like a truck can have breakdowns, horses can have problems too.

Alberta's Economy

The downturn in our economy has affected Albertans dramatically and a lot of folks really fear loosing their jobs. Most of our family, friends and subscribers are employed directly or indirectly by the Oil and Gas Industry and although we have their support, many are not able to really help us financially. There are also many people that are finding it difficult to accept this new era of sustainability that we are entering.

Global funding

Trishaly is a member of the empower network and she has the training and tools to help get this idea to other areas of the world. Larry is working with her to get the word out.

If you too think this is a cool idea, please, share this campaign with people you know who are environmentally conscious. 
By the way dudes, the ladies love the horses.

Thank-you!

Edmonton Journal and Edmonton Sun Newspaper Article

story:
Why the world needs the Mauli Ola Festival

When it comes to coffee, agriculture, and our relationship with the earth, it's easy to become disconnected. It's easy to not remember the people who farm that coffee, to not worry about whether they are treated well or paid fairly. It's easy to forget that our actions - and our inaction - have an impact on the earth and our communities.

The Mauli Ola Festival is about reconnecting with those values. We will bring together a global tribe to celebrate, teach and start new dialogues about many aspects of the world around us. So far the festival will include: 

  • Coffee and Human Rights Circle -

    Prominent presenters Sunalini Menon of CoffeeLab, Sarah Allen of Barista Magazine, Sarah Grant of USC Fullerton, and more will be sharing their work in the nuts and bolts of women's empowerment, economic empowerment and other aspects of human rights in coffee. Using the framework developed by Monica Sharma, senior staff at the United Nations, to develop Leadership for Community Transformation, participants will relate the conversation at the event with their own projects and passions at home.

  • Land-Based Skill Workshops - Learn about permaculture, natural building, Leave No Trace ethics, fermented foods, biodiesel and more. 
  • Traditional Ceremonies - We will have a Sufi Coffee Ceremony celebrated at the festival.
  • Live music and dance - A great program of musicians is in store, including Malian, Grammy nominated Senegalese West African Kora player Youssoupha Sidibe, Hawai`ian music from Jeff Peterson, a Brazilian zouk workshop and performance by Marie Alonzo Snyder and more!
  • Great food (and of course, award-winning ethical coffee!) available from local vendors

What we're trying to accomplish. 

Everybody feels like the world is going crazy and it is time to return to basic goodness and a sense of human decency.

We have to start with nature when we want to build a future that is sustainable, whether it’s human nature or the weather or the earth.

Remember how precious and valuable joy and laughter are?

Our festival team is working to establish a sacred global culture of peace, harmony, love, and happiness for all.

Mauli Ola Festival is a joyful festival celebrating ecology, healing energy, the arts – and of course, farming. Earth-based wisdom keepers, builders, healers and leaders like Youssoupha Sidibe, Holly Baade, Bonzai Holmes, Jasmine Silverstein, Molly Masaoka, Momi Aiu, and Adam Junod will come together and co-create an expression of collective artistry and beauty.

Thank you so very much for coming to the rescue of all that makes life beautiful!  

A portion of the festival's profits will be donated to I Ola Na Aina Momona and the Black Hills Unity Concert. 

 

Why Pahala?

Pahala is right in the middle of Hawai'i Island's Ka`u District.  Ka`u is home to the newest coffee growing region on the island.  Between 2007 and 2012, Ka`u coffee farmers won eight individual Coffee of the Year Awards from the SCAA.  Widely recognized for quality, Ka`u coffee was first planted by sugar workers left without livelihoods when the sugar plantation closed down in 1997.  In the last twenty years, these amazing people have invested their capital, their labor and their hearts in this land and in the coffee they produce.  A selection of small lot coffees from these farmers will be just one of the many delights to experience at the Mauli Ola Festival.

Our Coffee and Human Rights Circle will give needed attention to the coffee industry.  More and more cafe owners, importers and growers are developing relationships and conversations about improving human rights in coffee.

Our Coffee and Human Rights Circle intends to ground these heroic efforts in a conversation about structural change, that will institutionalize this commitment to human rights as an enduring shift in the way the world works.

 

Risks & Challenges

Here are some of our key challenges:

Bandwidth: As this is the first year of our festival, our biggest investment will be people's time. We will invest the proceeds from our funding to pay the festival organizers, to set up the infrastructure of the event and to help offset the costs of lodging for our speakers. 

Recognition: As a new festival, one of our biggest objectives will be to educate the public about what we are doing and to get our name out there. Being funded will certainly help, as we will need to advertise in addition to our PR media outreach. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute today, please help us out any way you can. For example, you could help us out by... 

  • Sharing this page on Facebook using the share tools on Indiegogo
  • Email a link to this page to your family and friends! 

Thank you very much for your support. Mahalo and Aloha!
story_txt:
Why the world needs the Mauli Ola Festival
When it comes to coffee, agriculture, and our relationship with the earth, it's easy to become disconnected. It's easy to not remember the people who farm that coffee, to not worry about whether they are treated well or paid fairly. It's easy to forget that our actions - and our inaction - have an impact on the earth and our communities.
The Mauli Ola Festival is about reconnecting with those values. We will bring together a global tribe to celebrate, teach and start new dialogues about many aspects of the world around us. So far the festival will include: 


Coffee and Human Rights Circle -Prominent presenters Sunalini Menon of CoffeeLab, Sarah Allen of Barista Magazine, Sarah Grant of USC Fullerton, and more will be sharing their work in the nuts and bolts of women's empowerment, economic empowerment and other aspects of human rights in coffee. Using the framework developed by Monica Sharma, senior staff at the United Nations, to develop Leadership for Community Transformation, participants will relate the conversation at the event with their own projects and passions at home.


Land-Based Skill Workshops - Learn about permaculture, natural building, Leave No Trace ethics, fermented foods, biodiesel and more. 

Traditional Ceremonies - We will have a Sufi Coffee Ceremony celebrated at the festival.

Live music and dance - A great program of musicians is in store, including Malian, Grammy nominated Senegalese West African Kora player Youssoupha Sidibe, Hawai`ian music from Jeff Peterson, a Brazilian zouk workshop and performance by Marie Alonzo Snyder and more!

Great food (and of course, award-winning ethical coffee!) available from local vendors


What we're trying to accomplish. 
Everybody feels like the world is going crazy and it is time to return to basic goodness and a sense of human decency.
We have to start with nature when we want to build a future that is sustainable, whether it’s human nature or the weather or the earth.
Remember how precious and valuable joy and laughter are?
Our festival team is working to establish a sacred global culture of peace, harmony, love, and happiness for all.
Mauli Ola Festival is a joyful festival celebrating ecology, healing energy, the arts – and of course, farming. Earth-based wisdom keepers, builders, healers and leaders like Youssoupha Sidibe, Holly Baade, Bonzai Holmes, Jasmine Silverstein, Molly Masaoka, Momi Aiu, and Adam Junod will come together and co-create an expression of collective artistry and beauty.
Thank you so very much for coming to the rescue of all that makes life beautiful!  
A portion of the festival's profits will be donated to I Ola Na Aina Momona and the Black Hills Unity Concert. 
 
Why Pahala?
Pahala is right in the middle of Hawai'i Island's Ka`u District.  Ka`u is home to the newest coffee growing region on the island.  Between 2007 and 2012, Ka`u coffee farmers won eight individual Coffee of the Year Awards from the SCAA.  Widely recognized for quality, Ka`u coffee was first planted by sugar workers left without livelihoods when the sugar plantation closed down in 1997.  In the last twenty years, these amazing people have invested their capital, their labor and their hearts in this land and in the coffee they produce.  A selection of small lot coffees from these farmers will be just one of the many delights to experience at the Mauli Ola Festival.
Our Coffee and Human Rights Circle will give needed attention to the coffee industry.  More and more cafe owners, importers and growers are developing relationships and conversations about improving human rights in coffee.
Our Coffee and Human Rights Circle intends to ground these heroic efforts in a conversation about structural change, that will institutionalize this commitment to human rights as an enduring shift in the way the world works.
 
Risks & Challenges
Here are some of our key challenges:
Bandwidth: As this is the first year of our festival, our biggest investment will be people's time. We will invest the proceeds from our funding to pay the festival organizers, to set up the infrastructure of the event and to help offset the costs of lodging for our speakers. 
Recognition: As a new festival, one of our biggest objectives will be to educate the public about what we are doing and to get our name out there. Being funded will certainly help, as we will need to advertise in addition to our PR media outreach. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute today, please help us out any way you can. For example, you could help us out by... 

Sharing this page on Facebook using the share tools on Indiegogo
Email a link to this page to your family and friends! 

Thank you very much for your support. Mahalo and Aloha!

story:
A Solar Manufacturer Doing Good in MN

Saga Solar is Minnesota's newest solar manufacturer. We are a Public Benefit Corporation committed to social responsibility and the adoption of carbon-free energy solutions.

We wake up every day thinking about how we can use solar to make a positive impact. It is literally in our business plan.


How Your Funds Will Help

The first $50,000: Enable Us to Hire Disabled Workers

The first portion of our funding would go directly towards refitting our manufacturing line to be completely accessible, so we can hire disabled workers. This would entail lift assist equipment for solar panels, wheelchair ramps and platforms at workstations, slide stations to accommodate proper ergonomics during the manufacturing process, and other specialized equipment. As a veteran and former Registered Nurse, our founder R. Marie Zola has a great deal of passion for building a welcoming and accessible work environment.

$50,000+:  Produce Panels for Low-Income Housing in MN

If we exceed our initial funding goal of $50,000, we will produce and donate panels to low-income households within Minnesota. To facilitate this we’ve partnered with RREAL, a nonprofit solar installer, to complete projects throughout Minnesota in coordination with various local community and state grant programs.

RREAL, the Rural Renewable Energy Alliance, was founded in 2000, to solve fuel poverty with solar energy, balancing the use of advanced technology with the interests of our environment while bringing lasting independence, economic and social change to communities. RREAL is a 501(c)(3), tax-exempt nonprofit organization that has been delivering solar energy to low-income individuals and communities since inception

Partnering with RREAL not only helps our mission of furthering solar adoption in Minnesota, it prevents low-income families from having to pay for the skyrocketing cost of energy.  We plan to actively pursue philanthropic projects such as these, and with partners such as RREAL for the life of our company. Said a different way: We're in this for the long haul, and like many of our partners we truly believe that solar and renewable energy can be a vehicle to address poverty in Minnesota, America and the planet we all share. 

Timeline and Progress

Our manufacturing line is already completely built, UL certified and Made in Minnesota approved. Our material and parts sources are completely secured. We plan to start producing panels in the Spring/Summer of 2016.  We are excited to take our venture to the next level by doing good, while also making something good.


What Gives our Company an Edge?

Dependability

Our product carries the most secure, bankable warranty of any Minnesota manufacturer. Every panel sold includes our triple-backed warranty:

  • 12-year product warranty to cover workmanship and product quality
  • 25-year linear performance warranty with no sharp declines
  • Added 3rd-party protection, so you're covered no matter what

Financial Incentives

As an approved "Made in Minnesota" solar manufacturer, we will be able to offer Minnesotan consumers amazing financial incentives to use our Minnesota-produced panels.  

Industry Standards

Our industry-standard design works well with countless applications.  The Minnesota-made market, in particular, has a surprising amount of panels that do not comply with industry standards. All of our panels can easily utilize standard racking, wiring and inverters. 

Owned by Everyday Minnesotans

Unlike our local competition, Saga is owned by its employees, not rich investment firms or hedge funds. We are proudly majority woman-owned—extremely rare in the manufacturing world. We care about advancing solar in Minnesota and helping our community, because it is OUR community.


How We're Limiting Risks

Our staff are solar industry veterans with a total of 20+ years combined experience. We've learned—the hard way–which aspects of solar manufacturing is risky. We've taken great lengths to mitigate those risks with Saga.

Sourcing

We are working with major, financially backed global partners well-known for their dependability. We love our partners and trust them implicitly, but we've still laid a deep system of checks and balances. Our staff has been through the ringer with bad solar partnerships. That's why we've been careful to diversify our sourcing. We want to make sure that the end consumer is never left in the lurch. 

Cashflow

Creating solar panels is a cash-intensive process. Installers—particularly small, local installers—don't always have the funds to pay for everything upfront. As a manufacturer, we can't assume that risk for them. We've eliminated that concern altogether by partnering with a solar finance company that will finance all of our commercial sales upfront. Once the panel is sold, the capital is secured.

On-Time Delivery

Delivering product on-time is a huge problem in the solar industry. Part of the issue is that installers don't want to ask for product until they're sure they have available capital. With our financing, they are no longer incentivized to wait. On the manufacturing side, our diversified sourcing will prevent problematic delays. We also provide permitting and project management assistance. Installers appreciate the assistance, and we stay apprised of any potential road bumps.


What's in it for you?

Perk Levels 

$5 -  Website Credit
We will list your name on the website as a lover of a solar company looking out for the public benefit.

$10 – We Will Write You a Saga
We will show how grateful we are by listing your name on our website, along with a twitter shout-out, and a Thank You card signed by the entire Saga Solar team.

$15 – Window Cling + All of the Above
Same benefits as above, plus a solar-themed window cling so you can show off your appreciation for grassroots-supported solar energy. 

$25 – "Got Sun? Go Solar" Book + All of the Above
Same benefits as above, plus a copy of “Got Sun? Go Solar”. From industry veteran and pioneer, Doug Pratt.  This educational book documents the early years of solar technical development, understanding the technology as it exist now, and the ways solar can work for you now and in the future.


$40 – Travel Mug + All of the Above
Same benefits as above, plus a handy beverage Saga-themed travel mug. Show your support for the public benefit solar industry in more ways than one! Keep it hot if it’s hot (and solar is hot), and cold if it’s cold. 


$75 – Ringer T-shirt + All of the Above
Same benefits as above, plus a comfy ringer T-shirt to proudly wear in your support for solar. Retro style wear is as fashionable as it is cool, and is just one more way to show that you value solar as a part of our energy future.

$250 – Battery Charging Kit
Same benefits as above, plus a Saga 50 watt 12V battery charging kit (battery not included). In the event of an emergency, having a simple, easy to set up way to keep your electronics charged so you can stay informed is a must-have for your emergency kit. This kit comes with a 50 watt solar panel, charge controller, wire, mounting hardware, and 100w AC inverter. Simply choose a 12v battery (purchase locally) that is sized appropriately for your needs and budget, and make the wire connections to start harvesting the sun. How-to directions and battery selection guide are included.

$1,000 – 2 Saga Solar Panels
2 x Saga Solar "Made in Minnesota" 280 Watt Solar Panels shipped to your door. Original MSRP of $1,092.00

$1,900 – 4 Saga Solar Panels
4 x Saga Solar "Made in Minnesota" 280 Watt Panels shipped to your door.  Original MSRP - $2,184.00

$4,500 – 8 Saga Solar Panels + Solar Edge Inverter
The perfect package for a small residential install - 8 x Saga Solar "Made in Minnesota" 280 Watt Panels and a Solar Edge 3kW inverter with Power Optimizers. Original MSRP - $5,930.00

$8,500 – 16 Saga Solar Panels + Solar Edge Inverter
The perfect package for a typical residential install - 16 x Saga Solar "Made in Minnesota" 280 Watt Panels, and a Solar Edge 5kW inverter with Power Optimizers. Original MSRP - $11,493.00

$15,000 – 32 Saga Solar Panels + Solar Edge Inverter
The perfect package for a larger residential install - 32 x Saga Solar "Made in Minnesota" 280 Watt Panels,  and a Solar Edge 10kW inverter with Power Optimizers. Original MSRP - $21,485.00

$25,000 – Northern Minnesota Getaway
One of a kind get-away to beautiful Northern Minnesota.  Perk includes a flight for 2 to the Twin Cities from anywhere in the Continental US.  Meet and have dinner with the Saga team in Historic Downtown St Paul and stay at the luxurious St Paul Hotel for 1 night.  Then drive north out of the city and enjoy a relaxing 5 day, 4 night stay on beautiful Lake Superior along the North Shore. Perk includes rental car, airfare and hotel/lodge accommodations.

story:
Why using WUNMIXER?

If you visit a solid waste landfill, you will have a perspective of the amount of products we consumed daily; it is even more outrageous to imagine the abundant amount of components and materials that are wasted and destroyed. Our vision consisted to optimize the potential of raw material that are consumed and how it can be reintegrated in the production cycle of manufacturing. If we consider the whole production cycle: the energy involved in the extraction of the virgin materials, the processing of these materials, manufacturing and transportation, would imply that the renewable energy invested in these materials is destroyed in an incinerator or deposited in a landfill, ultimately going to waste. Recycled materials, on the other hand, will prevent energy consumption done in the extraction of virgin materials, transportation, and processing. Re-using materials, eliminates the need for re-manufacture, saves the use of energy, and reduces the costs of products manufactured with these recovered materials.


The problem:

There are two commercial ways to recycle materials, which are separated and classified from homes, and those that are mixed in garbage bags, these waste are carried to separation and treatment plants, the separation is executed manually (completed by people) or mechanically (completed by machines), these method do not achieve a high percentage of classification for recycling, so these are intended for final disposal, which can be in a landfill or incinerators to take advantage of the calorific content of electricity, electricity that is necessary and highly demanded, but these incinerators generate CO, acid gases, SO2, which are sent to our air, and create toxic waste ash.



About our project:

We are working on manufacturing a technology able to separate with 99% efficiency inorganic materials of mixed municipal solid waste applying electrostatic properties of the materials. Materials to be recycled are paper, glass, plastic, and non-ferrous metals. As a result, it will allow to recover 70% of municipal solid waste generated in your city, leaving 30% for final disposal. Opposed to other methods, this machine guarantees efficient separation of waste in the same process, classifying the product, and minimizing the physical space for management waste separation in less time, giving us higher production of efficiency.


What will be done with the money?

The money collected will be used for the construction of the prototype. Our design is ready and patented provisionally, we want your help to develop this project. Our company GEARS INC in conjunction with 3 Mechanical Engineering students of FIU are manufacturing the prototype for future marketing.


Who is WUNMIXER for?

WUNMIXER is designed to be operated in: counties, municipalities, recyclers and recycling companies. WUNMIXER can be used anywhere in the world, the objective is to separate waste before they are sent for final disposal.


How does  WUNMIXER works?

 WUNMIXER is a machine able to separate the mixed municipal solid waste, in the first phase it separates plastic, glass, paper and non-ferrous metals. This measure the electrostatic charge of each of the materials and possible separation, separated and classified by their chemical composition. We created four magnets, one for separating glass, one for separating plastic, another to separate paper, and one for separating nonferrous metals through a grinding process, sanitation, drying and then entering the WUNMIXER to be separated.
